Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Welcome to Alf!

Hi there! We are Alf – a newly formed tech company within Länsförsäkringar Alliance. With a client base of more than 1,8 million households, Länsförsäkringar is one of Sweden’s biggest financial groups. Alf is on a mission to create a secure and sustainable way of living by adding cutting-edge IoT tech to 200+ years of experience from helping customers taking care of their homes.

About The Job.

As our first Analytics Engineer, you’ll be contributing across multiple teams. Your primary focus will be designing and implementing data models for Alf's data platform.

Key responsibilities include:


Designing and implementing data models in our cloud-based data platform, which underpins essential use cases such as BI reporting, product analytics, and customer-facing analytics.
Supporting development teams to implement analytics-ready data points in products.
Enabling self-service analytics by maintaining and optimizing the semantic layer.
Building reports and dashboards to track key business metrics.


In this early-stage role, you’ll be our first Analytics engineer, working alongside talented individuals and receiving significant support from Head of Data & Analytics. Together, we’re on a mission to transform the insurance industry—we need to capture and measure this transformation through data.

About You.

You have an academic background in fields like computer engineering, mathematics, or a similar area and have developed your skills as an analytics engineer, data engineer, or data analyst. You’re proficient in SQL and dbt and have preferably some experience working with cloud-based data platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake, or similar services (Azure Databricks is a plus, but not required). Solid skills in programming with Python and familiarity with orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow is also an advantage.

Key strengths include:


Excellent communication skills, enabling you to act as a bridge between tech and product teams for designing analytics solutions.
A passion for driving analytics use cases from start to finish, from identifying needs to creating effective visualizations.
Attention to detail, ensuring data models are robust, accurate, and impactful.
Above all, you’re passionate about understanding our business and products, bringing a data-driven mindset to help Alf make informed decisions and succeed.


Additional skills, such as knowledge of infrastructure-as-code frameworks like Terraform and experience with tools like Google Analytics for tracking app and web performance, are also a bonus.

About Alf.

Länsförsäkringar embodies more than 200 years of dedication to create safety for our customers. With Alf, all that experience is being combined with innovative technology to cater the current needs of our clients. It’s a full-service solution providing personalized insights, advice and content, which enables the users to proactively take care of and protect their homes. With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, safety and sustainability go hand in hand.

Alf is operated by Länsförsäkringar Trygghetstjänster AB, a company owned by Länsförsäkringar Alliance. This provides a unique opportunity to become part of an engaged and fun team at an innovative tech company, characterised by the agile and dynamic essence of a startup, all while being supported by the stability and strength of Länsförsäkringar Alliance.

With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, you will get:

🏡 Work-life balance through a hybrid model

🏢 Centrally located office in Stockholm

🤝 Collective agreement including pension and insurance coverage

🏃 Wellness allowance

💸 Special banking perks

🚀…and more but let us dive more into that when we meet in person!

How to apply.

Apply by sending us your CV in Swedish or English. Our selection process is continuous, and we may move forward with candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Dataingenjör – Bli en del av ett nytt kapitel i Sveriges datarevolution

Föreställ dig detta: Du går med i ett team med en dokumenterad framgångshistoria, inte bara inom att leverera innovativa lösningar utan också inom att forma en hel marknad. Efter år av oöverträffad framgång i Norge—där de samarbetat med några av regionens mest välkända organisationer—har vår kund nu riktat sin blick mot Sverige, med Stockholm i centrum för denna djärva nya expansion.




Det här är inget vanligt företag. I över ett decennium har de varit experterna att vända sig till för att utnyttja data och låsa upp affärspotential. Deras arbete har hjälpt statliga organisationer, globala företag och startups att fatta smartare och snabbare beslut med hjälp av banbrytande AI-, moln- och analyslösningar. Nu är deras mål att replikera denna framgång i Sverige och etablera sig som Nordens ledande aktör inom datainsikter senast 2026.

Detta är din chans att bli en grundläggande del av den historien.




Rollen: Bygg ryggraden för Sveriges framtid inom data

Som Dataingenjör kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att designa och leverera skalbara datalösningar för en varierad portfölj av kunder. Ditt arbete kommer direkt att påverka branscher som sträcker sig från sjukvård till finans och säkerställa att de har verktygen att blomstra i en alltmer datadriven värld.




Du kommer att samarbeta med ett skickligt team av dataforskare, arkitekter och ingenjörer för att skapa pipelines som bearbetar och omvandlar stora mängder data till användbara insikter. Från att integrera komplexa datamängder till att optimera molnbaserade lösningar kommer du att stå i spetsen för Sveriges datarevolution.




Dina arbetsuppgifter:

Designa och bygga datapipelines som hanterar olika datakällor och säkerställer noggrannhet, tillförlitlighet och skalbarhet.
Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att förstå affärsbehov och omvandla dem till tekniska lösningar.
Arbeta med molnplattformar som Azure, AWS eller GCP för att implementera banbrytande datainfrastrukturer.
Ständigt förbättra systemen genom att identifiera flaskhalsar och hitta smartare sätt att hantera data.
Leda bästa praxis för datahantering, från automatisering till kvalitetssäkring.




Vad du tar med dig:

En stark grund inom datahantering, med erfarenhet av att bygga skalbara och högpresterande pipelines.
Färdighet i verktyg som Python, SQL, Spark eller Kafka.
Erfarenhet av molntjänster (AWS, Azure eller GCP) och moderna datalager.
En entusiasm för att lösa komplexa problem och leverera lösningar som gör verklig skillnad.
En samarbetsvillig inställning och utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor för att arbeta med både tekniska och icke-tekniska team.




Varför ansluta dig nu?

Du söker inte bara ett jobb—du blir en del av en mission. Vår kunds expansion till Sverige är ambitiös, och de har all avsikt att lyckas med samma principer som gjort dem framgångsrika i Norge: att investera i människor, främja innovation och leverera resultat som talar för sig själva.




Det här är vad du får:

En konkurrenskraftig lön, anpassad efter din erfarenhet, upp till 80 000 SEK per månad.
Certifieringsbonusar och avsatt tid under arbetsveckan för att aktivt stödja din professionella utveckling.
Tillgång till Thursday Innovation Days, där du får experimentera, lära dig och utveckla nya färdigheter.
Möjligheten att resa och knyta kontakt med ett livfullt nätverk av likasinnade yrkespersoner i Norden.




Det här är mer än bara en roll—det är en möjlighet att bli en del av något större. Du kommer inte bara att utveckla din karriär utan också hjälpa till att forma en ny era för datahantering i Sverige.

Är du redo att göra avtryck?




Ansök idag och ta det första steget mot att bli en del av denna nordiska framgångssaga.

  • Möjligheten att resa och knyta kontakt med ett livfullt nätverk av likasinnade yrkespersoner i Norden.


Det här är mer än bara en roll—det är en möjlighet att bli en del av något större. Du kommer inte bara att utveckla din karriär utan också hjälpa till att forma en ny era för datahantering i Sverige.

Är du redo att göra avtryck?


Ansök idag och ta det första steget mot att bli en del av denna nordiska framgångssaga.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re a cutting-edge tech-enabled bank on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses across 7 markets in northern Europe. Our innovative solutions aim to simplify access to financing and enable growth for small businesses. As we scale, we are now looking for a Data Engineer to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.




About the role

This is a role where you will be playing a significant role in designing, implementing, iterating, and improving the data lake and data warehouse in our company. Your daily responsibilities will include the data preparation for different consumers, including Data Scientists, Software Engineers and Business & Data Analysts, and help them find the data they need. Nowadays, our technical stack consists of Python, AWS, Redshift, Postgres, Java and node.js.




Key Responsibilities

Design and optimize efficient data pipelines for seamless integration and processing across diverse data sources
Oversee and manage data warehouses and lakes to ensure reliable storage, processing, and accessibility
Collaborate with stakeholders to transform business objectives into analytics-ready data models using tools like dbt
Implement comprehensive testing frameworks, maintain high data quality standards, and ensure security-compliant metadata with clear data lineage and catalog systems for effective governance
Strengthen infrastructure using IaC tools like CDK and CloudFormation




Requirements

Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, building and orchestrating data pipelines, pref aws glue, aws lambda and aws step functions
Fluent in Python, SQL and/or other relevant languages
Experience with relational database, schema design and dimensional data modeling
Solid knowledge of cloud based platforms, preferably AWS
Hands-on experience with big data storage concepts such as Redshift, Snowflake or Big Query
Understanding of data platform architecture and concepts, including data ingestion, data lakes, and data lakehouses




Experiences that make you stand out from the rest:

Experience with event-driven architecture in the cloud
Experience in working with git/version control and in a ci/cd environment
Big plus if you have some experience with machine learning projects and building data science infrastructure
Understanding of microservices and APIs
Prior experience in the financial industry is an advantage
Experience with tools for Data Governance, such as DataHub or OpenMetaData




Why join us?

This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, and be a part of creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.




One last thing

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.




Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

Title: Informationsarkitekt - Data & Analytics
Description:
Arbetsuppgifter


Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance


Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. På så sätt blir din drivkraft utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och för oss. Låter det bra? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Informationsarkitekt

Som Informationsarkitekt hos Data & Analytics kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att bygga och förädla den grund som vår data- och informationshantering vilar på. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi organiserar och strukturerar vår information, vilket är avgörande för vår förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut och skapa värde för våra kunder. Genom att utveckla avancerade begrepps-, informations- och datamodeller, samt leda workshops och analyser, kommer du att säkerställa att vi har en tydlig och effektiv informationsstruktur. Ditt arbete med att skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt ansvara för masterdata och relaterade processer kommer att vara centralt för vår Data & analytics-avdelning. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:


Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.


Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Vänligen notera att återkoppling kan ta längre tid än vanligt under jul- och nyårsledigheter.

Har du check på allt?


Analytisk
Helhetsperspektiv
Initiativtagande
Kommunikativ
Strukturerad


Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.
Show more

  • Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
  • Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
  • Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance

Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About us:

At Leya, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.

You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.

The role:

Are you passionate about AI and eager to work on groundbreaking projects? Do you want to be a part of a rock-star team in a promising startup, collaborate with industry leaders and make a real impact in the legal landscape? Here's your chance!

What you will be doing:


Architect and implement features and improvements across our data pipelines
Monitor and ensure data freshness and health across many different sources
Take ownership of our data pipelines and data warehouse, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
Helping break down tasks and ensure their effective execution
Work with some of the latest technologies and some of the smartest engineers in the industry
Be challenged and grow very quickly as a developer


Who you are:


Skilled: You have a proven track record of developing reliable data pipelines and you are not afraid of responsibility for important and mission-critical software.
Innovative: You thrive in a dynamic start-up environment where problems don’t always have obvious or easy solutions. You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about data and architecture. You are curious and passionate about writing good software, and you’re ambitious about learning and improving yourself as an engineer.
Autonomous: Although constantly working in a team we believe in self leadership and ownership! You value feedback, take initiative without needing direction, and focus on outcomes. You are not afraid to try new things and learn from your mistakes rather than play it safe.
Entrepreneurial: Leya is an ambitious start-up. Things move fast, tasks and challenges may be demanding, and responsibilities may change over time. But you’ll get to work with a team of brilliant and dedicated people that are all working to solve difficult problems and really change how legal work is done.


Preferred qualifications:


2+ years writing data pipelines with Python, SQL and some modern orchestration tool
Dagster (Prefect, Airflow or similar also ok)
Python
SQL


Additional experience that’s a plus:


IaC (Pulumi or Terraform)
CI/CD pipelines
Azure
Elasticsearch
Kubernetes


What’s in it for you:


Competitive base salary
Generous stock option program
30 vacation days
5000 SEK in Wellness contribution
Pension scheme comparable to ITP1
An office in the central parts of Stockholm


We founded Leya with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.

We didn't build Leya for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our innovative team to create scalable, robust, and cutting-edge data infrastructure solutions. With your technical expertise and experience of the digital media ecosystem, you will play an important role in shaping the future of data-driven decision-making and transforming the way we approach media and analytics.




Do you want to grow within the world of data at Sweden's leading media agency group? We are now seeking a Data Engineer to join our talented team. The role involves both project management for executing advanced data, reporting and infrastructure solutions, as well as helping us build the foundation to embrace the advances made within AI.







About Annalect

Annalect is the Nordic regions leader in advanced decision-making systems within marketing and a global specialist unit for technology, data, and analytics. As part of Omnicom Media Group - a network of media, performance, and creative agencies - Annalect has been driving data-driven strategies and advanced analytics within the group since 2016. In the Nordics, we work closely with the group’s media agencies, supporting data-driven media planning and execution. We specialize in collecting, analysing, and leveraging data to provide our clients with insights and strategies aimed at optimizing marketing campaigns and achieving their business objectives. We are a strong team of 30 employees in Sweden and around 100 in the Nordics.







About the Role

As a Data Engineer, you will develop and maintain data analytics and reporting solutions that drive informed decision-making. Collaborating closely with advertisers and client teams, you will gather and translate data requirements into scalable models, build efficient data pipelines, and deliver impactful reports.




In this role, you will design and implement systems that enable seamless data integration, transformation, and accessibility across the organization. Partnering with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Analysts, you will create pipelines that support advanced analytics and AI-powered initiatives.




This is an exciting opportunity to work on complex data projects, shape data strategy, and foster a data-driven culture among our clients. As we embrace the rapid advancements in AI, this role is pivotal in shaping the future of marketing and innovation.







Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain data models, ETL processes, and data pipelines
Build and maintain data extraction scripts in Python from public and private APIs
Create visually compelling and interactive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations
Optimize BI solutions for performance and scalability, ensuring timely access to data for end-users
Perform data quality assessments and implement data governance best practices to maintain data accuracy and consistency
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business goals and align BI solutions with strategic objectives
Ensure compliance with data security and privacy regulations in all BI solutions
Play a critical role in scaling AI initiatives, ensuring the seamless integration of advanced models into real-world media applications







Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems or a related field
A strong understanding of the digital media ecosystem and the data infrastructure attached to it
A minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist, or Analytics Engineer
High proficiency in Python for data manipulation and automation
Experience with orchestration tools like Apache Airflow or similar
Proficiency in BI tools such as PowerBI, Looker Studio, or Tableau and the ability to create visually appealing reports and dashboards
Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis
Experience with ETL processes and building data models
Familiarity with data visualization best practices and data storytelling
Proficient in English reading and writing




As a person, we believe you are a curious individual who, like us, loves data and analytics. You demonstrate strong personal leadership and are happy to share your knowledge with the rest of the team. You enjoy interacting with clients and are genuinely interested in solving our clients' challenges within media and marketing.







We Offer You




A challenging role within one of Sweden’s leading media agency groups
The opportunity to work at the intersection of data, media, and AI in a forward-thinking organization
After-work events, conferences, training sessions, and fun activities to connect with colleagues as both coworkers and friends
Attractive benefits, including a pension plan and insurance, health and wellness allowance, and access to the benefit portal Benify
A 37.5-hour work week with flexible office arrangements
A centrally located office in Katarinahuset, by Slussen in Södermalm




We hope you want to join our team and look forward to getting to know you better. Interviews are conducted on a continuous basis, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. For questions about the role, feel free to contact;




David Rindelöv, Managing Director, david.rindelov@annalect.com

Daniel Hussam, Data & BI Lead, daniel.hussam@annalect.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Data Engineer

Company: BluEdge

Max Price Rate: Open bid

Location: Solna (SE)

Start Date: 02 Dec 2024

End Date (renewable): 30 Jun 2025

The company is seeking a motivated and skilled Data Engineer/BI Developer to join their team. In this role, you will be responsible for building the company’s data platform using various data sources and cutting-edge technology. Working within an agile team, you will play a key role in fostering a data-driven culture and enabling data-based decision-making.

Responsibilities:


Conduct BI development in a modern cloud environment
Design and model databases
Perform requirements analysis
Develop new features and maintain existing ones
Collaborate with other development teams and business functions to understand data needs and deliver solutions


Offered:


Opportunity to work with the latest technology
Collaboration with a deeply knowledgeable data team in an agile environment
Employment with a sustainable company that is integral to the Scandinavian business community
Engagement in transformative and innovation-driven challenges


Requirements


3-5 years of experience in Data Engineering and/or BI development
Proficiency in Data Modeling (e.g., Kimball or similar)
Strong experience with SQL
A keen interest in Data Engineering and Business Intelligence
Post-secondary education in systems science, computer engineering, or related field
Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English
Experience working in a cloud environment


Desirable Skills:


Experience working in agile teams
Familiarity with Microsoft Cloud Platform or Google Cloud Platform
Knowledge of data integrations
Proficiency with visualization tools such as Looker or Power BI


Personal Qualities:


Team player
Outgoing
Problem-solving
Analytical skills
Structured
Curious


Required Skills:


Cloud environment
Power BI
SQL
Kimball


Languages:


Swedish (Proficient)
English (Proficient)


Benefits

PayExpress:

The company now offers a fast and efficient payment solution, so you can avoid long waiting times. With us, you will receive your payment within 3-5 days after your timesheet has been approved. This benefit is included as a standard in nearly all our contracts with no extra work from your side.

Title: Insights Lead to Shared Products and Platforms
Description:
About us

In SPP we’re passionate about creating editorial tools that empower our newsrooms to produce great media content! We are now looking for a dedicated and experienced Insights Lead to join our team - maybe that is you?

Shared Products & Platforms (SPP) offers a powerful suite of tools for newsrooms and journalists within Schibsted Media and for our external partners. SPP supports the entire editorial process with advanced tools, enhancing content distribution by leveraging new technologies. From planning and discovery to creation and personalized recommendations in text, video, and sound - SPP meets the needs of modern media operations.

We have a strong need for data-driven product development and decision-making, where you will play a key role in enhancing our analytics to deliver valuable insights. As an Insights Lead, you will shape data-driven strategies, optimize decision-making processes, and integrate insights to support product development within SPP.

Role Description

In this role, you will enhance our analytics capabilities, support the development of data products, and ensure advanced product analytics solutions are implemented across our product portfolio. You will manage and develop a team of in total four Data Analysts and Data Engineers, fostering collaboration and alignment with both current and future data needs.

Key Responsibilities


Lead and Develop a Team of Data Professionals: Foster collaboration, trust, and a supportive culture that values diverse perspectives. Manage day-to-day operations while mentoring team members to grow both professionally and personally, promoting communication and shared success
Lead Data Product Development: Assist in packaging and delivering data products (articles, videos, podcasts, etc.) and support teams in identifying data requirements early in product development.
Data Analytics Strategy:Recommend the right tools, implement and manage product analytics solutions for the CMS, guide teams on metrics and tracking, and support dashboard setup and user behaviour/usage analysis to drive data-driven decisions.
Collaboration and Alignment: Work closely with central data teams to ensure consistency and alignment with Schibsted’s tools and best practices, while collaborating across all SPP teams to optimize data strategies.
Drive Data Competency: Enhance the data literacy of Engineering Managers and Product Managers to better integrate data-driven insights into decision-making processes.
Operational Excellence: Maintain and optimize data pipelines, perform ad-hoc analysis, ensure the quality of data models, and stay updated with the latest technologies to continually improve data infrastructure.
Foster Cross-Team Collaboration: Lead the Data & Analytics team to work closely with other product teams to refine data strategies, monitor progress, and adapt to challenges as they arise.
Innovate and Optimize: Promote a culture of innovation within the team, focusing on the development of advanced analytics solutions that meet the evolving needs of SPP’s product teams.


Qualifications


A Bachelor's degree or relevant experience in analytics, computer science, or related field
Excellent data analysis and visualization skills, proficiency with relevant tools and software
Experience in leading data and analytics disciplines (3+ years)
Experience in people management (2+ years)
Strong leadership skills including effective communication and stakeholder management
English language written and spoken fluency is required


Please note that the screening phase of this application process begins in January after the Holidays.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, is comfortable leading cross-functional teams, and is passionate about using data to drive impactful product decisions.

We work in a hybrid way and would like you to work from the office 2-3 days per week. This allows for collaboration and meaningful connections with the teams. If you’re not the working-from-home kind of person, you are of course welcome in our office every day!

At Schibsted, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

Role Description

In this role, you will enhance our analytics capabilities, support the development of data products, and ensure advanced product analytics solutions are implemented across our product portfolio. You will manage and develop a team of in total four Data Analysts and Data Engineers, fostering collaboration and alignment with both current and future data needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead and Develop a Team of Data Professionals: Foster collaboration, trust, and a supportive culture that values diverse perspectives. Manage day-to-day operations while mentoring team members to grow both professionally and personally, promoting communication and shared success
  • Lead Data Product Development: Assist in packaging and delivering data products (articles, videos, podcasts, etc.) and support teams in identifying data requirements early in product development.
  • Data Analytics Strategy:Recommend the right tools, implement and manage product analytics solutions for the CMS, guide teams on metrics and tracking, and support dashboard setup and user behaviour/usage analysis to drive data-driven decisions.
  • Collaboration and Alignment: Work closely with central data teams to ensure consistency and alignment with Schibsted’s tools and best practices, while collaborating across all SPP teams to optimize data strategies.
  • Drive Data Competency: Enhance the data literacy of Engineering Managers and Product Managers to better integrate data-driven insights into decision-making processes.
  • Operational Excellence: Maintain and optimize data pipelines, perform ad-hoc analysis, ensure the quality of data models, and stay updated with the latest technologies to continually improve data infrastructure.
  • Foster Cross-Team Collaboration: Lead the Data & Analytics team to work closely with other product teams to refine data strategies, monitor progress, and adapt to challenges as they arise.
  • Innovate and Optimize: Promote a culture of innovation within the team, focusing on the development of advanced analytics solutions that meet the evolving needs of SPP’s product teams.

Qualifications

  • A Bachelor's degree or relevant experience in analytics, computer science, or related field
  • Excellent data analysis and visualization skills, proficiency with relevant tools and software
  • Experience in leading data and analytics disciplines (3+ years)
  • Experience in people management (2+ years)
  • Strong leadership skills including effective communication and stakeholder management
  • English language written and spoken fluency is required

Please note that the screening phase of this application process begins in January after the Holidays.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, is comfortable leading cross-functional teams, and is passionate about using data to drive impactful product decisions.

We work in a hybrid way and would like you to work from the office 2-3 days per week. This allows for collaboration and meaningful connections with the teams. If you’re not the working-from-home kind of person, you are of course welcome in our office every day!

At Schibsted, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

Title: Tableau Consultant
Description:
Role : Tableau Consultant
Experience : 5+ years
Job Type : Contract
Contact Email : anusha.kusuma@cubane.se
Contact person : Anusha Kusuma

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Support the migration of approximately 300 data flows (1000 flows in total) from our current server to our new server. The plan is to work closely with our 15 super users and dataflow owners to help them with the migration and ensure that every feature within each dataflow works correctly.
Help us plan the work, set up collections, etc., and make sure we can switch to the new server before March 15th.
Support superusers after switching to the new server.

Experience with Alteryx Server and Desktop. Experience with migration of Alteryx data flows.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Din roll

Som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta som konsult och få möjlighet att samarbeta med olika kunder i varierande branscher. Du kommer att arbeta med att samla in, hantera och analysera stora mängder data för att stödja affärsbeslut och skapa innovativa lösningar. I rollen ingår att designa och implementera dataflöden som är skalbara och effektiva, samt bidra med insikter och förbättringar för att optimera våra processer.

Du kommer att få erfarenhet av olika miljöer och utmaningar, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att bredda din kompetens och förståelse för hur data kan användas för att driva verksamheter framåt. I nära samarbete med andra team kommer du att vara med och utveckla lösningar som möjliggör smart och datadriven verksamhet.

Det här är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med hela datalivscykeln och bidra till att skapa insikter som driver beslut och innovation.

Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:


Datainsamling samt att bygga och underhålla data pipelines och flöden, ELT/ETL, och Airflow.
Större datalagringslösningar såsom data warehouses, data lakes och delta lakes.
Datahantering inklusive datamodellering och rensning.
Datavisualisering och analys med verktyg som Power BI, QlikSense och Grafana.
Utveckling av REST API:er.



Du har dessutom kunskap och intresse av:


Kringliggande discipliner som data science, maskininlärning, analys och statistik.
Azure och Databricks.
Python och gärna PySpark.



Varför Knowit?

På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas, lära dig nya teknologier och arbeta i spännande projekt.

Låter detta som en roll för dig?

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
In a world where product size labels are unreliable, Volumental is the footwear industry's leading FitTech™ company, using 3D scans and a one-of-a-kind, AI-powered recommendation engine to match everyone with the shoes that fit them best.

Our vision is “a world without sizes, where every body fits.” With top brand and retail partners across the world including New Balance, Fleet Feet, XXL, The Athlete’s Foot, Red Wing Shoes, Intersport and Crocs, our footprint spans 3000+ stores across 58 countries, and growing! To date, we’ve gathered more than 60 million foot scans.

Our online product enables e-commerce sites to help their shoppers find the best-fitting footwear through our size-guiding tool. The product has experienced rapid growth and is now being used by almost 100,000 shoppers every month. This means we have to quickly leverage data insights, both to show how we impact our customers' KPIs, as well as to learn about our end users so we can keep iterating and improving our product.

Who You Will Work With

We are working in cross-functional product teams with a strong product development focus. Our team values collaboration, creativity, and a passion for innovation. We have an inclusive environment where everyone's ideas are heard and respected. Every team member has strong agency and is expected to have a holistic mindset on what needs to be done. Our work environment thrives when there is open, respectful discussion and the best (data-driven) ideas win.

If you like being part of the early stages of product development and working alongside technically skilled and motivated colleagues, this is your opportunity.

What You Will Work On

Our goal is to enable shoppers to simplify their purchasing decisions online, help them find the best size, and in the end decrease fit-related returns. To measure the impact and improve our product we collect a lot of different data points, some of which are:


How shoppers use our product, and where they drop off, as well as ask for feedback on the experience.
Mobile scans and fit preferences to generate footwear recommendations.
Orders and returns from our customers to be able to measure the impact of the product, like conversion and return rates.


As a Data Scientist within our online product making sense of this data will be one of your primary objectives. And, in close collaboration with the Product Manager and the whole team, you will:


Translate data into actionable insights, for your team and our customers.
Promote a data-driven mindset within the team, defining priorities and guiding best practices when it comes to methodology and technology.
Develop dashboards and visualize key metrics to help our customers understand how we impact their business.
Design, conduct, and evaluate A/B tests to improve the user experience.
Maintain and evolve our data pipelines.
Tackle a variety of exciting challenges as we grow!


Some of the tools you will be using to accomplish this are BigQuery, SQL, Dataform, Python, and Amplitude. We run our products on Google Cloud Platform.

We are excited about you because:


A self-motivated and collaborative team member.
Curious and passionate about solving challenging problems.
Open to teaching others and learning new things.
Keen to work in a caring scale-up environment.


We expect you to:


Have strong collaboration skills for working with cross-functional teams.
Be a self-starter who can independently manage initiatives and drive them forward.
Have a Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as computer science, physics, statistics, or similar.
Be able to communicate complex insights effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Be proficient in SQL and Python for data analysis.


Bonus - Not required but nice to have, absolutely let us know if you have experience with any of the following:


Have 2+ years of professional experience working as a data scientist/engineer.
You have experience with e-commerce platforms, optimizing site performance and user experience through analyzing key business metrics.
You have worked with data pipeline tools like Dataform, DBT, or similar.
You have experience working with Google Cloud Platform.


What we can offer you:


Personal learning budget and access to coaching
Opportunity to work with a great team of 20+ nationalities in our English-speaking office
Occupational pension at ITP1 level
Flexible Public Holidays Policy
Options Program
Parental pay top-up
Wellness allowance
Dog-friendly office
Hybrid work policy (at least 2-3 days from our Stockholm office)


Join Volumental and be part of a team that's transforming the footwear industry with data-driven solutions. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a tangible impact on our product and our customers' success while growing your skills in a supportive environment.

Title: Python Developer - Intern (Remote Internship - IT)
Description:
Embark on an exciting journey into the world of Python development with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and advance your career in Python development!

If you're passionate about software development and have strong problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the mentorship of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse Python development projects, exploring concepts like web development, data analysis, machine learning, and automation. Gain hands-on experience in building robust and scalable Python applications, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Schedule: Part-Time Internship
Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Aspiring Python developers with a strong interest in software development.
Analytical thinkers adept at solving complex programming challenges.
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team environments.
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, technical settings.
Enthusiastic learners committed to refining their Python development skills.
Proficiency in Python programming language and related technologies (e.g., Django, Flask) is highly valued.
Familiarity with software development lifecycle and best practices advantageous.
Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


Your Role:


Contribute to Python development projects, writing clean and efficient code.
Collaborate with the development team to design and implement software solutions.
Assist in debugging, testing, and optimizing Python applications.
Bring innovative solutions to software development challenges.
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in Python development.
Support in documenting and presenting software design and solutions.


Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in Python development today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in Python development!

Title: Data Engineer & FinOps Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Engineer & FinOps Analyst

Company: BluEdge

Max Price Rate: Open bid

Location: Stockholm (SE)

Start Date: 15 Dec 2024

End Date (renewable): 30 May 2025

We are in need of a proficient Data Engineer & FinOps Analyst to oversee and enhance cloud expenditure on Azure and GCP platforms. If you possess expertise in cloud cost management, data reporting tools, and FinOps practices, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities


Cloud Cost Management: Supervise the organization's cloud expenses for Azure and GCP.
Data Integration: Process cloud cost data, integrate it with the business hierarchy, and generate comprehensive reports and dashboards for various teams.
Cost Optimization: Visualize reservations, savings plans, and identify cost irregularities, taking necessary actions to minimize wastage.
Reporting: Develop detailed dashboards for cloud cost, chargeback, showback, governance, engineering, and compliance.
Collaboration: Work closely with product teams, controllers, engineering teams, and cloud vendors to provide essential data and address cost-related issues.


Requirements


Data Reporting Tools: Proficiency in Power BI, Data Factory, PowerAutomate (preferred but not mandatory), and Fabric (nice to have).
Cloud Knowledge: Strong understanding of Azure and GCP fundamentals, BigQuery, and cloud cost management APIs.
Automation & Queries: Knowledge of PowerShell and resource graph queries.
Data Analysis: Experience in analyzing datasets and identifying cost trends or anomalies.
FinOps Practices: Hands-on experience with FinOps principles such as cost optimization, governance, chargeback, and showback.
Soft Skills: Proven ability to collaborate with multiple teams and stakeholders, and strong verbal and written communication skills in English.


Required Skills


PowerBI
Data Factory
Azure
BigQuery
PowerAutomate
GCP
Powershell

Title: SQL Database Developer
Description:
Xensam: SAM Disrupters

Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.




We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.




About the role

As our Database Developer at Xensam, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of our company's databases. You will work closely with our development and operations teams, providing support and guidance to optimize our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, as well as implementing efficient data models.




The ideal candidate is passionate about database management, possesses at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, and thrives in an environment that values freedom of work and the ability to get things done.




Responsibilities

You will take ownership by maintaining and managing our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, performing routine database administration tasks, such as database monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization. You will also collaborate with development and operations teams to design and implement efficient database structures and schemas. Other responsibilities that you will have:

Engage in database concept refinement, data modeling, and the fine-tuning of SQL queries for optimal system performance.
Monitor database performance and proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues, including query optimization and data consistency problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enforce database standards and best practices.
Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in SQL and database administration.




Qualifications

3-5 years of professional experience working with databases.
Strong proficiency in SQL/PostgreSQL database administration and performance tuning.
Excellent understanding of database concepts, data modeling, and SQL query optimization.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex database-related issues.
Proven ability to work independently, take ownership of projects, and meet deadlines.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and Swedish.




Bonus points for

SQL/PostgreSQL certification (e.g., SQL/PostgreSQL Certified Professional) is a plus.
Experience with other database technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle Database, MongoDB etc.
Experience in the field of software licensing generally, or Software Asset Management specifically.




What you get

A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.




At Xensam, our core values define our culture

Rebellious: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.

Humane: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

Harmonious: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.

Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!




As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

Show more

We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.


About the role

As our Database Developer at Xensam, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of our company's databases. You will work closely with our development and operations teams, providing support and guidance to optimize our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, as well as implementing efficient data models.


The ideal candidate is passionate about database management, possesses at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, and thrives in an environment that values freedom of work and the ability to get things done.


Responsibilities

You will take ownership by maintaining and managing our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, performing routine database administration tasks, such as database monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization. You will also collaborate with development and operations teams to design and implement efficient database structures and schemas. Other responsibilities that you will have:

  • Engage in database concept refinement, data modeling, and the fine-tuning of SQL queries for optimal system performance.
  • Monitor database performance and proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues, including query optimization and data consistency problems.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enforce database standards and best practices.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in SQL and database administration.


Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of professional experience working with databases.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL/PostgreSQL database administration and performance tuning.
  • Excellent understanding of database concepts, data modeling, and SQL query optimization.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex database-related issues.
  • Proven ability to work independently, take ownership of projects, and meet deadlines.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and Swedish.


Bonus points for

  • SQL/PostgreSQL certification (e.g., SQL/PostgreSQL Certified Professional) is a plus.
  • Experience with other database technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle Database, MongoDB etc.
  • Experience in the field of software licensing generally, or Software Asset Management specifically.


What you get

  • A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
  • Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
  • Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
  • If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
  • Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
  • An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.


At Xensam, our core values define our culture

Rebellious: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.

Humane: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

Harmonious: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.

Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!


As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

Title: Junior Consumer Insights Consultant
Description:
HAYPP GROUP

We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.

Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 200 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.

THE ROLE

As Junior Consumer Insights Analyst at Haypp Groups insights division HayppLab, you will join a strong and well-versed team of ten incredibly talented individuals focusing on generating consumer insights. HayppLabs setup is reminiscent of an in-house insights agency that conducts research and analysis of our customers impacting decisions internally at Haypp as well as externally with our suppliers. Our main purpose is to offer actionable insights to relevant nicotine pouch and snus suppliers leveraging our robust consumer base and knowledge of the category.

As a Junior Consumer Insights Analyst you will be supporting our team that is working with several clients across different markets. To succeed you need to have both an eye for detail as well as ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously. The following are some of the tasks that you will be expected to do: gathering the clients’ needs, discussing preferred method & set-up, scripting questionnaires, preparing samples for product tests, conducting online fields via our online data collection tool, analyzing the data and building the report to be delivered.

Main Responsibilities:


Project management: support the team in all parts of the projects.
Analyzing data: Convert data into insights in a relevant and appealing way.
Interdepartmental collaboration: Manage relationships with other internal departments to ensure project development (CRM, Logistics, Customer Service & Partnership)


What We Want From You

We are looking for a driven and proactive team player who is not afraid to leave their comfort zone to learn and grow.

Successful candidates also meet the following requirements:


Education in a relevant field with emphasis on statistics, market research, business or marketing
Knowledge of both quantitative and qualitative research methods and understanding how and when to use them
Proficiency in Microsoft Office software
Fluency in English


Bonus requirements that make you stand out from the rest:


Experience from hands-on research is a plus. e.g. setting up surveys, conducting interviews, moderating focus groups, analyzing data and visualizing/presenting insights.
Experience in using SPSS, XLSTAT, R or similar
Experience from advanced insights methods (e.g Maxdiff and conjoint analysis)
Experience with using CRM tools
Fluency in Swedish


What We Offer

We are a value driven company with our values We team up, Innovation Drives Us, No Douchebags and Going the Extra Mile at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.

Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:


Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
Insurance plan, including private healthcare
30 days of paid vacation
Parental pay lift
Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
Lots of social happenings


SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!

If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!

Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.

If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Max Moen at max.moen@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.

With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst & Empowerment Lead to Enterprise Business Analytics
Description:
Are you ready to make an impact in the world of analytics? We’re on the lookout for a dynamic Data Analyst and Empowerment Lead to join our innovative team! At the heart of our mission is a commitment to empowerment, collaboration, and harnessing the power of data. If you’re passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and driving positive change, this is the opportunity for you!

We are building for the future – come join us

The construction industry is currently facing a development leap where the change agent is spelled digitalization. NCC is leading the way by developing our business and future proofing our IT platform. We are currently recruiting professionals who thrive on becoming important players in our digital transformation journey, taking construction to new heights through innovation in data.

You will join the Group function “Finance & IT”, which leads NCC´s strategic development and major change programs in the business. Finance & IT is NCC’s development and delivery function for IT as well as operations development and research & innovation. We are a Nordic organization working together closely under one common management. Cooperation in- and between units is key for us to deliver value to NCCs business areas, and therefore we have adapted an Agile team-based setup with a focus on collaboration, people and efficient delivery and development.

See Film about NCC here

How You’ll Add Value

In this role, you’ll be at the forefront of our analytics transformation. By empowering teams to effectively use data, you’ll help us make informed decisions that drive growth and enhance operational efficiency. Your expertise will not only shape our analytics strategy but also inspire a culture of collaboration and continuous learning within the organization. You are a technical expert in Power BI and help set the future best practices within this area.

As a Data Analyst And Empowerment Lead, You Will


Reporting and Visualization: Create compelling visualizations and reports that communicate complex data in a clear and engaging manner.
Empower Teams: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to foster a data-driven culture, providing training and support to enhance their analytical skills.
Advanced Data Analysis: Utilize advanced analytics techniques and data modelling to extract meaningful insights from our data and contribute to data-driven decision-making.
Establish Processes and Structures: One of our main goals is enabling self-service BI. You help develop and refine processes and structures around Power BI to ensure our analytics capabilities are robust, efficient, and scalable.


Your Profile – Skills And Qualifications


Technical Proficiency: Strong experience with Power BI and data visualization tools, along with a solid understanding of data analysis techniques.
Analytical Mindset: Proven ability to turn data to easily actionable reports
Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication skills with a knack for working effectively across diverse teams.
Empowerment Focus: A passion for teaching and empowering others in data literacy and analytics skills.
Problem-Solving Ability: Strong critical thinking skills with a proactive approach to identifying and solving challenges.
Language Skills: You are fluent in Swedish, and in English.


Why Join Us?


Empowerment Culture: We believe in lifting each other through empowerment activities, making every team member feel valued.
Innovation at Heart: Embrace a dynamic environment that encourages curiosity and openness to new ideas.
Collaborative Spirit: Be a part of a team that works together, plays together, and grows together.


Ready to Take the Next Step?

If you’re excited about leveraging data to empower teams and drive impactful change, we want to hear from you! Join us in our journey to unlock the true potential of data. Apply now and be a part of a collaborative and empowering environment that values your expertise and vision!

Additional Information

This position is in Stockholm, you will be working closely with our stakeholders located at our office in Stockholm, Sweden. And The position may require some travelling within the Nordic countries, although we do apply a flexible way of working and strive to collaborate digitally as much as possible. In accordance with NCC:s safety culture we conduct background checks on final candidates.

NCC Offers

NCCstrives to be anappealing employer, providing a work environment where employees cangrow and experience well-being. We offer a wide range of employee benefits through our benefit portal, Benify. NCC has collective agreements for all employees, providing a solid foundation of security and clear guidelines so that you know what applies to your employment. We also offer excellent opportunities for continued development and a broad range of further education options, allowing for a long career within the company.

Contact and application

Please register your application and CV in English below. Selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible but no later than January 1, 2025. For further information on this position, please contact Lis Karlehem, IT Competence Manager, +46706276580 or lis.karlehem@ncc.se or Karin Österman de Wall, HR Recruitment Specialist, +46790787210.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Build with us - together with the best colleagues in the industry!

At NCC, we are driven to continue developing, whether it's our construction projects or our personal expertise. Every day, we drive the industry's most exciting and complex construction projects forward in close cooperation between our employees, partners and customers. With us, you are a significant employee who contributes to the landmarks that define our cities and communities. Here, our employees take an active role in a corporate culture based on stable values and behaviors for a safe and secure workplace. Our collective expertise and diverse backgrounds make a difference.

NCC - one of the leading companies in the Nordics
Show more

We look forward to receiving your application!

Build with us - together with the best colleagues in the industry!

At NCC, we are driven to continue developing, whether it's our construction projects or our personal expertise. Every day, we drive the industry's most exciting and complex construction projects forward in close cooperation between our employees, partners and customers. With us, you are a significant employee who contributes to the landmarks that define our cities and communities. Here, our employees take an active role in a corporate culture based on stable values and behaviors for a safe and secure workplace. Our collective expertise and diverse backgrounds make a difference.

NCC - one of the leading companies in the Nordics

Title: Trainee Data Scientist Sundbyberg
Description:
Som trainee hos oss är du med och bygger it-infrastruktur som är en del av grunden för ett fungerande samhälle. Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar – resten är upp till dig. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

Om jobbet

Som trainee inom systemutveckling ingår du i ett av våra agila utvecklingsteam från dag ett. I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.

Skatteverkets it-traineeprogram är inne på sitt fjärde år och vi planerar nu för nästa start där vi vill

anställa upp emot 25 traineer på sju olika orter. Under programmet får du kunskap om Skatteverkets verksamhet och bygger på din erfarenhet. Du har en individuell utvecklingsplan som följs upp och revideras under programperioden så att du kan skapa det bästa upplägget utifrån dina förutsättningar och verksamhetens behov. Du har en erfaren mentor som stöd och bollplank. Traineeprogrammet pågår 12 månader och din vardag består av praktik, utbildning, temadagar och workshops, parallellt med att du jobbar i teamet. Programmets upplägg är noga framtaget för att du ska ha den bästa starten på din karriär. Självklart inleds programmet med en kick-off.

Som Data Scientist arbetar du i ett agilt team och utvecklar lösningar som använder avancerad dataanalys och maskininlärning för att skapa nytta för medborgare och företag. Du bidrar till Skatteverkets digitala utveckling och effektivisering av befintlig verksamhet. Du utför avancerade analyser av strukturerad och ostrukturerad data med bland annat statistiska modeller och nätverksanalyser, och arbetar nära verksamheten för att förstå behov och krav på de lösningar som teamet utvecklar. Du tränar, utvärderar och applicerar modeller för bild- och textanalys (NLP) och inom området urval och riskvärdering. Exempel på tillämpningar inkluderar användning av maskininlärning för klassificering av inkommande e-post, handskriftstolkning och identifiering av fel och fusk inom beskattning och folkbokföring.

Teamet består av kompetenser från verksamhet, IT och data science.

Som trainee får du använda din problemlösningsförmåga till att skapa system som underlättar vardagen för många. På vår stora it-avdelning med nära 1500 kollegor har du möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid.

Du tillhör Data- och analyssektion 1 på enhet Gemensamma Tjänster på it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg. På vår sektion är vi 22 kollegor.

Om dig

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.

I det här jobbet ska du:


vara en teamspelare och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och att kunna tänka om när det behövs
vara nyfiken, gilla utmaningar och ha förmågan att driva din egen och verksamhetens utveckling framåt
uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och kommunicera på ett engagerande sätt.



Du ska även ha:


en pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom statistik, civilingenjör, livsvetenskap eller tillämpad matematik/fysik (minst 180 hp) från högskola eller universitet med examen från år 2023 eller framåt, dock senast augusti 2025
erfarenhet av dataanalys och modellutveckling i programmeringsspråket Python från studietiden.



Bra att veta

Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.

På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.

När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.

Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/538 | Kontakt: Thomas Carlbring, sektionschef thomas.carlbring@skatteverket.se, Jesper Österberg, hr-specialist jesper.osterberg@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-12-16 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-31
Show more

I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.

Skatteverkets it-traineeprogram är inne på sitt fjärde år och vi planerar nu för nästa start där vi vill

anställa upp emot 25 traineer på sju olika orter. Under programmet får du kunskap om Skatteverkets verksamhet och bygger på din erfarenhet. Du har en individuell utvecklingsplan som följs upp och revideras under programperioden så att du kan skapa det bästa upplägget utifrån dina förutsättningar och verksamhetens behov. Du har en erfaren mentor som stöd och bollplank. Traineeprogrammet pågår 12 månader och din vardag består av praktik, utbildning, temadagar och workshops, parallellt med att du jobbar i teamet. Programmets upplägg är noga framtaget för att du ska ha den bästa starten på din karriär. Självklart inleds programmet med en kick-off.

Som Data Scientist arbetar du i ett agilt team och utvecklar lösningar som använder avancerad dataanalys och maskininlärning för att skapa nytta för medborgare och företag. Du bidrar till Skatteverkets digitala utveckling och effektivisering av befintlig verksamhet. Du utför avancerade analyser av strukturerad och ostrukturerad data med bland annat statistiska modeller och nätverksanalyser, och arbetar nära verksamheten för att förstå behov och krav på de lösningar som teamet utvecklar. Du tränar, utvärderar och applicerar modeller för bild- och textanalys (NLP) och inom området urval och riskvärdering. Exempel på tillämpningar inkluderar användning av maskininlärning för klassificering av inkommande e-post, handskriftstolkning och identifiering av fel och fusk inom beskattning och folkbokföring.

Teamet består av kompetenser från verksamhet, IT och data science.

Som trainee får du använda din problemlösningsförmåga till att skapa system som underlättar vardagen för många. På vår stora it-avdelning med nära 1500 kollegor har du möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid.

Du tillhör Data- och analyssektion 1 på enhet Gemensamma Tjänster på it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg. På vår sektion är vi 22 kollegor.

Om dig

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.

I det här jobbet ska du:

  • vara en teamspelare och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
  • kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
  • ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och att kunna tänka om när det behövs
  • vara nyfiken, gilla utmaningar och ha förmågan att driva din egen och verksamhetens utveckling framåt
  • uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och kommunicera på ett engagerande sätt.


Du ska även ha:

  • en pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom statistik, civilingenjör, livsvetenskap eller tillämpad matematik/fysik (minst 180 hp) från högskola eller universitet med examen från år 2023 eller framåt, dock senast augusti 2025
  • erfarenhet av dataanalys och modellutveckling i programmeringsspråket Python från studietiden.


Bra att veta

Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.

På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.

När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.

Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/538 | Kontakt: Thomas Carlbring, sektionschef thomas.carlbring@skatteverket.se, Jesper Österberg, hr-specialist jesper.osterberg@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-12-16 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-31

Title: BI-utvecklare med fokus på Power BI
Description:
Vår kund, ett framstående företag i Stockholm, söker nu en engagerad BI-utvecklare att förstärka sitt analysteam. Som en del av ett dynamiskt team får du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med erfarna kollegor, samtidigt som du bidrar med din kreativitet och nya perspektiv.

Vad vi söker:


Stark passion för dataanalys och visualisering
Minst 3 års erfarenhet av BI-utveckling med fokus på:
Power BI
DAX
SQL
Data modellering
Förmåga att förstå affärsbehov och omsätta dem till tekniska lösningar
Stark analytisk förmåga och problemlösningsförmåga


Meriterande kunskaper:


Azure Data Factory
Python eller R
Erfarenhet av stora datamängder och datalagerlösningar


Som konsult hos Liminity får du tillgång till marknadens bästa villkor och förmåner, inklusive:


Spännande uppdrag hos en framåtsträvande kund
Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken
Omfattande utbildningsmöjligheter och certifieringar
Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete
Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner
Och mycket mycket mer, läs mer på https://handbok.liminity.se


Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär inom BI utveckling? Ansök idag och bli en del av Liminity - framtidens IT-konsultbolag!
