Title: Trainee Data Engineer/ML Ops Sundbyberg
Description:
Som trainee hos oss är du med och bygger it-infrastruktur som är en del av grunden för ett fungerande samhälle. Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar – resten är upp till dig. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

Om jobbet

Som trainee inom systemutveckling ingår du i ett av våra agila utvecklingsteam från dag ett. I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.

Skatteverkets it-traineeprogram är inne på sitt fjärde år och vi planerar nu för nästa start där vi vill

anställa upp emot 25 traineer på sju olika orter. Under programmet får du kunskap om Skatteverkets verksamhet och bygger på din erfarenhet. Du har en individuell utvecklingsplan som följs upp och revideras under programperioden så att du kan skapa det bästa upplägget utifrån dina förutsättningar och verksamhetens behov. Du har en erfaren mentor som stöd och bollplank. Traineeprogrammet pågår 12 månader och din vardag består av praktik, utbildning, temadagar och workshops, parallellt med att du jobbar i teamet. Programmets upplägg är noga framtaget för att du ska ha den bästa starten på din karriär. Självklart inleds programmet med en kick-off.

Som Data Engineer/ML Ops Trainee arbetar du i ett agilt team och utvecklar lösningar som kombinerar avancerad datahantering och maskininlärning för att skapa nytta för medborgare och företag. Du bidrar till Skatteverkets digitala utveckling genom att bygga skalbara dataflöden och pipelines för att möjliggöra effektiva ML-tillämpningar och avancerad analys. Dina arbetsuppgifter omfattar hela utvecklingsprocessen, från arkitektur och design till dataförberedelse, modellträning, implementation, automatisering, test, drift och förvaltning. Du arbetar nära verksamheten och levererar frekvent, vilket kräver god samarbetsförmåga, flexibilitet och problemlösningsförmåga.

Teamet består av kompetenser från verksamhet, IT och data science. Du kommer att arbeta med tekniker som Python, Java, Red Hat OpenShift, DevOps, mikrotjänster samt verktyg för datahantering som Denodo och databaser. Exempel på tillämpningar inkluderar att bygga effektiva dataflöden för klassificering av inkommande e-post, identifiering av fel och fusk inom beskattning och folkbokföring samt olika tillämpningar av social nätverksanalys.

Som trainee får du använda din problemlösningsförmåga till att skapa system som underlättar vardagen för många. På vår stora it-avdelning med nära 1500 kollegor har du möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid.

Du tillhör Data- och analyssektion 1 på enhet Gemensamma Tjänster på it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg. På vår sektion är vi 22 kollegor.

Om dig

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.

I det här jobbet ska du:


vara en teamspelare och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och att kunna tänka om när det behövs
vara nyfiken, gilla utmaningar och ha förmågan att driva din egen och verksamhetens utveckling framåt
uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och kommunicera på ett engagerande sätt.



Du ska även ha:


en pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom it (minst 180 hp) från högskola eller universitet med examen från år 2023 eller framåt, dock senast augusti 2025
erfarenhet av systemutveckling i programmeringsspråk Python, Java och SQL från studietiden.



Bra att veta

Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.

På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.

När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our innovative team to create scalable, robust, and cutting-edge data infrastructure solutions. With your technical expertise and experience of the digital media ecosystem, you will play an important role in shaping the future of data-driven decision-making and transforming the way we approach media and analytics.




Do you want to grow within the world of data at Sweden's leading media agency group? We are now seeking a Data Engineer to join our talented team. The role involves both project management for executing advanced data, reporting and infrastructure solutions, as well as helping us build the foundation to embrace the advances made within AI.







About Annalect

Annalect is the Nordic regions leader in advanced decision-making systems within marketing and a global specialist unit for technology, data, and analytics. As part of Omnicom Media Group - a network of media, performance, and creative agencies - Annalect has been driving data-driven strategies and advanced analytics within the group since 2016. In the Nordics, we work closely with the group’s media agencies, supporting data-driven media planning and execution. We specialize in collecting, analysing, and leveraging data to provide our clients with insights and strategies aimed at optimizing marketing campaigns and achieving their business objectives. We are a strong team of 30 employees in Sweden and around 100 in the Nordics.







About the Role

As a Data Engineer, you will develop and maintain data analytics and reporting solutions that drive informed decision-making. Collaborating closely with advertisers and client teams, you will gather and translate data requirements into scalable models, build efficient data pipelines, and deliver impactful reports.




In this role, you will design and implement systems that enable seamless data integration, transformation, and accessibility across the organization. Partnering with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Analysts, you will create pipelines that support advanced analytics and AI-powered initiatives.




This is an exciting opportunity to work on complex data projects, shape data strategy, and foster a data-driven culture among our clients. As we embrace the rapid advancements in AI, this role is pivotal in shaping the future of marketing and innovation.







Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain data models, ETL processes, and data pipelines
Build and maintain data extraction scripts in Python from public and private APIs
Create visually compelling and interactive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations
Optimize BI solutions for performance and scalability, ensuring timely access to data for end-users
Perform data quality assessments and implement data governance best practices to maintain data accuracy and consistency
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business goals and align BI solutions with strategic objectives
Ensure compliance with data security and privacy regulations in all BI solutions
Play a critical role in scaling AI initiatives, ensuring the seamless integration of advanced models into real-world media applications







Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems or a related field
A strong understanding of the digital media ecosystem and the data infrastructure attached to it
A minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist, or Analytics Engineer
High proficiency in Python for data manipulation and automation
Experience with orchestration tools like Apache Airflow or similar
Proficiency in BI tools such as PowerBI, Looker Studio, or Tableau and the ability to create visually appealing reports and dashboards
Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis
Experience with ETL processes and building data models
Familiarity with data visualization best practices and data storytelling
Proficient in English reading and writing




As a person, we believe you are a curious individual who, like us, loves data and analytics. You demonstrate strong personal leadership and are happy to share your knowledge with the rest of the team. You enjoy interacting with clients and are genuinely interested in solving our clients' challenges within media and marketing.







We Offer You




A challenging role within one of Sweden’s leading media agency groups
The opportunity to work at the intersection of data, media, and AI in a forward-thinking organization
After-work events, conferences, training sessions, and fun activities to connect with colleagues as both coworkers and friends
Attractive benefits, including a pension plan and insurance, health and wellness allowance, and access to the benefit portal Benify
A 37.5-hour work week with flexible office arrangements
A centrally located office in Katarinahuset, by Slussen in Södermalm




We hope you want to join our team and look forward to getting to know you better. Interviews are conducted on a continuous basis, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. For questions about the role, feel free to contact;




David Rindelöv, Managing Director, david.rindelov@annalect.com

Daniel Hussam, Data & BI Lead, daniel.hussam@annalect.com

Show more

In this role, you will design and implement systems that enable seamless data integration, transformation, and accessibility across the organization. Partnering with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Analysts, you will create pipelines that support advanced analytics and AI-powered initiatives.


This is an exciting opportunity to work on complex data projects, shape data strategy, and foster a data-driven culture among our clients. As we embrace the rapid advancements in AI, this role is pivotal in shaping the future of marketing and innovation.



Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain data models, ETL processes, and data pipelines
  • Build and maintain data extraction scripts in Python from public and private APIs
  • Create visually compelling and interactive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations
  • Optimize BI solutions for performance and scalability, ensuring timely access to data for end-users
  • Perform data quality assessments and implement data governance best practices to maintain data accuracy and consistency
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business goals and align BI solutions with strategic objectives
  • Ensure compliance with data security and privacy regulations in all BI solutions
  • Play a critical role in scaling AI initiatives, ensuring the seamless integration of advanced models into real-world media applications



Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems or a related field
  • A strong understanding of the digital media ecosystem and the data infrastructure attached to it
  • A minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist, or Analytics Engineer
  • High proficiency in Python for data manipulation and automation
  • Experience with orchestration tools like Apache Airflow or similar
  • Proficiency in BI tools such as PowerBI, Looker Studio, or Tableau and the ability to create visually appealing reports and dashboards
  • Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis
  • Experience with ETL processes and building data models
  • Familiarity with data visualization best practices and data storytelling
  • Proficient in English reading and writing


As a person, we believe you are a curious individual who, like us, loves data and analytics. You demonstrate strong personal leadership and are happy to share your knowledge with the rest of the team. You enjoy interacting with clients and are genuinely interested in solving our clients' challenges within media and marketing.



We Offer You


  • A challenging role within one of Sweden’s leading media agency groups
  • The opportunity to work at the intersection of data, media, and AI in a forward-thinking organization
  • After-work events, conferences, training sessions, and fun activities to connect with colleagues as both coworkers and friends
  • Attractive benefits, including a pension plan and insurance, health and wellness allowance, and access to the benefit portal Benify
  • A 37.5-hour work week with flexible office arrangements
  • A centrally located office in Katarinahuset, by Slussen in Södermalm


We hope you want to join our team and look forward to getting to know you better. Interviews are conducted on a continuous basis, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. For questions about the role, feel free to contact;


David Rindelöv, Managing Director, david.rindelov@annalect.com

Daniel Hussam, Data & BI Lead, daniel.hussam@annalect.com

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Welcome to Alf!

Hi there! We are Alf – a newly formed tech company within Länsförsäkringar Alliance. With a client base of more than 1,8 million households, Länsförsäkringar is one of Sweden’s biggest financial groups. Alf is on a mission to create a secure and sustainable way of living by adding cutting-edge IoT tech to 200+ years of experience from helping customers taking care of their homes.

About The Job.

As our first Analytics Engineer, you’ll be contributing across multiple teams. Your primary focus will be designing and implementing data models for Alf's data platform.

Key responsibilities include:


Designing and implementing data models in our cloud-based data platform, which underpins essential use cases such as BI reporting, product analytics, and customer-facing analytics.
Supporting development teams to implement analytics-ready data points in products.
Enabling self-service analytics by maintaining and optimizing the semantic layer.
Building reports and dashboards to track key business metrics.


In this early-stage role, you’ll be our first Analytics engineer, working alongside talented individuals and receiving significant support from Head of Data & Analytics. Together, we’re on a mission to transform the insurance industry—we need to capture and measure this transformation through data.

About You.

You have an academic background in fields like computer engineering, mathematics, or a similar area and have developed your skills as an analytics engineer, data engineer, or data analyst. You’re proficient in SQL and dbt and have preferably some experience working with cloud-based data platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake, or similar services (Azure Databricks is a plus, but not required). Solid skills in programming with Python and familiarity with orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow is also an advantage.

Key strengths include:


Excellent communication skills, enabling you to act as a bridge between tech and product teams for designing analytics solutions.
A passion for driving analytics use cases from start to finish, from identifying needs to creating effective visualizations.
Attention to detail, ensuring data models are robust, accurate, and impactful.
Above all, you’re passionate about understanding our business and products, bringing a data-driven mindset to help Alf make informed decisions and succeed.


Additional skills, such as knowledge of infrastructure-as-code frameworks like Terraform and experience with tools like Google Analytics for tracking app and web performance, are also a bonus.

About Alf.

Länsförsäkringar embodies more than 200 years of dedication to create safety for our customers. With Alf, all that experience is being combined with innovative technology to cater the current needs of our clients. It’s a full-service solution providing personalized insights, advice and content, which enables the users to proactively take care of and protect their homes. With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, safety and sustainability go hand in hand.

Alf is operated by Länsförsäkringar Trygghetstjänster AB, a company owned by Länsförsäkringar Alliance. This provides a unique opportunity to become part of an engaged and fun team at an innovative tech company, characterised by the agile and dynamic essence of a startup, all while being supported by the stability and strength of Länsförsäkringar Alliance.

With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, you will get:

🏡 Work-life balance through a hybrid model

🏢 Centrally located office in Stockholm

🤝 Collective agreement including pension and insurance coverage

🏃 Wellness allowance

💸 Special banking perks

🚀…and more but let us dive more into that when we meet in person!

How to apply.

Apply by sending us your CV in Swedish or English. Our selection process is continuous, and we may move forward with candidates on an ongoing basis.
Show more

Title: Research Assistant to Stockholm School of Economics
Description:
The Stockholm School of Economics is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Research Assistant to join our dynamic research team under the guidance of Professor Valentina Tartari. The successful candidate will be responsible for performing data management and analysis tasks, with a particular focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP) models.

Key Responsibilities


Manage and preprocess large datasets for research projects.
Develop and implement data analysis pipelines using Python.
Apply NLP techniques to analyze textual data.
Assist in the interpretation and presentation of research findings.
Collaborate with other team members to ensure the successful completion of research projects.
Maintain detailed documentation of data processing and analysis procedures.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Prior research experience is a plus.

Title: Analyst – TLM Market Lead - Nordics
Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

Are you looking for a new challenge? Are you someone who is motivated to provide excellent results for their colleagues and customers? Do you enjoy a dynamic work environment where you can make a mark? Are you passionately curious with an impulse to seek new information and experiences and explore novel possibilities? If you've answered 'yes' to any or all the above, then you could be just who we are looking for!

ICS Nordic is need of a TLM market analyst to join their Business Excellence Consumer team. This position will be responsible for actively supporting the Nordic Consumer and Merchant business to adhere compliance with our third party life cycle management policy, (AEMP10).

AEMP 10 is our standard policy that defines what is required to ensure accurate selection process and management of third-party suppliers throughout their evolvement, from pre-contract to post-contract phases.

What you will be up to:


Ensure risks related to third parties are handled in line with regulatory & American Express expectations (AEMP 10-policy, among others).
Collaborate with our internal teams and partners to ensure that policy timelines are met and Control & Compliance expectations are supervised.
Drive long-lasting risk management through data and trend analysis, highlighting opportunities and championing change initiatives to reduce risk and improve controls.
Manage third-party documentation and contracts, ensuring a high quality of demanding information.
Schedule, implement and document critical meeting minutes for collaborators including information security calls and gap remediation calls.
Prepare presentations and communicate status updates at all levels, including senior leadership.
Raise awareness and educating business teams and Third-Party Risk and Relationships Managers (TRMs) on various requirements on TLM program.
Support in ad-hoc projects.


Minimum Qualifications:


Fluent English and Swedish, both spoken and written.
Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint with demonstrated presentation skills.
Experience working with operational risk, compliance, and/or control functions.
Knowledge of issuer or/and acquiring products and processes.
Understanding of the Legal Entity framework.
Demonstrated analytical skills
Ability to adjust quickly to shifting priorities, multiple demands, ambiguity, and rapid change.


Qualifications that will help you in this role:


Structured and organized.
Strong will-to-win.
Self-motivated, standout colleague with ability to balance multiple work streams and ad-hoc tasks simultaneously.
Strong communication skills combined with an ability to interact effectively with senior leaders and business partners.
Strong attention to detail.
Collaboration skills and ability to network.


We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


Competitive base salaries
Bonus incentives
Support for financial-well-being and retirement
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits (depending on location)
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
Generous paid parental leave policies (depending on your location)
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
Career development and training opportunities


Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Show more

  • Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
  • Career development and training opportunities

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
BI-utvecklare till Agero – Skapa smarta datalösningar med oss! 🚀




Är du en person som ser skönhet i en riktigt välskriven SQL-query? Tycker du att en dashboard kan vara både användbar och lite av en konstform? Då är det dig vi söker!




Hos oss får du:

Bygga allt från stabila datalager till flexibla dashboards som kunderna faktiskt vill använda.
Automatisera det tråkiga så att både du och kunden kan fokusera på det roliga.
Jobba i ett team som gillar att nörda ner sig i BI men som också är grymma på att diskutera andra ämnen vid fikat.
Friheten att växla mellan kontoret, hemmakontoret och favoritfåtöljen framför brasan, vi gillar omväxling!




Vi letar efter dig som:

Har minst fem års erfarenhet av Microsofts BI-verktyg (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, Power BI) och SQL.
Kan strukturera datalager och bygga tabulära kuber som en mästare.
Har en nyfikenhet som matchar våra kunders skiftande behov och ett öga för att skapa lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.
Är flytande i svenska – både när du kodar och när du snackar.




Varför Agero?




Vi satsar stort på din utveckling, från ny teknik till AI och avancerad datahantering. Som medarbetarägt företag får du dessutom påverka både din och Ageros framtid. Och eftersom vi tror på balans mellan jobb och fritid ser vi till att du trivs både framför skärmen och utanför den.




Redo att göra BI-magi?

Hör av dig så bokar vi in en kaffe (eller en digital fika!) och pratar om hur vi kan skapa smarta lösningar tillsammans. 👩‍💻☕👨‍💻

Show more

Title: Developer Support Engineer for Data Calling
Description:
About Sinch

Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.

Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.

At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!

Description

As a Developer Support Engineer, you will be responsible for enhancing the developer experience by continuously improving our reference implementations, sample apps, and documentation, while providing top-notch support to our clients' developers. You'll troubleshoot customer integrations of our SDKs and APIs, track FAQs, and identify patterns that highlight potential SDK improvements. Our SDKs use WebRTC technology, making it easy to add real-time, in-app voice and video calling to our clients' websites or apps.


Handle and analyse third-line support inquiries to ensure our FAQs remain relevant.
Help keep our developer documentation up-to-date and user-friendly.
Build reference implementations and sample apps to simplify the integration of our voice, video, and verification SDKs.
Collaborate closely with other engineers to stay informed about important updates and new releases.
Focus on quality assurance and provide first-class support to developers.
Communicate effectively with clients, ensuring their technical issues are resolved promptly and clearly.
Conduct QA testing of SDKs on mobile devices to ensure optimal performance and usability.


Requirements


Degree in IT, engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
High proficiency in English, particularly in writing.
Strong communication skills, with experience in handling customer support.
Experience in app development or relevant development roles.
Strong understanding of the development process and effective communication with developers.
Interest in voice and video calling technologies.


Good to have


Familiarity with Android and iOS application development (Kotlin, Swift).
Experience of using tools such as Datadog and Kibana for monitoring systems and performing root cause analysis through detailed log and metric exploration.
Previous experience in a similar support role.
Experience with voice and video calling.
Familiarity with WebRTC technology, IP networks or telecom networks.
Experience in manual and automated QA testing of SDKs on mobile devices.


Our Hiring Process

We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.

We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
Show more

Title: Vi söker dataanalytiker/data scientist för analys av informationsflöden
Description:
Svenska institutet (SI) är en myndighet med uppdrag att skapa intresse och förtroende för Sverige utomlands. Vi arbetar med Sverigefrämjande, samarbete i Östersjöregionen och global utveckling. Se vidare på www.si.se

”Vill du vara med och driva utvecklingen våra arbetssätt och metoder för analyser av informationsflöden om Sverige? Då är du kanske vår nya kollega.”

Enheten för Sverigebildsanalys ansvarar för att följa och analysera bilden av Sverige samt att se förändringar i informationsflöden och desinformation om Sverige. Målgrupperna för våra studier och rapporter är främst regeringen, Regeringskansliet, utlandsmyndigheter och andra organisationer som arbetar med att främja Sverige.

Vi erbjuder dig utmanande arbetsuppgifter i en händelserik miljö där du är med och bidrar till genomslag för svenska intressen i utlandet. Du följer dagligen utvecklingen i omvärlden och bidrar till samhällsnytta. För den här tjänsten är det en förutsättning att ha ett stort intresse för omvärlden.

Som dataanalytiker/data scientist arbetar du huvudsakligen med att driva metodutveckling inom analys av informationsflöden samt att följa informationsflöden om Sverige internationellt. Det inkluderar att förstå och analysera hur Sverige porträtteras i nyhetsmedia och sociala medier. Datainsamling och analyser genomförs idag med hjälp av kommersiella verktyg. Tillsammans med dina kollegor ska du utvärdera befintliga och identifiera nya lösningar för analys av informationsflöden.

Vi söker dig som har relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom kvalificerat analysarbete och analys av stora datamängder inom akademin, näringsliv eller myndighet. Du har kunskaper om den tekniska utvecklingen och kan utvärdera olika verktyg och metoder för analys av informationsflöden.

Som person är du analytisk, ser mönster och kan tolka och dra slutsatser. Du är van vid att arbeta självständigt men även som del av en grupp. Du kan både muntligt och skriftligt förmedla resultat och insikter på ett kommunikativt och lättillgängligt sätt. Du har gott omdöme och kan hantera en stundtals intensiv arbetsmiljö. Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.

Vi söker dig som har:


Högskoleutbildning inom ett område som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant tex systemvetenskap, datateknik, datavetenskap, samhällsvetenskap med kvantitativ profil, statistik, informationsteknik, samhällsvetenskap/(social data science) eller medie-kommunikationsvetenskap
Minst tre års erfarenhet av kvalificerat arbete inom dataanalys
Kunskap om och erfarenhet av bearbetning och analys av stora datamängder
Erfarenhet av programmering i exempelvis Python eller R
Förmåga att skriva och muntligen presentera analysresultat
Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift


Det är dessutom meriterande om du har:


Kunskap om eller erfarenhet av att analysera desinformation och informationspåverkan
Kunskap om eller erfarenhet av inhämtning av information från öppna källor
Kunskap om eller erfarenhet av bearbetning av olika ostrukturerade data så som text, bild och ljud för analys
Erfarenhet av att bearbeta, analysera och visualisera information i databasmiljö


Som person är du analytisk, ansvarstagande och har god samarbetsförmåga. Du har ett nytänkande som kan omsättas i praktiken och leder till resultat.

Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

Varaktighet och tillträde

Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders inledande provanställning.

Din tjänstebenämning inom myndigheten blir analytiker.

Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån 2 dagar per vecka om arbetet tillåter.

Kontaktpersoner

Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Sofia Bard. Fackliga ombud är Jan-Frederic Buss (Saco-S) och Katharina Holmén (ST). Samtliga nås på telefon 08-453 78 00.

Ansökan

Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-01-19!

Bifoga endast CV och personligt brev i din ansökan. Övriga dokumentation begärs in vid behov. Vi använder oss av urvalsfrågor som del i vår urvalssprocess. Var noga med att dina svar speglar din kompetens och erfarenhet på ett korrekt sätt. Som en del av urvalsprocessen kan arbetsprov begäras in.

Varför jobba hos oss?

Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats som präglas av samarbete, nytänkande och förtroende. Vi är en innovativ och lyhörd myndighet där vi vågar testa nya saker och tar vara på erfarenheter och kompetenser. Vi har ett öppet förhållningssätt och genomsyras av en inkluderande attityd samt respekt för allas kompetens, åsikter och roller. Mångfald är en förutsättning för vårt uppdrag.

Därtill erbjuder vi flexibla arbetstider, föräldrapenningtillägg samt generösa friskvårdsförmåner och semestervillkor.


Show more
HTML:
Svenska institutet (SI) är en myndighet med uppdrag att skapa intresse och förtroende för Sverige utomlands. Vi arbetar med Sverigefrämjande, samarbete i Östersjöregionen och global utveckling. Se vidare på www.si.se

”Vill du vara med och driva utvecklingen våra arbetssätt och metoder för analyser av informationsflöden om Sverige? Då är du kanske vår nya kollega.”

Enheten för Sverigebildsanalys ansvarar för att följa och analysera bilden av Sverige samt att se förändringar i informationsflöden och desinformation om Sverige. Målgrupperna för våra studier och rapporter är främst regeringen, Regeringskansliet, utlandsmyndigheter och andra organisationer som arbetar med att främja Sverige.

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant)
Description:
Come work with us

Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.




What does it mean to be a Data Engineer Consultant at Netlight?

It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar with your experience, and from there it is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like. As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems, and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.




As a Data Engineer Consultant, you will help our clients in projects with roles in Data Engineering. It can be working within Data Engineering, Data Architecture, or project management in terms of working with data or utilizing data to make product decisions to mention a few examples.




Minimum Qualifications

Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
Verbal and written fluency in English
0,5-5 years of work experience within the data engineering field related to IT and software products in agile teams




Application

We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

Title: Power Platform & AI Specialist
Description:
Brinner du för automation, AI och low-code? Till vår IT avdelning på Ving söker vi nu en Power Platform & AI Specialist!

Som Power Platform & AI Specialist kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att utforma, utveckla och driftsätta lösningar i Microsoft Power Platform för att möta verksamhetens behov. Du kommer att ansvara för att driva plattformen framåt och att fungera som en möjliggörare för Citizen Developers inom vår organisation för low-code lösningar. Dessutom kommer du att arbeta i framkanten av teknologin genom att integrera Generativ AI och AI-assistenter för att automatisera processer och skapa nya värden för verksamheten.

Du kommer att ingå i vårt Workplace team som ansvarar för att leverera innovativa och effektiva lösningar som driver vår verksamhet framåt. Teamet strävar efter att ständigt förbättras, och du kommer att ges stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och att vara i framkant av den snabbt utvecklande low-code & AI teknologin.


Du kommer att arbeta med att:

Utforma, utveckla och tillhandahålla lösningar i Microsoft Power Platform & Copilot Studio

Samarbeta med verksamheten och andra intressenter för att förstå affärskrav och identifiera möjligheter för AI-lösningar
Utveckla och underhålla Power Platform-infrastruktur och verktyg inklusive AI-komponenter

Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste utvecklingarna inom Microsoft Power Platform

Kommunicera komplexa tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska intressenter

Utbilda och stötta Citizen Developers i organisationen

Du har:

Högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, teknik, matematik eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet

Gedigen erfarenhet av Microsoft Power Platform, inklusive Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI & Copilot Studio
Utmärkta problemlösnings- och analytiska färdigheter

Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
Har praktisk erfarenhet av att skapa AI Assistenter
Gedigen kunskap om Generativ AI

Det är meriterande om du även:


Är certifierad inom AI & Microsoft Power Platform
Programmeringsförmåga i språk som Python & .NET
Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en DevOps-kultur och med verktyg som AzureDevOps och GitHub

Har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt

💚 Human IT

Human IT handlar om att göra saker lite annorlunda, att på riktigt sätta våra anställda i fokus. Vi växer tillsammans och värdesätter engagemang och ambition. För oss är det viktigt att du får chansen att vara med och påverka vägen framåt.

I utbyte erbjuder vi kompetens- och karriärutveckling genom varierande och utmanande uppdrag. Vi är inte branschinriktade och kan därför erbjuda en fantastisk variation bland uppdragen för dig som konsult. Självklart ser vi till att du får rätt utbildning och vi är väl medvetna om att det är det livslånga lärandet som bygger vår framgång.

Tillsammans skapar vi framtiden 🚀
 


Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
Kollektivavtal
Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning, inklusive maxat friskvårdsbidrag
Utvecklingsplan
Hälsoförsäkring + pension
Förskottssemester


Start: Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare.

Plats: Stockholm med möjlighet till hybridarbete

Ansökan: Vi rekryterar löpande. Så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

Human IT arbetar tillsammans med Great Place To Work för att vi skall bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats.




Och förresten:

Som en aktiv del i ett samhälle med kulturell och social mångfald är Human IT’s ambition att präglas av inkludering och bred representation, samt vara en arbetsplats med lika möjligheter för alla. Human IT anställer, bibehåller, befordrar och i övrigt behandlar alla medarbetare och kandidater efter erfarenhet, kvalifikationer och kompetens, oavsett kön, religion, ursprung, ålder, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller funktionsvariationer.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.




To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...




Job Details




HamiltonAI is a Media & Marketing AI Platform helping marketers optimise future media investments and predict the business outcome. The platform applies artificial intelligence and machine learning to media planning across all offline and online media channels.




Come and join our Center of Excellence team as a Data Analyst in Copenhagen.




As a Data Analyst you will be a part of Center of Excellence team in CPH and will participate in ensuring our customers data are being processed correctly into our proprietary platform and aligning with our internal Modelling team on requirements and needs. Thus, a key responsibility will be to make sure that the quality of the data lives up to our internal expectations and general sanity levels.




In return, we offer you a vibrant environment where you have the opportunity to learn about the most cutting edge technologies, experiment and create while working with cool, autonomous teams.




The Center of Excellence team is the central nerve of the company, as it ensures our customers get access to their models, in a timely fashion. The team is one of the main users of our proprietary software, that provides customers with in-depth knowledge of their media and marketing performance, and allows them to predict and optimise their future campaigns.

We imagine that you are an ambitious, data savvy person who takes pride in getting the details right, but at the same time is concerned with the overall end outcome. You may be newly graduated or only have a few years of experience, but you have drive, and talent, take responsibility and are eager to learn and grow fast.




If that sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!




About The Role




As a Data Analyst, here is what you’ll spend most of your time on:

Taking part in customer data onboarding and securing that the data is following our standard specifications
Ensuring high data quality, both syntactically and semantically
Contribute with developing automated dashboards/reports with relevant metrics and statistical summaries
Writing scripts in order to transform data according to specifications.
Being involved in the continuous improvement of our tools and processes which will allow us to improve overall data reliability and quality
Communicate with internal stakeholders in regards to everything data related.
Learning about modelling on our AI platform after the fundamentals have been learned
Having fun!




About You




Here are some competencies/attributes that we look for:

Detailed oriented person with passion for data
Able to analyze large, complex datasets and share key learnings, patterns and outliers
Solid hands-on knowledge of SQL
Good experience with data visualisations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to present and share insights with stakeholders across the teams with different level of data and technical knowledge
Proactive person with can-do attitude, curious about knowledge and skills development
Adaptable and ready to face any challenges as an individual but also supporting others and winning as a team

It’s a plus if you have knowledge of these, but not a requirement:

Experience with Python or Power BI




What We Bring To The Table




International vibrant environment in the center of CPH
Flexibility of working from home a couple of days a week
Access to Premium LinkedIn educational courses
Being part of a global leading brand marketing company placed in 90 different countries




The position requires on-site presence in Copenhagen and we do not have the possibility to relocate candidates




If you see yourself as a part of our team at Kantar and believe that you can contribute something valuable, apply for the position!




Location

Copenhagen, RaadhuspladsenDenmark




Kantar Rewards Statement




At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.




We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.




Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Show more
HTML:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.


To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...


Job Details


HamiltonAI is a Media & Marketing AI Platform helping marketers optimise future media investments and predict the business outcome. The platform applies artificial intelligence and machine learning to media planning across all offline and online media channels.


Come and join our Center of Excellence team as a Data Analyst in Copenhagen.


As a Data Analyst you will be a part of Center of Excellence team in CPH and will participate in ensuring our customers data are being processed correctly into our proprietary platform and aligning with our internal Modelling team on requirements and needs. Thus, a key responsibility will be to make sure that the quality of the data lives up to our internal expectations and general sanity levels.


In return, we offer you a vibrant environment where you have the opportunity to learn about the most cutting edge technologies, experiment and create while working with cool, autonomous teams.


The Center of Excellence team is the central nerve of the company, as it ensures our customers get access to their models, in a timely fashion. The team is one of the main users of our proprietary software, that provides customers with in-depth knowledge of their media and marketing performance, and allows them to predict and optimise their future campaigns.

We imagine that you are an ambitious, data savvy person who takes pride in getting the details right, but at the same time is concerned with the overall end outcome. You may be newly graduated or only have a few years of experience, but you have drive, and talent, take responsibility and are eager to learn and grow fast.


If that sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!


About The Role


As a Data Analyst, here is what you’ll spend most of your time on:

  • Taking part in customer data onboarding and securing that the data is following our standard specifications
  • Ensuring high data quality, both syntactically and semantically
  • Contribute with developing automated dashboards/reports with relevant metrics and statistical summaries
  • Writing scripts in order to transform data according to specifications.
  • Being involved in the continuous improvement of our tools and processes which will allow us to improve overall data reliability and quality
  • Communicate with internal stakeholders in regards to everything data related.
  • Learning about modelling on our AI platform after the fundamentals have been learned
  • Having fun!


About You


Here are some competencies/attributes that we look for:

  • Detailed oriented person with passion for data
  • Able to analyze large, complex datasets and share key learnings, patterns and outliers
  • Solid hands-on knowledge of SQL
  • Good experience with data visualisations
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to present and share insights with stakeholders across the teams with different level of data and technical knowledge
  • Proactive person with can-do attitude, curious about knowledge and skills development
  • Adaptable and ready to face any challenges as an individual but also supporting others and winning as a team

It’s a plus if you have knowledge of these, but not a requirement:

  • Experience with Python or Power BI


What We Bring To The Table


  • International vibrant environment in the center of CPH
  • Flexibility of working from home a couple of days a week
  • Access to Premium LinkedIn educational courses
  • Being part of a global leading brand marketing company placed in 90 different countries


The position requires on-site presence in Copenhagen and we do not have the possibility to relocate candidates


If you see yourself as a part of our team at Kantar and believe that you can contribute something valuable, apply for the position!


Location

Copenhagen, RaadhuspladsenDenmark


Kantar Rewards Statement


At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.


We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.


Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Title: Data analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Analyst

We believe businesses around the world should have access to open data, helping them to better understand their market and competition - and how it will evolve. Simply put, leverage prescriptive intelligence, and gain foresight by answering the questions that give a competitive edge!

Our Vision Is To Answer Questions In Every Industry, But We Have Started With E-commerce And Real Estate Where We Collect The Right Data To Forecast & Predict Answers To Questions Like This


Which company is about to move in within the next 12 months?
Which companies will grow?
How many web shops deliver cosmetics in different countries?
What is the average delivery time for all web shops?
How can we reduce CO2 footprint?


Tembi is developed by an internal team that possesses all the competencies involved in building data driven SaaS web products. We have data engineers, data scientists, data analysts, software engineers, UI/UX designers, front end developers and agile coaches. We are committed to our company values to innovate, collaborate, and support each other. We celebrate our wins and take every opportunity there is to improve and to learn new things. We believe in agile ways of working and apply a start-up mentality in everything we do.

Location: The role is located in Copenhagen, Denmark. You need to be on location four days per week. Our office is located 5 min walk from Nørreport station.

Who are you?

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst who thrives on diving deep into data to uncover trends and opportunities. If you are driven by the thrill of turning data into actionable insights— identifying growth opportunities and visualizing complex datasets in compelling ways—you might just be the one, we are searching for.

Being part of our tight-knit team means every day is unique. Some days you will be deep diving into data, making sense of patterns and anomalies. On others, you will be brainstorming with colleagues, ensuring that our predictive models are in line with the latest trends and customer needs. Agility is our mantra, and your commitment to swift, quality deliveries without cutting corners will resonate deeply with our ethos.

Given the pivotal nature of this role, there's ample room for you to become a subject-matter expert. With this comes significant responsibility, as your insights will shape the models and analyses, we present to our clients. We are passionate about individuals with a growth mindset—those who view challenges as intriguing puzzles rather than roadblocks. Our team is on a rapid trajectory of growth and evolution, and adaptability is key. You might be consulted or even asked to help with coding our front-end or creating a special report for clients, we need people who do not get scared when asked to try new things.

Your Main Responsibilities


Identify opportunities for business growth and efficiency improvements through data analysis.
Gather, clean, and maintain data from multiple sources while ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Explore relationships between various data sources to uncover insights.
Use statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and predictive modeling to address business questions.


Other Aspects Of The Role


Collaborate with sales and product development teams to understand and fulfill data needs.
Present complex analyses as clear, actionable conclusions.
Organize team outings to your favorite pastime—whether it is golf, climbing, biking, skeet shooting, or something entirely unique.


Qualifications To Excel In This Role


Proficiency in Python and experience with platforms like Databricks.
Advanced Excel skills, including pivot tables and complex formulas.
Expertise in Power BI and DAX for creating advanced dashboards and visualizations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven experience in data analysis.
Detail-oriented, self-motivated, and passionate about uncovering trends and driving innovation.
Critical thinking skills to analyze data, identify inconsistencies, and apply logical reasoning.
Experience with data warehouse environments and cloud platforms (e.g., Azure) is a plus.
Prior experience in building or contributing to a product is an advantage but not required.


Dive into the data-driven world with us, harnessing the power of predictive analytics to shape the future of businesses. We eagerly await your expertise and fresh perspectives.

What We Offer


A highly entrepreneurial environment with flat hierarchies and short decision paths.
We are 25 colleagues today, have clients in fourteen markets, and have an ambition to build a fast-growing organization. You’ll be part of the ride from nearly the start and learn how to build a software company from the ground up.
Outstanding engineering and product team, shipping high-quality product incredibly fast.
Salary and packages are tailored individually based on experience and fit for the team.
An office full of talented, mission-driven people.
A position with direct feedback from customers.
A strong, collaborative work environment with a history of successful startups.
Enjoyable lunches at our Cantina and a multicultural team that communicates in English.
Office stocked with free snacks, soda, and coffee
Located at Fiolstræde, centrally in Copenhagen near Nørreport. (25 min from Malmö)
Diverse team with members from (Denmark, Sweden, Chile, Iran, Spain, Ukraine, and India)


Application Process

The application process begins with a review by our team. Following this, candidates will undergo interviews conducted via voice or video calls. Successful candidates will then be invited for an in-person interview where they will have the opportunity to meet the team to ensure a good fit. During this process there may be a technical test and TT38 personality test. We care about finding the right person for the job with best fit for the team. The final stage includes contract negotiations. The entire hiring process is expected to take anywhere from a few days to a couple of weeks.

This is not a consultant opportunity and we respectfully ask not to be contacted regarding consultancy offers.

  • Salary and packages are tailored individually based on experience and fit for the team.
  • An office full of talented, mission-driven people.
  • A position with direct feedback from customers.
  • A strong, collaborative work environment with a history of successful startups.
  • Enjoyable lunches at our Cantina and a multicultural team that communicates in English.
  • Office stocked with free snacks, soda, and coffee
  • Located at Fiolstræde, centrally in Copenhagen near Nørreport. (25 min from Malmö)
  • Diverse team with members from (Denmark, Sweden, Chile, Iran, Spain, Ukraine, and India)

Application Process

The application process begins with a review by our team. Following this, candidates will undergo interviews conducted via voice or video calls. Successful candidates will then be invited for an in-person interview where they will have the opportunity to meet the team to ensure a good fit. During this process there may be a technical test and TT38 personality test. We care about finding the right person for the job with best fit for the team. The final stage includes contract negotiations. The entire hiring process is expected to take anywhere from a few days to a couple of weeks.

This is not a consultant opportunity and we respectfully ask not to be contacted regarding consultancy offers.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Why join us in 2025?

Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us in influencing the future of digital payments in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.

About Your Future Role

At Nets, you’ll develop in a fast-growing tech company in a high-paced, high-impact market. Working to shape the future of payments, it’s not just skills and motivation that get the job done, it’s the full package that makes the difference. Together, we impact the lives of everyone around us by powering an easier tomorrow for every citizen, bank, business and colleague.

Are you enthusiastic about working with data in reporting and analytical solutions? And would you be excited to take a critical role within data analysis in productive agile teams? Then take this opportunity at Nets as Data Analyst and join an experienced team, where you’ll be allowed to facilitate and direct our use of agile principles and methods according to SAFe (Portfolio configuration).

You’ll be powering Data and Analytics Nordics and DACH department, and your key responsibilities will include:


Bringing about product development from MVP to full-fledged operational solutions
Analyze payment datasets and design solutions for developing product propositions for customers.
Establishing data flows, transforming large data sets, building data models, enabling robust and scalable integration, and provisioning of data towards customer solutions.


As a Data Analyst, you’ll join an open and sharing community with highly skilled colleagues. You can come as you are and be at your best at Nets. You’ll find the freedom to balance an exciting job with life outside of work.

What makes you the best person for this job?

As you read about the role, are you eager to learn more? If so, review the qualifications that fit you for the position. Remember, beyond your skills and experience, your potential sets you up for success in your daily tasks.

At Nets, we are going all-in to establish agile best practices around product development and portfolio management, so we need a person who is a quick learner, motivated, result-oriented, highly analytical, and structured.

Your other qualifications include:


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proven experience (2+ years) in data analysis, preferably in the financial industry.
Ideally, you have 5 - 7 years of experience with a broad and deep technical understanding in areas of BI, analytics, data platforms, architecture and governance.
Potentially, you have been working with many of these technologies and tools:
– Big Data technologies like Cloudera Data Platform (CDP) including Apache Hive, Apache Spark, Hbase, Sqoop, etc.
– SQL and RDBMS like Oracle, SQL server
– SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
– Power BI tool
Experience on public cloud-based technologies is an added advantage
You have a solution-oriented and analytical mindset, and you thrive working with complex end-to-end solutions and processes.
You are a team-oriented person, have great communication skills, and have worked with both on-site and off-site development teams.
Verbal and written communication skills in English is necessary.

If you join us in the role of Data Analyst, this is what you can expect from us:


Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
Hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours
Home equipment allowance
Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
Health insurance
Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company


Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

About Us

Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

About The Team

We are the result of merging Nexi, Nets, and Sia, with a presence in over 25 countries. With over 80 years of experience, we offer plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth

At Nexi, we learn, adapt, and think like entrepreneurs. Discover more about our culture by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=about-the-team

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

About The Job

Do you want to work with management reporting and financial crime prevention in one? Saxo is an investments bank, with high speed, global colleagues and we are looking for a Data Analyst to work within the AML program management and reporting team.

The AML program is part of 1st Line of defense in Group Operations and located in Saxo’s headquarters in Hellerup. We are currently a team of four dedicated employees with diverse backgrounds and experience, and we are looking for new colleagues to join our program. The responsibility of the program team is to ensure progress on the Financial Crime Prevention globally across Saxo.

As our new Data Analyst, your primary focus will be to work closely with the reporting and data team to develop and implement multiple reporting solutions based on the right data. Furthermore, you will be responsible for supporting senior management and financial crime prevention leadership with data requests on different projects.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate should possess a balanced blend of business acumen and IT expertise. Saxo has a client-centric focus, which requires the candidate to comprehend data analysis and issues from a business standpoint. It is a requirement for this role to be able to collaborate with and communicate across departments and business units in the organization. The nature of the position is analyzing data stemming from financial crime prevention business units, so findings, scoping and collaboration of fixing issues will take place across the value chain.

Besides this, the candidate must be self-driven and interested in learning how the business works. Experience with data analysis itself and with other financial institutions is a plus, but the right attitude can go a long way if other elements are missing.

Your profile

You thrive in an environment with constant changes but have an eye for the details. You may have experience from the financial sector within financial crime prevention or are eager to expand your qualification in this area.

The Ideal Candidate For The Job


Understanding of how data is used within business processes and its impact on desired business process outcomes.
Experience with data analysis of big data sets using SQL, Power BI, and Excel.
Experience with Databricks would be an advantage.
Solid project management skills to guide point-in-time and ongoing targeted data quality projects. 
Comprehensive understanding of the importance and impact of data (or bad data) on the ability of the business to meet its own objectives. 
Facilitation and conflict resolution skills to assist in resolving the different points of view and requirements that invariably collide during cross-team and cross-organization efforts.
Have experience in presenting and reporting to senior management
Have good communications skills both verbally and in writing.
Masters English on a professional level


We conduct interviews on a continuous basis, so send your application sooner rather than later.

Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst for our newly formed Managed Services team within the Vendor Management function. You will be responsible for analyzing data and reports and transforming them into actionable insights that drive decision-making.

BEC is transforming into a leading fintech integrator for Danish banks by strengthening our product offering and transforming the technology estate. A central part of this journey is BEC’s tech transformation where outsourcing will be a natural, continuous part of the operating model to reduce complexity, increase efficiency, ensure access to international specialists, and focus the company. BEC has partnered with outsourcing vendors to manage many existing services and future-proof important platforms efficiently.

To support BEC’s strategic aspirations the Operations & Infrastructure division is adjusting its setup to handle a multi-vendor setup. This is the division you will be a part of. To ensure vendors and partners live up to BEC’s requirements and expectations and that their work is based on BEC priorities, a new area is being established for managing and governing vendors and partners. The new setup will handle BEC’s main partners.

You will get a role in shaping the data reporting setup and ensuring that necessary stakeholders have relevant data for decision-making. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the analysis of data, reports, and documentation management. You will take part in setting up and configuring tools supporting data and reporting in the Managed Service function.

If you are experienced with data analysis, supporting business and operations while having technical expertise and the ability to communicate complex data this role is for you..

Primary task and responsibilities include:



Creation, maintenance, and continuous improvement of the reporting setup and data sets.
Transforming incoming data to data models for creating actionable insights.
Communicate and visualize complex data to internal stakeholders.
Manage and maintain documentation and systems that support the Managed Services function, ensuring adequate tools for reporting and that data is accurate and up to date.
Close collaboration within the Managed Services team to ensure the information needed for your colleagues to perform is in place.
Define future data needs, e.g. data points needed for SLA reporting



To succeed you will:



Be proficient in data analysis, being able to manipulate and interpret data sets to form data models for analysis of trends and insights.
Have excellent data management skills to ensure accuracy and reliability in reports.
Be able to communicate complex data clearly and effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Have experience in reporting and visualization with a strong proficiency with BI tools.
Have a good understanding of ITIL, ITSM, and application lifecycle management.
Be excellent at cross-organizational collaboration.
Have experience with ServiceNow either as a user or with configuration.
Thrive in a fast-paced and continuously evolving environment.



B e your best self with BEC’s Benefits!

We offer a diverse range of benefits for our employees. Here are just a few of them.



Professional development
Healthy, varied lunch and fruit in the canteen
Active staff associations: yoga, cycling, gokart, games, running, bowling etc.
Flexible working hours
Pension scheme
Health and dentist insurance.
Referral bonus
Find out more about working life at BEC .



What does the recruitment process look like?



Send us your CV: We want to get to know you
Screening call: Let’s chat and see if we’re a match
Meet your future manager and team: See who you’ll be working closely with.
Personality and cognitive test: Let’s learn more about you.
Meet our talent partner and your future manager once more: Get feedback on your test results.
Time to sign the contact: We’re ready to welcome and onboard you to BEC!



Make us aware of your talent

We are an equal opportunities employer. We hire top talent regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, and age. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. See our full list of vacancies at https://www.bec.dk/en/vacancies/

If you have any questions related to the position, please contact Area Director Vendor Management Mikkel Tvermose Nielsen at Mikkel.Nielsen@bec.dk

You can also learn more about BEC by browsing our company culture book: wearebec.pdf
Show more
