Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about enabling insights to be discovered through data? Do you have a keen eye for how to best visualize and communicate with data through reporting and analytics solutions? Do you want to assist in enabling data-informed decision making in area of Supply & Distribution to grow the world’s largest jewelry brand? If yes, you are the person we are looking for. As our new data visualization specialist, you will play a pivotal role in making sure that we create technical analytics solutions that solve real business problems and engage users to drive adoption.

Transform, model and visualize data

At PANDORA, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new Data Visualization Specialist, you will collaborate with product managers, data engineers, stakeholders, and end-users across the global organization. You will help business verticals and clusters maximize the value of our data and drive impactful business change.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing analytics solutions on our global data platform along with our team of excellent engineers in the organization.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  


Working closely with your products team to design efficient, stable, and to-the-point products to drive commercial business value through reporting, self-service analytics and other data communication cases.
Creating and maintaining high-quality and high-performance Power BI reports and semantic models.
Taking ownership of your products and continuously tracking stability, adoption, and impact.
Ensuring that great user experiences are at the heart of all deliverables.
Delivering self-service solutions for end-users and training them in their usage.
Working with stakeholders and end-users to assist with data-related technical challenges.
Following best practices and existing guidelines but also challenging the status quo.



Team Player With Strong Analytical Skills

We are looking for a real team player with a product-oriented, can-do attitude who is both technically proficient but also able to engage with end-users. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, we are looking for a confident communicator that can explain solution designs and can tailor their message and solutions according to the audience.

You’re perfect for this role if you have:


Relevant education within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field, however experience and passion for data analytics is most important.
At least 2 years of experience working with BI, data preparation, and visualization.
Experience from a global retail organization.
Experience with Power BI, DAX, Analysis Services, Tabular Editor, SSMS, Databricks, Power Automate, Power Apps, and Jira.
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL and Tabular models.
High proficiency in English and ability to communicate at all levels of technical competence.
Agile mindset and experience with Scrum and agile ways of working.



Your new team

You will be an essential asset to one of PANDORA’s Data & Analytics product teams, consisting of data engineers, business analysts, scrum masters, and product managers who all enable our global business users in making impactful decisions informed by data. You will join our Digital Hub in Havneholmen, a peninsula on Kalvebod Brygge with a great view over Copenhagen Harbour.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake 

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
Show more

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to be a part of the IT department in a company with a unique impact on global healthcare? Grab this opportunity to join a rapidly growing company, where we are ready to invest in you. Here you will not only get to impact the production and development of our products; you will also have every opportunity to develop your skills further. 

Every 2nd second Ferrosan Medical Devices’ products help surgeons and nurses control bleedings and avoid complications in surgical procedures. We make seconds count in surgical care! And we need you on our team!

Role Summary

We are in search of a proficient Data Analyst to become a valuable member of our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst you will use your breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems. You are a great communicator and storyteller - and enjoy helping non-technical audiences see what you see in numbers and complex data sets. You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing.

The ideal candidate should excel in utilizing Microsoft Power BI and Microsoft Fabric and have a robust ability in documentation, which is crucial for meeting regulatory requirements in the medical devices sector. In this role, you will have the chance to shape and build the future data platform for Ferrosan Medical Devices.

Your Responsibilities


Develop, design, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand the business needs and translate them into data models and visualizations.
Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business objectives.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through meticulous validation and testing.
Optimize Power BI solutions for performance and scalability.
Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI functionalities and best practices.
Continuously explore new sources and tools to enhance analytical capabilities.


Your profile


You have a relevant background, e.g. a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or another relevant field.
You probably have +2 years proven experience as a Data Analyst with a strong focus on Power BI.
You are proficient in data modelling and testing.
You know your way around data manipulation tools such as SQL, Python, etc.
You pay attention to details and have commitment to data accuracy.
You are fluently speaking and writing English.


About

About Ferrosan Medical Devices A/S

Ferrosan Medical Devices develops and produces a portfolio of medical devices used in surgical care. Our portfolio consists of various haemostatic products to minimize bleeding challenges in surgery and electromechanical medical devices to perform breast biopsies. We are an international company with products registered in more than 100 countries. Our products are marketed in collaboration with global MedTech partners. Innovative ideas are developed and matured from the first thought to finished implementation in production. And we manage the business with an uncompromising focus on quality based on current GMP requirements.

Why join us?


Potential to contribute shaping the future in a strategic, high-impact initiative.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Innovative and inclusive culture.
Opportunity to make a significant impact in the medical device industry.


Want to join our team?

Send your application along with your CV. We will process the applications as we receive them. 

Questions? Please do not hesitate to contact Director, Group IT, Anders Jacobsen on +45 2929 3300

We look forward to hearing from you. 
Show more

Title: Lab Data Analyst
Description:
On behalf of our client, market leader, we are looking for a skilled, Lab Data Analyst for a mechanical/physical laboratory.




The role will revolve around thermal performance and testing, as well as advising and guiding projects from initial product testing to certification.




Overview of the role:




Focusing on thermal performance and other product properties, planning tests, performing analyses, and presenting conclusions, as well as:




Supporting R&D development projects and participating in/initiating line trials at the factories
Diving into test methods and data to become the expert in the field
Preparing statistics and documentation for reporting of test results to project managers and project groups
Participating in internal and external networks at test institutes




More specifically, tasks include:




Planning and conducting tests in collaboration with laboratory technicians.
Evaluating products and test results.
Analyzing data and preparing reports for project managers.




Essentials in a nutshell:




A degree in chemical engineering or other scientific area
Interest in the world of data and statistics
Willingness to specialise within the field of thermal performance
Material knowledge
A couple of years of experience from a similar position, ideally within development
Stellar communications skills







As of now, the duration has been set to around 3-6 months, but there is a high possibility of the contract being extended.




In case of any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me. Looking forward to seeing your application!

Show more

Title: Junior Quantitative Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you curious to enter the investment world at Danske Bank and guide our customers in their investment decisions? Join our Investment Concepts team and contribute to developing highly competitive investment solutions that contribute to excellent customer experiences across the Nordic region.

Join the Investment Concepts Team in the Investment Products & Offerings department

In the Investment Products & Offerings department, part of the broader Private Banking & Investments organization at Danske Bank, we provide the foundation for a highly competitive investment product offering towards Danske Bank’s private customers across the Nordic markets. We constantly seek to enhance our customers' financial wellbeing and guide private customers in their wealth planning anchored by sound investment concepts & recommendations, leading our clients towards achieving their long-term financial goals.

The new team member will join our Investment Concepts team, a crucial component of the Investment Products & Offering department. This innovative group is committed to secure the highest standards of quality and innovation in our investment concepts. The team's work concentrates on continuously developing and refining our investment concepts to ensure relevance and value contribution for our customers. Their efforts are vital in maintaining the integrity and effectiveness of our investment recommendations, directly contributing to our overarching goal of enhancing customers’ financial well-being.

In this role within the Investment Concepts team, you will handle both changing and recurring tasks, supporting assignments throughout the Investment Products & Offering organization. Your analytical skills and creative mindset will be key in driving the development and refinement of investment concepts that will shape the future of our customer engagements.

You will:


Develop and implement quantitative analysis methods to carry out diverse assignments, including analysis on portfolios and custody holdings across different customer segments.
Conduct thorough impact analysis of investment recommendations to ensure their effectiveness and relevance.
Collaborate in the development and refinement of new and existing investment concepts through quantitative building blocks.
Support in improving our operational efficiency by developing tools to streamline process steps.


Detail-oriented quantitative analyst with an interest in investments

We are looking for a candidate with an interest in investments, investment products, and financial markets, who excels in developing quantitative frameworks and analyses. Your technical skills, combined with a proactive and collaborative approach, will be essential in advancing our team in a continuously evolving environment. We do not expect you to bring many years of experience, but instead the ideal candidate will have:


Proficiency in SQL databases and programming languages such as Python, C#, C++, or R.
A keen curiosity and enthusiasm for handling non-routine tasks and thriving in engaging settings.
Notable creativity and self-motivation, with a proven ability to initiate and lead projects independently.
Effective team collaboration skills.
Proficiency in English and preferably a Scandinavian language to effectively communicate and collaborate across our diverse teams.


Have we caught your interest?

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Kerstin Lysholm, Head of Investment Products & Offerings at klys@danskebank.dk .

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.

We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.
Show more

  • A keen curiosity and enthusiasm for handling non-routine tasks and thriving in engaging settings.
  • Notable creativity and self-motivation, with a proven ability to initiate and lead projects independently.
  • Effective team collaboration skills.
  • Proficiency in English and preferably a Scandinavian language to effectively communicate and collaborate across our diverse teams.

Have we caught your interest?

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Kerstin Lysholm, Head of Investment Products & Offerings at klys@danskebank.dk .

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.

We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
📊 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Analytics Engineer to join our Data Modeling team, currently composed of 2 analytics engineers.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as an Analytics Engineer

As an Analytics Engineer, you will play a key role in transforming raw data into meaningful insights, ensuring data is not only accessible but also actionable for decision-makers across the organization. Your expertise will enable scalable analytics and reporting solutions, empowering stakeholders to drive business growth with confidence.

Your responsibilities will include:


Designing and maintaining scalable data models and datasets for business reporting and analysis
Developing and optimize dbt transformations for clean, reliable data
Collaborating with Data Modeling and Data Platform teams for smooth data integration and pipeline efficiency
Building and maintaining dashboards and visualizations in Looker or Tableau, tailored to business needs
Working with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into insights
Ensuring data integrity through validation and monitoring
Promoting data literacy and self-service analytics across the organization
Contributing to the improvement of our analytics stack and workflows


🙌 Your profile

You will be a good fit to join the team if:


You have 3+ years of experience in an Analytics Engineer or similar role (Data Analyst, BI Developer, Data Engineer)
You're proficient in Python and SQL, with a strong understanding of complex data transformations
You have expertise in data modeling and visualization tools (e.g., dbt, Looker, Tableau)
You're familiar with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
You can communicate complex data concepts in a clear, concise, and actionable manner
You possess a strong product sense and can empathize with business needs and customer challenges
You thrive in a collaborative environment, enjoy teamwork, and learn from others
You're fluent in English, both written and spoken (Ageras is an international team!)
You're available to work from our office in Copenhagen


💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 30' introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to get to know each other and tell you more about Ageras.

2️⃣ A 30' discussion with August (Lead Analytics Engineer) to talk about your previous experiences and the role we're offering.

3️⃣ A 45' business case presentation to assess your technical skills, followed by a 45' meeting with the team.
Show more

Title: Senior BI Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Flatpay, a rapidly growing fintech company recognized as one of the fastest growing in Denmark, we’re expanding our presence in Denmark, Finland, Germany, and Italy. We’re looking for an ambitious and curious Senior BI Analyst for our office in Copenhagen, who loves transforming data into insights and developing value-adding solutions to support our growth journey!




About us

Flatpay is dedicated to revolutionizing the payment industry with innovative solutions that enhance user experience and drive efficiency. Our commitment to technology and customer satisfaction has positioned us as a leader in the fintech sector. With a dynamic team and a collaborative culture, we are focused on leveraging data to inform decision-making and drive our business forward. You’ll become part of our expanding BI team, where collaboration, fun and a relaxed atmosphere are our top priorities.




What You’ll Do

As a Senior BI Analyst at Flatpay, you’ll be juggling various tasks related to analysis and reporting on diverse data sets, along with playing a crucial role in developing and maintaining our data platform. With your expertise, you’ll revise and develop our existing models, ensuring that we meet business needs and stay ahead of best practices and technologies.




Your main responsibilities will include:




Understanding and exploring business needs for data, analysis and reporting.
Ensuring data quality and accuracy through testing and validation of data.
Developing reports and dashboards (mainly in Power BI).
Support on data transformations and data pipeline (dbt & Fabric).
Optimizing existing reports and insights based on user feedback.
Contribute to shaping a future-proof solution of our data infrastructure.




Who you are

To succeed in this role, you must have flair for programming along with experience in Power BI and SQL. You are naturally curious, and open to embracing new technologies to streamline your tasks. You possess a solid understanding of business processes and thrive when working on connecting business needs with complex analytical solutions. You’re used to working independently, passionate about delivering results continuously, and comfortable navigating an agile environment with a high pace.




Moreover, we imagine that you have:




1-3 years of experience in data processing and visualization using Power BI.
Fluency in English, both written and spoken (Danish is a plus).
Great stakeholder management skills.
The ability to communicate financial and analytical concepts in an understandable way.
A higher education degree in economics, IT, data analytics or another relevant field.
Great business acumen and a commercial mindset.




Why choose Flatpay?

At Flatpay, we believe in work-life balance, creativity, and a culture that embraces innovation, where our ambitious colleagues can thrive. As part of our team, you become a part of +300 passionate Flatpayers dedicated to shaping the future of payments in Europe.




Flatpay is proud to be a company that values diversity. We secure an inclusive work environment for all our people and offer opportunities for professional growth and development.




We have free slush-ice, an in-office gym, fully equipped gaming room and lots of other fun stuff at the office!

If you’re ready to be a part of this exciting journey, we would love to hear from you today! Please submit your resume and cover letter and we’ll get in touch with you.  




Let’s shape the future together! 🚀

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Are you passionate about data and adding value through reports, and do you want to work in a global production company within the food industry?




At Palsgaard, we have set out on an ambitious growth journey to double our production capacity over the next couple of years. Part of that journey is to rethink our global business processes and how we use data to create more valuable insights and reports. We have started implementing a global ERP platform, Dynamics 365FO, and as part of this, extensive global reports become even more crucial to the business.




As our new BI consultant, you will be responsible for developing solutions to our existing Microsoft Azure cloud-based data platform and building value-added Power BI reports to ambitious colleagues around the world.




You will be part of our highly qualified, global IT team of 16 dedicated IT professionals. A team where we value an informal environment and pursue strong collaboration to achieve our goals and have fun while doing so - we always support each other in getting the job done. We value personal development and offer the opportunity to take on other responsibilities as you develop in the role.




You will report to Martin Nordestgaard, Team Leader for Global BI and Data Platform. The team currently consists of 2 colleagues. The position is placed at our headquarter in Juelsminde (DK) where you will experience a flexible workday, including the opportunity to work from home.




Responsibilities:

Further develop and maintain our cloud-based data warehouse.
Develop Power BI reports in cooperation with our Finance Business Partners and the existing BI team.
Improve and structure reports based on the principles of storytelling (Strategic -> Analytical -> Informative/Operational).
Delivering high quality analytical solutions after best practices and our governance in BI-development, data modelling and report design.




What do you need to apply?

Our ideal candidate holds a BI background such as for example a cand.merc.BI or equivalent with proven experience in a global company or as a consultant.




Technical skills:
Advanced: Azure SQL DB and T-SQL, Azure Data Factory, analytical data modelling (star schema) and Power BI.
Basic: Microsoft Azure, Azure DevOps.
Basic understanding of ERP-systems and production companies.




As a person, you are a self-starter with a curious and analytical mindset and a constant focus on making progress to deliver a valuable product. As you will be working primarily with internal stakeholders on a variety of reports, you have great interpersonal skills and are able to communicate complex matters on multiple levels.




Additionally, you have a structured way of working, are good at critical thinking and therefore able to troubleshoot systematically.




As we work within a global scope, excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English and Danish are required.




What do we offer you?

A job with unique working conditions, including one extra week of holiday (7th week), health insurance etc., and the possibility of further career development.
A job with profit sharing through an extra pension scheme.
A job in a socially well-functioning atmosphere and informal environment.
A job in an expanding company that combines technological knowledge with practical value generation.
A job in a market leading company with high ESG standards.
A job in an international environment with clients, partners, and colleagues all over the world.




Do you have any questions?

If you want to seize this opportunity, then send us your application and resume. We hold interviews on an ongoing basis. If you would like to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Martin Nordestgaard at tel.: +45 4072 2788.




We are looking forward to hearing from you.

Show more

Title: IT Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Title: IT Analyst

Company: BluEdge

Max Price Rate: Open bid

Location: Copenhagen (DK)

Start Date: 23 Dec 2024

End Date (renewable): 31 Oct 2025

Key Responsibilities


Evaluate existing XBRL-based reporting solutions to ensure adherence to regulations and operational effectiveness.
Create connections and integrations between XBRL reporting systems and other internal or external platforms.
Work closely with finance, compliance, and IT teams to offer recommendations and strategies for enhancing reporting precision and efficiency.


Requirements

Skills & Qualifications


Demonstrated expertise with XBRL-based reporting solutions, preferably in an IT analyst or support capacity (2+ years).
Profound comprehension of XBRL taxonomies, tagging, and associated software tools (e.g., Arelle, Workiva).
Exceptional analytical and critical-thinking abilities with a keen eye for detail.
Proficient communication skills tailored for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with the Danish regulatory landscape and Danish-specific reporting standards is advantageous.
Exposure to ESEF compliance requirements is a plus.
Basic proficiency in programming or scripting languages (e.g., SQL, Python) for data analysis and troubleshooting is advantageous.
Relevant certifications in XBRL or financial data management are beneficial.


Required Skills


XBRL taxonomies
Danish regulatory environment
XBRL-based reporting
Problem-Solving
IT Analyst


Preferred Skills


ESEF compliance requirements
SQL
XBRL or financial data management
Python

Title: Consumer Data Analyst Retail Vertical Denmark
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Would you like to work within the grocery and convenience retail business? In this role, you will work closely with one of the largest retailers in Denmark to help them to make better decisions based on insights and NielsenIQ data.

KEY RESPOBSIBILITIES:


Building a strong partnership with the client and delight the client by delivering analytical insights, presentations and thought leadership in line with commitments
Contributing to client retention by sharing data insights, supporting the client needs within data driven decisions to support their business
Analyzing information and contributing to presentations with other team members. Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Making best in class insights and presentations for category managers, C-level, consumer insights, and other senior stakeholders etc
Taking lead on the account. Set the strategy for the account and secure executing
Building and maintaining yearly joint business plans in close cooperation with the client and secure we reach our financial targets and KPI’s like client satisfaction
Working with NielsenIQ’s tools and systems like Discover, MS Dynamics, and MS Office
Mentoring and guiding junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement
Being onsite with clients (frequency will be decided based on clients’ portfolio, approximately 1-2 day per week)


WHAT IS THE PERFECT CANDIDATE?


Analytical mindset and approach
Ability to draw conclusions from a lot of data, which are to the point and visualized in a simplified way
Focused on details and analysis method
A good listener when it comes to the client-facing part, excellent presentation and communication skills
Highly driven and likes to have a variety of tasks and is adaptable to change


KEY REQUIREMENTS:


Minimum 2-4 years of previous working/or internship experience within the Retail or FMCG industry
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset and/or sales experience in a client-facing role, preferably from the market research industry or from FMCG clients or retailers
Good numerical confidence and ability to translate numbers into insights and recommendations
Strong presentation skills
Ability to work independently when onsite at the client and as a part of a young but ambitious team
Ability to build trust and engage with the client. Strong networking skills and ready to build new relationships with clients
An engaged and ambitious mindset, not afraid of challenging the status quo
Fluent in Danish and English


WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?

Professional Growth - You will have a chance to grow with us, leading important clients in Denmark and facing challenges that will bring you to the next stage in your career. You will get the chance to work on exciting projects with leading industry clients and build a strong network.

Training & Development - You will learn about all the services that NielsenIQ provides. Employees are encouraged to pursue growth opportunities and are provided with professional training to enable them to stay at the forefront of the latest marketing trends.

Benefits - In addition to your salary, we offer a comprehensive non-financial benefits package, including collective agreements (occupational pension and parental leave), access to our office facilities in Hellerup with a nice canteen, and the opportunity to work with a dedicated team and in a collaborative and inclusive work environment.

Great Culture - Our core values are client obsessed, driven to win, accountable for results and committed to integrity. You will experience a dynamic, open, international, and solution-oriented environment where you can simply be yourself.

ARE YOU THE ONE WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

Apply now by clicking the “Apply” button. We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, and we will close the ad once we have hired our new colleague. Therefore, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Benefits - In addition to your salary, we offer a comprehensive non-financial benefits package, including collective agreements (occupational pension and parental leave), access to our office facilities in Hellerup with a nice canteen, and the opportunity to work with a dedicated team and in a collaborative and inclusive work environment.

Great Culture - Our core values are client obsessed, driven to win, accountable for results and committed to integrity. You will experience a dynamic, open, international, and solution-oriented environment where you can simply be yourself.

ARE YOU THE ONE WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

Apply now by clicking the “Apply” button. We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, and we will close the ad once we have hired our new colleague. Therefore, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27839 



Would you like to analyze the links between investment decisions, risk and performance? We are now looking for a quantitative analyst to support our investment teams in delivering risk-optimized outperformance.     

Nordea Asset Management (NAM) is the centre of investment management in the Nordea Group and in the Asset & Wealth Management division. NAM is the largest asset manager in the Nordics with the vision of being a leading European Asset Manager. We want to do this by delivering returns with responsibility. We meet customer demands and guide our customers in the right direction in asset selection while ensuring prudent ESG practices. NAM has around 900 employees and more than 475 Nordic and international institutional clients. 

About this opportunity

Welcome to the Risk and Performance Analysis team. We add value by providing investment insights and analyses. As quantitative analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in providing a solid foundation for making informed investment decisions. 

What you’ll be doing:

Meet with portfolio managers at regular intervals to discuss risk and performance based on your analysis, predominantly in the fixed income domain
Maintain and develop risk and performance analysis tools
Produce internal risk and performance reporting using a combination of in-house tools and vendor-based systems
Perform in-depth investment process reviews, alpha plan reviews, to challenge and develop our investment processes 
Ad-hoc tasks of various nature to support the portfolio managers



You’ll join a close-knit team of 6 specialists with long experience in the field. The role is based in our waterfront offices at Christianshavn, Copenhagen.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  

To do well in this role, we believe that you:

Are analytical by nature
Are self-propelled and persistent to make a multitude of analyses to arrive at good result
Enjoy programming and crunching numbers. Python and SQL are our friends
Have a genuine interest in the fixed income domain
Are a nice colleague - value teamwork and contribute to a great workplace culture 



Your experience and background: 

A solid quantitative background with a higher education in finance, statistics, economics or similar
Basic financial knowledge from a bank, asset manager, hedge fund or similar
Applied statistics experience is advantageous
Fixed income knowledge is also advantageous

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 12/01/2025.  For more information, you are welcome to contact Morten Eddy, morten.eddy@nordea.com 

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at supporting our customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Title: Business Intelligence specialist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join TDC NET’s mission to increase the use of data for automation and decision-making!

TDC NET is taking the next step in our journey as an independent provider of digital infrastructure in Denmark. We aim to create a unified central data warehouse where definitions are aligned, updated, and documented; where data quality is monitored and improved; and where users of all kinds can find or create the insights they need. We are well on our way and are now looking for another skilled team member to contribute tothis goal. As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will play an important role as a sparring partner for the business, helping to address challenges and support decisions with factual insights.

About The Job

Business Intelligence is positioned within our strategy function, and you will join a team of employees with competencies spanning all areas of BI, ranging from junior to senior levels. You will never work alone on a task, and there is plenty of knowledge to draw upon.

We work in an agile manner with a quarterly plan for our overarching priorities, using Kanban daily to handle and prioritize new needs as they arise. Team collaboration is close, as is our partnership with the business on prioritized tasks.

Currently, most data resides within the MS SQL Server stack, and we are transitioning toward Snowflake and dbt.

As part of our BI team, your primary responsibilities will include:


Collaborating with the business to identify the need for new insights.
Modeling the appropriate data products to meet business needs.
Working with the BI team and other data users to further develop the data warehouse.
Visualizing data to simplify access and enhance self-service.


"In the BI team, we focus on the business's needs, and in collaboration with the business, we define various rules and definitions in the data. We create both complex data models and small, quick ad-hoc data deliveries, all of which support the business's needs and requests. There is a wide variety of tasks and challenges, which only makes working with our data more enjoyable. Most importantly, we optimize and automate everything that can be optimized and automated within data processes," says Camilla from the BI team.

About You

We are looking for an experienced SQL Specialist who can transform business needs into insights through data. The focus is on data modeling and data management, requiring an ability to understand complex relationships while maintaining an overview and clear structure. If you can also visualize data, that’s a significant advantage.

You Have


Several years of experience with SQL development in a role where you’ve also handled data modeling and structuring.
Experience with Snowflake and dbt, or with the MS SQL Server stack and a willingness to develop skills in the former.
Visualization skills and possibly experience with Power BI and DAX or another tool to support your work.
A structured approach to tasks, ensuring your code and outputs are understandable and usable by others.
A high level of responsibility for your work by being precise in solutions and communication.
Good collaboration skills that your colleagues notice in daily interactions.
Proficiency in stakeholder management and experience from working in complex organizations.
Skilled in Danish and English.


As a person, you are curious about our business, processes, and technologies. You engage and are keen to join a company that already makes significant use of data and aims to leverage it even further in the future. It’s okay to be a bit of a data nerd - we all are, and we love it.

Join TDC NET and assist us taking the use of data to the next level. We look forward to your application!

Contact

If you have questions about the position or want to know more about what it means to work at TDC NET, feel free to reach out to Department Director, Carsten Fogh Madsen, on +45 20200600. We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our team at TDC NET.

Location:

Teglholmsgade 1, Copenhagen or Sletvej 30, Aarhus

Process

We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than 20 January 2025.

You can expect to hear from us within 3 weeks from the application date.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job as Quantitative Analyst

As our new Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading and a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Minimum 2 years of experience from a similar role or top of your university class
Quantitative background in Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, etc.
Master machine learning and data-science fundamentals
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytic skills and an eye for detail
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 175 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day become partner
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, Supply Chain
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about working in the interface between Supply Chain and Digital Data Organization while building the Business Intelligence solutions to make crucial decisions in LEGO® Operations?

Then bring your strong Business Intelligence (BI) skills, analytical mindset and stakeholder management capabilities into play in this role and help us playing a strong part in the provisioning of solid data solutions within a truly global organization!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities

In this role as Senior BI Analyst, you will be responsible for the data connectivity and global reporting solutions for allocated user groups within the Global Supply Chain Operations. You will act as an interface between business stakeholders in Supply Chain and our Digital Data Organization, to both translate business needs to IT requirements as well as create and influence business intelligence solutions to suit the digital data tool roadmap. Furthermore, you will support team priority activities related to new BI platforms and business developments. More specifically, you will





Secure accessible and reliable data across the Supply Chain information areas through data platforms like Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Automate and SAP Analysis for Office (AfO)
Develop and maintain global Power BI reporting and dataflow solutions used across wider user groups in Operations, Finance and Markets & Channels
Partner directly with supply chain colleagues to co-create a clear roadmap based on key business requirements to deliver both new and improved reporting solutions for use in critical business decision making.
Provide data governance across data assets and Power BI reports and give timely support to end-users when requested
Collaborate with Digital BI engineers to bridge the data requirements from colleagues in Operations
Understand tools and trends within the BI area to apply the newest specialist knowledge within Supply Chain




Play your part in our team succeeding

You will join the Supply Chain Business Intelligence team playing a crucial role in the Global Supply Chain Operations (GSCO) department, by enabling the broader Operations organization in driving the integrity and developments of reports and analysis used in LEGO® Operations.

The team is primarily located in LEGO Campus, Billund and consists of 7 highly skilled and dedicated colleagues with great diversity in terms of educational backgrounds, nationalities, age groups, experience levels, etc.

Do you have what it takes?

The ideal candidate comes with 2+ years of proven experience with Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse building data models for reporting purposes. Experience with Supply Chain & Operations and Demand Management will be an advantage. In addition, you have





Minimum BSc in Supply Chain, Business Intelligence, Business Science or equivalent educational fields
Proficiency in Microsoft Power BI including DAX programming and the overall Power Platform
Strong analytical, data management and problem-solving skills with core ability to spot end-to-end perspectives and solutions
Effective and confident communication, collaboration and networking skills to build strong business relationships
Experience with Databricks, SQL and SAP will be an advantage




As a person, you are a true team player contributing and collaborating closely with colleagues, while bringing a strong curiosity and collaborative mindset following a passion about solving user needs and making sure that we all succeed together!

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Student Analyst for Analytics in Personal Banking (PeB)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID:  26990   

Would you like to work with Business Intelligence to understand the past, present and the future? We are now looking for a Student Analyst to join the PeB Analytics team within PeB Denmark. You will play a key role in developing the bank’s use of BI through Power BI, to ensure that we use facts to take the right decisions and develop the right solutions. The need to use BI is a strategic asset in ways of working  and enabling stakeholders with data-driven actionable actions.  The PeB Analytics team is part of Personal Banking and have a fundamental role in developing the banks understanding of data and analytics from a customer centric point of view to support the full customer journey.

  

About our team     

Working in PeB Analytics you will be in the heart of everything we do in Personal Banking. From strategy projects, to actionable business/customer analysis and to make relevant engagement towards Nordea’s customers. We support key business stakeholders with a data driven approach making their everyday easy to take actions towards creating positive customer experience and business development.

  

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.    

  

What you’ll be doing    

To find pleasure in the job you have a keen eye on the visual experience and are eager to apply business understanding to our Power BI reports.  Main responsibilities in this role:

Develop and maintaining Power BI reports
Support stakeholder in utilizing Power BI
Document solution requirements and data
Enable automized ways of working for stakeholders with clear definitions and actions

  

Who you are    

This is the right role for you if you are self-driven and feel comfortable engaging with stakeholders across the organization. You are good at communications and strive deliver within expected time lines.You have minimum 2-3 years left of a relevant Bachelor's (BSc) / Master's degree (MSc) within IT, economics, finance or a similar technical discipline. 

  

Your background and skills include:

Experience with design and maintaining data reports. Using SQL is a must
Experience with Power BI is a plus, but eager to learn can compensate
Willingness to learn and apply Dax language
Experience working with stakeholders in regards of stakeholder management and expectations
We are a Nordic company but the organization is Danish therefore to be able to speak and write Danish is a plus

  

What we offer    

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.  

 

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.  

 

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.   

 

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.  

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps    

Submit your application no later than 07/01/2025.   

 

For more information, you’re welcome to contact Martin Zinglersen at martin.zinglersen@nordea.com.  

  

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.  

 

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.  

 

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.   

 

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.   

 

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Title: Bi & Data Analyst til afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Motiveres du af udvikling, store datamængder og analyser, der skaber reel værdi? Vil du arbejde med data fra kildesystemerne helt ud til brugerne? Hvis ja, tilbyder vi dig muligheden for at blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk fællesskab, hvor lysten til udvikling og optimering er essentielt, og hvor vi sammen bygger fremtidens løsninger.




Rollen og hvad du kan forvente

Hos MineTilbud er afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi en central partner for alle forretningsområder, fra marketing, salg og drift til IT-udvikling. Vores fokus er at levere de rette data, på det rette tidspunkt, til de rette modtagere. For at styrke vores forretning med faktabaseret ledelse og databårne beslutninger søger vi en forretningsorienteret BI & Data Analyst, der brænder for at forstå, optimere og visualisere forretningsdata i høj kvalitet. Størstedelen af dit arbejde vil foregå i PowerBI og Excel, hvor du skal udtrække data fra vores underliggende datawarehouse, som ligger i Amazon Web Services, og illustrere det i PowerBI.

Som det første teammedlem i afdelingen udover virksomhedens chef for Økonomi og Strategi vil du arbejde i tæt kontakt med både CEO og det øvrige ledelsesteam. Du får en central rolle med stor kontaktflade, og i takt med områdets udvikling får du mulighed for at præge det fremtidige BI-landskab og forme din rolle i denne udvikling.




Primære arbejdsopgaver

Modellering og effektivisering af data
Implementering af forretningslogik i Power BI
Udledning af forretningsindsigt fra forskellige datakilder
Udarbejdelse af rapporteringsløsninger
Visualisering og formidling af data til brug for forretningsdrift og udvikling
Være en engageret kollega, der bidrager til et stærkt fællesskab




Din baggrund og kvalifikationer

For at være den rette til denne rolle er det en forudsætning, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du i minimum 2 år har arbejdet med Power BI og haft tæt kontakt med interne stakeholders. Du har en relevant uddannelse på BSc- eller MSc-niveau og en stærk kommerciel forståelse.




Som person er du nysgerrig og opsøgende, har gode kommunikationsevner og lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vækst og udvikling er i fokus. Du er selvstændig, detaljeorienteret og har en struktureret og resultatorienteret tilgang til opgaver. Erfaring med Amazon Web Services er en fordel. Da North Media primært er en dansk virksomhed, er det et krav, at du behersker dansk og engelsk flydende, både mundtligt og skriftligt.




Den der kan og vil og gør, får også lov

Du bliver en del af en dynamisk og innovativ virksomhed i rivende udvikling. Vi er en arbejdsplads med dedikerede og dygtige kollegaer og en uformel omgangstone. Med det rette engagement får du stor indflydelse på din hverdag. Vi tilbyder lækker frokost- og frugtordning, mulighed for at tage aftensmad med hjem, kaffe og te ad libitum fra vores café, træningsfaciliteter i eget motionsrum samt diverse sociale arrangementer.




For mere information om rollen og hvorfor det at arbejde hos MineTilbud gør dig til en del af et stærkt, udviklende og inkluderende fællesskab, kan du kontakte Mayse Lind, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, på telefon +45 2154 9818. Vi afholder samtaler løbende og opfordrer interesserede kandidater til at søge snarest muligt.




Om MineTilbud

MineTilbud tilbyder en stærk medieplatform og teknologi, der giver retailers, brands og e-commercere mulighed for at tage del i hele kunderejsen ved at udkomme med relevant indhold på tværs af platforme. MineTilbud er en virksomhed med en skalerbar volumenforretning og et fundament bygget på effektiv håndtering af store mængder materiale og data – hurtigt, sikkert og til en lav enhedspris. Vi står over for spændende forandringer og udviklingsprojekter, hvor vores store datamængder spiller en central rolle i at forstå og styre forretningen. Som BI & Data Analyst får du en unik mulighed for at påvirke virksomhedens fremtid og bidrage til databaserede beslutninger.




MineTilbud er ejet af North Media A/S, hvis selskaber udvikler og driver platforme til transaktioner mellem erhvervslivet og forbrugerne inden for tilbud fra detailhandlen, lejeboliger, jobannoncering og digitale adgangssystemer. North Media A/S er børsnoteret på Nasdaq Copenhagen.

Title: IT Analyst for Traded Data Services
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27788

 

Would you like to be part of a combined business and technology team located on the trading floor in our Copenhagen office? You will be responsible for providing data design patterns and integration that enable different systems to interact and exchange information across the whole bank. We are looking for an innovative IT analyst to work with our strategic data sources for the financial transactions value chain.

 

This is a chance for you to join a team of experienced data design specialists with in-depth financial business knowledge who contribute to the success of key initiatives and projects in Nordea. So, bring your skills, ideas and curiosity and team up with us. We offer plenty of opportunities to learn and grow in areas like financial transactions, requirement and analysis practices, data structure modelling and integration technologies.

 

You’ll join a multinational team of professionals that have fun at work. The role is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

 

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank; we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.



About our team

 

Welcome to Trading Data Services within Markets and Traded Products Technology at Nordea. Our team is responsible for providing data and integration solutions across the bank through its messaging platforms (Kafka), standardized APIs, and operational data stores.

 

You will become a member of our agile cross-functional team of talented people. Working from our base in Copenhagen, where we enjoy meeting in the office, you will be cooperating with our IT and business teams across Large Corporates & Institutions in all our locations.

 

Your future responsibilities

 

You will act as the link between our technical teams and business areas, enabling good communication of the business requirements and data design decisions in an accurate manner. You will also support other teams in onboarding to our systems while ensuring that the team delivers the right functionality for the business. You must be able to do both very hands-on daily tasks and manage the deliveries with various stakeholders and teams, and you should be used to working towards demanding deadlines.

 

This position will be a great opportunity for candidates who are looking for exciting work in a complex and fast-paced environment in a technology department closely anchored with its business partners.

 

You will join a team where people are the most important and work is not only a place to go! We take pride in what we do, prioritize a learning culture, and strive to have fun in our daily work.

 

What you’ll be doing:

Develop data formats and models for the financial transactions value stream in accordance with our data strategy
Provide technical support to new data providers in preparing and setting up new operational data stores and public topics on the messaging platform
Offer guidance to existing data providers when changes to formatting and data structures are needed to ensure the data governance model is followed
Support existing and new data consumers to identify the necessary data, to understand data formatting and structure, and to document potential issues in the available data
In collaboration with other teams, ensure to improve data quality, increase data completeness, avoid duplications and continuously keeping the overview of data updated

 

Who you are

 

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

 

You have as well knowledge/skills within:

An interest in data strategy and financial products
Find motivation when working in a challenging and fast paced environment
Having great attention to details while also seeing the bigger picture
Stay curious to understand how the detail connects to the greater picture
A true team player and put the team’s goals ahead of the individual

 

Your background and skills include:

Relevant university qualifications or work experience, preferably with some database or coding experience
Experience with Data Management and Data Integration is an advantage but not a requirement
Enjoy interaction with other people
Fluency in English (written and spoken)

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next Steps

 

Submit your application no later than 01/01/2025. For more information, you are welcome to contact Henning Eriksen (Henning.Eriksen@nordea.com) for this opportunity related queries and Ritu Mittal (ritu.mittal@consult.nordea.com) for HR related matters.

 

What we offer



Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

 

People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

 

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

 

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

 

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

 

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.  

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

 

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

 

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

 

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

 

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

 

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

 

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

 

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.

Title: Lead Data/IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 24876  

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating a new cloud environment where we’re harnessing the power of near real time data – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  About this opportunity To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

 

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you’ll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

 

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.  What you’ll be doing:

Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis



The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.  Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team



Your experience and background: 

Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups



If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

 

Submit your application no later than 14/12/2024. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com

 

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.  Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

 

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.
