Title: Open Source Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about intelligence analysis? Do you want to be part of a cutting-edge team fighting counterfeit medicines and other physical security risks? We are seeking a best-in-class experienced Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT) Analyst to join Novo Nordisk’s Global Security Intelligence team.

If you have a natural curiosity and the ability to solve complex intelligence problems, read more and apply today for a life-changing career.

The position
The OSINT Analyst role presents a unique opportunity to contribute to our physical security team by leveraging open-source intelligence to combat counterfeit medicines, and other physical security threats to Novo Nordisk’s people, facilities, and medicines. As part of this dynamic and innovative team, you will play a pivotal role in investigating physical security threats, supporting due diligence activities, and shaping the development of OSINT practices across our Global Security programme.

Some of your responsibilities will be to:



Utilize cutting-edge tools and techniques to gather critical information from publicly available sources, covering a wide array of topics such as physical security threats, pharmaceutical crimes, due diligence, and investigations.
Analyse collected data to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights that inform strategic decision-making. Prepare comprehensive reports, briefings, and presentations to effectively share analysis with pertinent stakeholders.
Contribute to the design and advancement of OSINT practices, playing a vital role in bolstering Novo Nordisk’s Global Security programme across product, people, and facilities security, as well as crisis management.
Stay informed about the latest OSINT tools, techniques, and best practices, and provide mentorship and support to empower team members in the effective application of OSINT methodologies.




Qualifications



Master’s degree in Intelligence or a related field would be advantageous, not essential.
OSINT certifications would be advantageous.
Proven experience (3+ years) in OSINT analysis, preferably within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.
Experience with intelligence analysis tools and platforms (e.g., ShadowDragon, Maltego, Strider, Nexis Diligence).
Experience in OSINT problem solving.




As a person, you embody relentless curiosity and problem-solving skills. Your strong analytical thinking, paired with excellent research and data analysis capabilities, ensures that you uncover valuable insights. Proficient in OSINT tools and techniques, you adeptly leverage open-source intelligence. Your strong communication skills and foundational knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry make complex information clear and concise, fostering informed decision-making.

About The Department

The Global Intelligence team is part of Novo Nordisk’s Global Security team, and focuses on helping the company understand and navigate physical security threats, such as those linked to geopolitical risk, crisis situations, and economic espionage threats.

Deadline
Please apply before 20th December.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

Please note that only applications in English will be considered.

Working at Novo Nordisk
Novo Nordisk is a leading global healthcare company with a 100-year legacy of driving change to defeat serious chronic diseases. Building on our strong legacy within diabetes, we are growing massively and expanding our commitment, reaching millions around the world and impacting more than 40 million patient lives daily. All of this has made us one of the 20 most valuable companies in the world by market cap. Our success relies on the joint potential and collaboration of our more than 63,000 employees around the world.

We recognise the importance of the unique skills and perspectives our people bring to the table, and we work continuously to bring out the best in them. Working at Novo Nordisk, we're working toward something bigger than ourselves, and it's a collective effort. Join us! Together, we go further. Together, we're life changing.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Analytics Engineer for Analytics in Personal Banking (PeB) Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 26989 

 

We are growing our team in PeB Analytics in Denmark. We are looking for a person that loves working with data and analysis to join our existing Analytics team. In PeB we are a group of specialists in various fields: everything from digital marketing and content production to web analysis and data science. Collectively, we are responsible for engaging new and existing personal customers in digital and offline channels, and driving sales and engagement.



Every day, we work hard to ensure that each individual customer in Nordea receives personalized follow-up and advice. We relevant at the right time in a personalised approach. Joining us means you’ll have an impact on how we do banking – today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.



About this opportunity



This is a role within Personal Banking Analytics Denmark / Personal Banking Denmark. 

 

In Personal Banking we are building the omnichannel customer journey seamless experience and for that we need to connect different data sources across our platforms and applications. We want to send relevant personalised messages to our customers offering the right product or service, in the right channel, at the right time. 

 

We are looking for a curious and driven Analytics Engineer that is responsible for development and maintenance of local data storage to enable data availability and efficient utilization possibilities for local analytics team members. You will be providing clean, accurate and high quality datasets. These tasks are crucial part of implementing our Data and Analytics Strategy. You will collaborate with pears from a Nordic point of view to drive these initiatives from a Nordic Scale point of view.

Joining the team will provide you with opportunities to use your experience with data management, data analysis, data engineering and business analysis, to support data-savvy end-users. 

What you will be doing:

 

As the Analytics Engineer, you will empower end users to answer their own questions regarding for instance product portfolio analysis, sales funnels, campaign performance and customer segmentation. You will be working on setting up clean data sets and data modelling/structure that allows us to have the same view across different teams. This means making use of the infrastructure available in Nordea to write data transformation jobs through code and create reusable data assets for analysts and data scientists that get updated in an automated way with a given frequency.

 

In addition you will be:  

Extracting the underlying data from existing databases and centralizing it to a local data storage 
Drive Data Strategy with Nordic initiatives 
Writing (complex) data transformations in SQL, using the available data build tools in Nordea, that will create the metrics needed for the analysts. 
Documenting the process for building the different data sets to ensure a high quality foundation for data analysist/scientists. Maintaining data documentation and definitions.
Collaborating very close with Data Scientists and Business requestors within PeB Denmark and Nordic counterparties
Participating actively in development initiatives within Digital Sales teams to expand the usage of data in marketing campaigns.  
Supporting the maintenance or development of reports and analysis tools (e.g. PowerBI & java-applications) 

 

Who you are

 

You are a person who understands data. You can analyse it to answer queries, but also understand where potential limitations exist and can creatively resolve them in either a tactical or strategic manner. You have a blended profile of skills and mindset of a data engineer, data scientist and a data analyst. You take ownership of your tasks, and enjoy data gathering, cleaning, engineering, and documenting as you build.

 

You have good interpersonal and communication skills to ask the right questions to stakeholders and colleagues. You are comfortable working on your own but also as part of a small team. You thrive in a cross-functional set up.

 

To build a successful career with us, you’ll work well with others and always act with customer’s needs in mind. You love learning and trying new things, and you’re excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You’re honest and reliable. You’re passionate about doing a great job.  

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Have knowledge of software/data engineering best practices
Can sketch a data model/data structure and implement it
Are able to clearly communicate complex issues in an easy and understandable manner to a wide range of stakeholders
Are a team player - work closely with other specialists, involve stakeholders always asking questions and investigating alternative solutions
Are innovative, openminded and excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You strive for continuous improvement and love learning and trying out new things. You’re dependable, willing to speak up even when it’s difficult, and committed to empowering others

 

Your experience and background:

Academic degree in highly quantitative discipline or specialisation such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Software Engineering
2-3 years of experience working in data-driven landscapes. Ideally you have experience as a data engineer and have discovered the business aspect, or you have been working as a data analyst and have strong tech experience
Strong SQL skills, applied knowledge of Java
Proficient in written and spoken English
To be able to write and speak Danish is a advantage

 

Your application will benefit from demonstrating experience in the below:

You know your ways around tools like Snowflake, Git and Power BI
Skills in web frameworks such as Angular
Experience in data analysis, e.g. Python & R
You understand the principles of working with an Agile development approach.
Skills in written and spoken Finnish

  

The role is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch! 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 10/01/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Head of Analytics Personal Banking DK, Martin Zinglersen on martin.zinglersen@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

 

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

  • Can sketch a data model/data structure and implement it

  • To be able to write and speak Danish is a advantage

 

Your application will benefit from demonstrating experience in the below:

  • You know your ways around tools like Snowflake, Git and Power BI

Submit your application no later than 10/01/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Head of Analytics Personal Banking DK, Martin Zinglersen on martin.zinglersen@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
📊 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Analytics Engineer to join our Data Modeling team, currently composed of 2 analytics engineers.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as an Analytics Engineer

As an Analytics Engineer, you will play a key role in transforming raw data into meaningful insights, ensuring data is not only accessible but also actionable for decision-makers across the organization. Your expertise will enable scalable analytics and reporting solutions, empowering stakeholders to drive business growth with confidence.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Designing and maintaining scalable data models and datasets for business reporting and analysis.
Developing and optimize dbt transformations for clean, reliable data.
Collaborating with Data Modeling and Data Platform teams for smooth data integration and pipeline efficiency.
Building and maintaining dashboards and visualizations in Looker or Tableau, tailored to business needs.
Working with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into insights.
Ensuring data integrity through validation and monitoring.
Promoting data literacy and self-service analytics across the organization.
Contributing to the improvement of our analytics stack and workflows.


🙌 Your profile

You will be a good fit to join the team if:


You have 3+ years of experience in an Analytics Engineer or similar role (Data Analyst, BI Developer, Data Engineer).
You're proficient in Python and SQL, with a strong understanding of complex data transformations.
You have expertise in data modeling and visualization tools (e.g., dbt, Looker, Tableau).
You’re familiar with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
You can communicate complex data concepts in a clear, concise, and actionable manner.
You possess a strong product sense and can empathize with business needs and customer challenges.
You thrive in a collaborative environment, enjoy teamwork, and learn from others.
You’re fluent in English, both written and spoken (Ageras is an international team!).
You’re available to work from our office in Copenhagen.


💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 30’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to get to know each other and tell you more about Ageras.

2️⃣ A 30’ discussion with August (Lead Analytics Engineer) to talk about your previous experiences and the role we’re offering.

3️⃣ A 45’ business case presentation to assess your technical skills, followed by a 45’ meeting with the team.
Show more

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as an Analytics Engineer

As an Analytics Engineer, you will play a key role in transforming raw data into meaningful insights, ensuring data is not only accessible but also actionable for decision-makers across the organization. Your expertise will enable scalable analytics and reporting solutions, empowering stakeholders to drive business growth with confidence.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

  • Designing and maintaining scalable data models and datasets for business reporting and analysis.
  • Developing and optimize dbt transformations for clean, reliable data.
  • Collaborating with Data Modeling and Data Platform teams for smooth data integration and pipeline efficiency.
  • Building and maintaining dashboards and visualizations in Looker or Tableau, tailored to business needs.
  • Working with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into insights.
  • Ensuring data integrity through validation and monitoring.
  • Promoting data literacy and self-service analytics across the organization.
  • Contributing to the improvement of our analytics stack and workflows.

🙌 Your profile

You will be a good fit to join the team if:

  • You have 3+ years of experience in an Analytics Engineer or similar role (Data Analyst, BI Developer, Data Engineer).
  • You're proficient in Python and SQL, with a strong understanding of complex data transformations.
  • You have expertise in data modeling and visualization tools (e.g., dbt, Looker, Tableau).
  • You’re familiar with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • You can communicate complex data concepts in a clear, concise, and actionable manner.
  • You possess a strong product sense and can empathize with business needs and customer challenges.
  • You thrive in a collaborative environment, enjoy teamwork, and learn from others.
  • You’re fluent in English, both written and spoken (Ageras is an international team!).
  • You’re available to work from our office in Copenhagen.

💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 30’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to get to know each other and tell you more about Ageras.

2️⃣ A 30’ discussion with August (Lead Analytics Engineer) to talk about your previous experiences and the role we’re offering.

3️⃣ A 45’ business case presentation to assess your technical skills, followed by a 45’ meeting with the team.

Title: Quantitative analyst
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bliv en del af vores team i Modellering & Innovation, hvor vi udvikler og driver komplekse modeller til præcise forsikringsberegninger og strategisk styring. Vær med til at forme fremtidens forsikringsløsninger.

Vi har bedt din kommende leder om at sætte ord på jobbet og opgaverneVores "kunder" er Aktuariatet, investerings- og finansafdelingerne samt ledelse og direktion. Modellering & Innovation, som er en del af Aktuar & Analyse i Velliv, har et mål om at blive set som en forretningspartner, der med dataindsigt, analytiske kompetencer og forretningsforståelse, bidrager med finansiel viden og understøtter Vellivs væsentlige beslutningsprocesser med fakta og analyser.

Dine primære opgaver bliver:


Videreudvikle og forfine teknisk fundament for hensættelsesmodeller og solvensmodel
Drift af solvens- og hensættelsesmodellerne
Rapportering på baggrund af ovenstående modeller.


Du har forudsætningerne og modet til mere

Der er styrke i forskellighed. Vi bliver bedre af at bringe forskellige erfaringer, fagligheder og personligheder sammen. Derfor opfordrer vi til, at alle uanset baggrund sender en ansøgning. Vi vurderer dog, at der er nogle grundlæggende forudsætninger, som er vigtige for at lykkes i jobbet:


En kandidatgrad i forsikringsmatematik, matematik-økonomi, statistik eller tilsvarende
Ca. 1-3 års erfaring fra en tilsvarende stilling
Solide analytiske egenskaber
Professionelle mundtlige og skriftlige dansk- og engelskkundskaber
Kendskab til C# eller lignende objektorienteret sprog er ikke et krav, men det er en forudsætning at du har en grundlæggende interesse for objektorienteret programmering.


Sådan oplever en af dine nye kolleger afdelingenDu vil blive en del af et team på 5 fagligt dygtige medarbejdere. Vi er en lille afdeling med fokus på godt arbejdsklima og faglige udfordringer. Vi anvender primært C# som værktøj til vores modeller og analyser. Modellerne er lavet i state-of-the-art C# kode, så her vil du have mulighed for at udvikle et højt fagligt niveau. Vi bruger derudover Git og andre moderne værktøjer til vores arbejde. // Martin Rebild, Quantitative analyst

Plads til at være menneske – plads til at være digVelliv er to år i træk blevet kåret til at have branchens bedste medarbejderimage og har gennem flere år vundet prisen som Årets Pensionsselskab. Hos os bliver du mødt med åbne arme, og vi gør os umage for, at du kommer godt fra start og hurtigt falder til.

Du får en buddy, der hjælper dig i gang, og en leder, der bidrager med mening, udvikling og retning. Du har mulighed for at melde dig ind i ”Klub Velliv” og deltage i aktiviteter inden for sport, mad, hobby og kultur for os medarbejdere og vores børn. I det hele taget kan du forvente en kultur, hvor vi lever vores tre kerneværdier: Optimisme, Ordentlighed og Omsorg. I Velliv skal der være plads til at være menneske – plads til at være dig.

Vi holder samtaler løbende

Send dit CV og et par ord om dig selv og din baggrund i en kort ansøgning. Vi vil gerne høre fra dig senest den 26. januar, men vi holder samtaler løbende, så send gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, kan du kontakte Johannes Müller på telefon +45 25277479 eller johannes.m@velliv.dk.

Vil du lære Velliv bedre at kende? Læs mere her
Show more

Title: Senior Analyst - Value-Add Infrastructure Fund, Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
THE CLIENT

A well-established investment firm operating across value-add infrastructure space, with a track record of owning and operating businesses across emerging markets, notably MENA and APAC regions. Currently raising their third fund which will be targeting value-add infrastructure businesses across OECD countries.

With offices across Europe, Middle East and Asia, the investment team in Copenhagen is looking to hire a Senior Investment Analyst to work on investments and asset management.




THE ROLE

Senior Analyst will be based in Copenhagen, working as part of a global investment team and collaborating with colleagues in Asia and Middle East on acquiring new businesses and developing existing portfolio assets.




Key responsibilities include:

Participating in the investment process and delivering critical insights through financial analysis, due diligence, structuring and financing
Assisting with the preparation and evaluation of investment proposals, including Investment Committee papers
Leading the valuation workstream for new investment opportunities by building and maintaining financial and operational models
Assisting with the financial, technical, commercial, legal due diligence workstreams
Assisting with the preparation and presentation of regular updates and reporting on development of portfolio investments
Playing an active role in the monitoring and valuation of portfolio companies alongside investment and company management teams
Involvement in the preparation and provision of accurate and timely reporting, including asset valuations, to investors
Carrying out portfolio data analysis and financial modelling
Conducting relevant macroeconomic, industry, market and other research




THE CANDIDATE

The firm is looking for a team player who thrives in international environment and has appetite to learn, grow and develop in their role. The ideal candidate will have:




2-3 years’ experience in M&A or Debt Advisory, Private Equity, or Consulting
Experience/an understanding of the infrastructure asset class considered a plus, specifically in Transportation and Energy / Energy Transition related sectors
Strong quantitative/numerical skills - advanced financial and operational modelling skills
Strong academic track record, including a Bachelor’s degree covering Economics, Mathematics, Engineering or another quantitative subject
A strong team player who shares the company’s cultural values
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Able to work effectively and collaboratively with different members of the team
Fluency in additional European languages appreciated

Title: One or more positions as Associate Professor in Mathematics, Statistics or Mathematical Economics (2024-224-06121)
Description:
The Department of Mathematical Sciences conducts research in a wide range of mathematical disciplines and has three study programs: Mathematics(including a specialization in statistics at the master level), mathematical economics, and mathematics-technology.

The department offers an international and informal working environment. The department is proud of its long tradition of good social relations and collaboration among colleagues. Employees at the department have good opportunities to shape the direction of their professional activities.

Research Will Be Within One(or More) Of The Areas


Mathematics(preferably within the current research areas of the department)
Statistics(preferably within the current research areas of the department)
Mathematical economics(preferably mathematical finance and econometrics).


Teaching will primarily be in mathematics and/or statistics, but also in other study programs at the University.

Read more about the Department of Mathematical Sciences here: https://www.math.aau.dk/english

Qualification Requirements

The level of qualification for Associate Professors shall correspond to the level which can be achieved on the basis of the appointment as Assistant Professor but may be achievable in other ways. The appointment presupposes that the applicant can demonstrate original scientific production at an international level as well as documented teaching qualifications. Appointment to the position requires that both research and teaching qualifications are at the requested level. The two qualifications will be given equal and principal priority in the overall assessment.

The Application Must Contain The Following


A motivated text wherein the reasons for applying, qualifications in relation to the position, and intentions and visions for the position are stated.
A current curriculum vitae.
Copies of relevant diplomas(Master of Science and PhD– both in English).
Scientific qualifications. A complete list of publications must be attached with an indication of the works the applicant wishes to be considered. You may attach up to 10 publications.
Teaching qualifications described in the teaching portfolio. If this is not enclosed the applicant must include an explanation for its absence.
Applicants are encouraged to document personal awards and track record of external funding.
Dissemination qualifications, including participation on committees or boards, participation in organisations and the like.
Additional qualifications in relation to the position.
A list of people whom we could contact and ask for references.
Personal data.


The applications are only to be submitted online by using the"Apply online" button below.

Assessment

The assessment of applicants for the position will be carried out by an assessment committee.

Shortlisting will be applied. This means that the head of the department, with the assistance of the hiring committee, will select candidates for assessment. Candidates selected for assessment will then be informed about the composition of the assessment committee. All candidates will be notified whether they have been shortlisted for assessment or not.

Applicants who are selected for assessment will have the opportunity to comment on their assessment.

When the hiring process is completed, a final rejection will be sent to the applicants who are not considered for the position.

Contact information

You may obtain further professional information from the Head of the Department, Professor Morten Willatzen, mowi@math.aau.dk, phone(+45) 9940 8469.

For further information concerning the application procedure please contact HR-Support by mail est-ef-hr@adm.aau.dk.

Information regarding guidelines, ministerial circular in force, teaching portfolio and procedures can be seenhere.

AAU wishes to reflect the diversity of society and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background or belief.

The hiring process at Aalborg University may include a risk assessment as a tool to identify potential risks associated with new hires, ensuring the safety, compliance, and integrity of the workplace.

Wages and employment

The employment is in accordance with the Ministerial Order on the Appointment of Academic Staff at Universities(the Appointment Order) and the Ministerial Order on Job Structure for Academic Staff at Universities. Salary and terms of employment are in accordance with the collective agreement between the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations and the state(AC collective agreement)(only in Danish) and circular concerning protocol on certain terms of employment of academic staff at universities(only in Danish).

The employment is in accordance with the Ministerial Order on the Appointment of Academic Staff at Universities(the Appointment Order) and the Ministerial Order on Job Structure for Academic Staff at Universities. Salary and terms of employment are in accordance with the collective agreement between the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations and the state(AC collective agreement)(only in Danish) and circular concerning protocol on certain terms of employment of academic staff at universities(only in Danish).

Ref number

2024-224-06121

Deadline

26.02.2025

Title: Senior AI Data Platform & Assets Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27378 

 

Are you ready to help shape the future of AI & Generative AI at Scandinavia’s largest bank, working alongside a dynamic, fast-paced team?

 

The Group AI Center of Excellence is an established unit within Group Data Management focusing on delivering and enabling generative AI use cases across the organisation. The unit provides reusable AI Assets that are developed in conjunction with business stakeholders to be leveraged by a wide variety of use cases.

 

We are now looking for a Senior AI Platform & Asset Analyst who is interested in working in the field of Generative AI with use-cases across the bank. You will work closely with data scientists, data architects, and business stakeholders to guarantee the implementation of the AI Platform and the underlying Assets and Services.

 

About this opportunity

 

Welcome to the Applied Data Science team. Your passion for working with people from both a technical and a business background, coupled with your curiosity for AI and new innovations like Generative AI, makes you well-suited for this position. As Nordea pioneers its way into an AI and Gen AI driven future, you will thrive by embracing a dynamic environment, fostering collaboration, and maintaining an open and adaptable mindset.

 

What you will be doing:

Collect, prioritize and translate use case functional and non-functional requirements into technical solutions and capabilities
Define AI Assets, Services and Platform roadmap, planning enhancements ensuring alignment with business needs
Design and build reusable AI Assets and Services to accelerate use case development and deployment
Support the implementation MLOPs practices to streamline advanced analytics use case development and deployment

 

Our AI team culture is built on collaboration, continuous learning and innovation. We foster an open environment where diverse ideas thrive, encouraging everyone to push the boundaries of technology while supporting each other´s growth. With a strong focus on well-being, we prioritize work-life balance and encourage open communication.

 

At Nordea, inclusion and diversity are at the heart of our values. We believe that a diverse workforce drives innovation, fosters creativity and creates a more supportive workplace for all. The role is based in Høje Taastrup, Helsinki, or Stockholm.

 

Who you are



Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.    

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Embrace a growth mindset, where you enjoy taking initiative and bringing solutions
Enjoy problem solving and tackling challenges
Are an awesome team member and you have a strong ability to inspire people to take action

 

Your experience and background:

MSc or PHD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, relevant technical field
10+ years of experience in Platform Owner, Technical Product Owner or similar role
Experience working with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP), especially their serverless, generative AI (e.g. AWS Bedrock), ML (e.g. AWS SageMaker), or data storage services, as well as Infrastructure as Code (IaC), containerisation, container orchestration and shell scripting
Proficiency in architecture design, concepts and tooling (e.g. Data Ingestion, Data Warehousing, MLOPs, Hardware and Infrastructure etc.)
Strong understanding of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL), ETL/ELT processes, and data integration tools
Experience in Generative AI tooling and software (Large Language Models, Embeddings Models, Multi-Modal, Large Vision Models)
Strong execution skills and problem-solving ability with a collaborative and goal-oriented mindset

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch! 

Next steps

 

We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 31/12/2024. We will ongoingly be reviewing applications and conducting interviews as we receive them, and might close the recruitment process before the posting end date. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.

 

If you have any questions about the role or this recruitment process, please reach out to our tech recruiter and main point of contact Anna Dahlström, anna.dahlstrom@consult.nordea.com.



At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

 

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.com or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

If this sounds like you, get in touch! 

Next steps

 

We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 31/12/2024. We will ongoingly be reviewing applications and conducting interviews as we receive them, and might close the recruitment process before the posting end date. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.

 

If you have any questions about the role or this recruitment process, please reach out to our tech recruiter and main point of contact Anna Dahlström, anna.dahlstrom@consult.nordea.com.



At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

 

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.com or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Data at Ageras 👨‍💻

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Analytics Engineer to join our Data Modeling team, currently composed of 2 analytics engineers.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!




Your Role as an Analytics Engineer 👋

As an Analytics Engineer, you will play a key role in transforming raw data into meaningful insights, ensuring data is not only accessible but also actionable for decision-makers across the organization. Your expertise will enable scalable analytics and reporting solutions, empowering stakeholders to drive business growth with confidence.




Your responsibilities will include:

Designing and maintaining scalable data models and datasets for business reporting and analysis.
Developing and optimize dbt transformations for clean, reliable data.
Collaborating with Data Modeling and Data Platform teams for smooth data integration and pipeline efficiency.
Building and maintaining dashboards and visualizations in Looker or Tableau, tailored to business needs.
Working with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into insights.
Ensuring data integrity through validation and monitoring.
Promoting data literacy and self-service analytics across the organization.
Contributing to the improvement of our analytics stack and workflows.




It’s a match if :

You have 3+ years of experience in an Analytics Engineer or similar role (Data Analyst, BI Developer, Data Engineer).
You're proficient in Python and SQL, with a strong understanding of complex data transformations.
You have expertise in data modeling and visualization tools (e.g., dbt, Looker, Tableau).
You’re familiar with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
You can communicate complex data concepts in a clear, concise, and actionable manner.
You possess a strong product sense and can empathize with business needs and customer challenges.
You thrive in a collaborative environment, enjoy teamwork, and learn from others.
You’re fluent in English, both written and spoken (Ageras is an international team!).
You’re available to work from our office in Copenhagen.




Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 30’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to get to know each other and tell you more about Ageras.

2️⃣ A 30’ discussion with August (Lead Analytics Engineer) to talk about your previous experiences and the role we’re offering.

3️⃣ A 45’ business case presentation to assess your technical skills, followed by a 45’ meeting with the team.

Title: Student BI Analyst
Place: Silkeborg Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Er du god til tal, data, struktur og analyse, og kan du se det spændende i at arbejde i en teknologi-drevet organisation, der drifter Danmarks økonomi? Vil du sætte turbo på din udvikling som fremtidig BI-udvikler, datakonsulent eller analytiker? Så kan du blive en del af vores Business Intelligence (BI) team i JN Data som Student BI Analyst.




Stillingen

Som én af de største IT-service virksomheder for den finansielle sektor i Norden er vi med til at drifte Danmarks økonomi. For at understøtte vores egen og kunders forretning har vi lanceret et Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) initiativ, der skal sikre effektiv behandling af data, regulatorisk compliance, og at data kan anvendes på flere og nye forretningsområder.




Dine primære arbejdsopgaver bliver at:

Vedligeholde vores datakatalog, herunder håndtere det samlede datalandskab, så det altid er up-to-date og indeholder de relevante oplysninger.
Sammen med dine kollegaer i teamet at videreudvikle vores tekniske katalog-løsning, herunder automatisere og optimere en række processer og drive de forskellige aktiviteter relateret hertil.
Udvikle forskellige typer af rapportering, både i relation til EDG og til generel supportering af BI-teamet.
Afhængigt af dine evner og interesser at løse opgaver på tværs af teamets portefølje, fra klassifikation af vores data og modeller – til udvikling af rapporter og data-produkter.




Teamet

Du bliver en del af vores BI-team i Silkeborg, som arbejder for den øverste ledelse i JN Data for at skabe en funktion, der kan støtte udvikling af datamodenhed. I BI-teamet får du syv kollegaer, herunder seks dygtige udviklere og en projektleder. Vi garanterer et stærkt fagligt læringsmiljø, som vi kan supplere med regulær uddannelse indenfor fx PowerBI. Herudover vil du få en stor berøringsflade med resten af JN Data. Vores engagement er højt, og hvis vi selv skal sige det, har vi en fed arbejdsplads og venligheden er slående.




Vi sikrer løbende fokus på dit potentiale og din udvikling med faste feedback-samtaler med din leder og planlægger et introduktionsforløb for dig fra første dag, hvor du får tilknyttet en mentor.




Dig

Vi er på udkig efter dig, som har interesse for tal, dataanalyse og struktur. Du skal formentlig i gang med det sidste semester på din bachelor eller læser kandidat på cand.merc., cand.oecon., ingeniør- eller datavidenskab.




Vi lægger vægt på, at:

Du er god til Excel og har kendskab til basal datamodellering, fx med PowerPivot eller andre værktøjer.
Du har interesse for IT og tech og ønsker at arbejde i et teknologi-drevet miljø.
Du arbejder struktureret og detaljeorienteret.
Du kommunikerer flydende på skrift og i tale på dansk og engelsk.




Har du kendskab til PowerBI, PowerQuery og SQL er det en fordel. Afhængigt at behov så vil du også modtage træning i nogle af disse værktøjer.




Vi forventer, at du kan arbejde to dage om ugen, men vi tager naturligvis hensyn til din undervisning og eksamensperioder.




Hvad vi tilbyder

Særligt i starten er det vigtigt, at du kommer fysisk på vores kontor i Silkeborg, mens du med tiden vil kunne udføre nogle af dine opgave hjemmefra. Der er indtil flere køreordninger fra Aarhus.




Derudover:

Et professionelt, men uformelt arbejdsmiljø, hvor der er stort fokus på medarbejdertrivsel og udvikling.
Arbejdscomputer og headset.
Kantineordning.
Udvalgte forsikringer, herunder Tandsikring, Sundhedssikring og Kritisk Sygdom.




Fangede vi din interesse?

Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & Systems Architecture Lars Trier Husted på 61240213.

Show more

  • Udvalgte forsikringer, herunder Tandsikring, Sundhedssikring og Kritisk Sygdom.

Title: Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:


Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers


What you’ll Need to Succeed:


Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills


It’s Great if you Have:


Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a talented individual to join our IT Technical Support team at Marsh, Denmark. This role will be based in Copenhagen, and is based onsite five days per week.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

We will rely on you to:


On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.


What you need to have:


Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality


What makes you stand out:


Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.


Why join our team:


We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders.
We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities.
Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.

We are seeking a talented individual to join our IT Technical Support team at Marsh, Denmark. This role will be based in Copenhagen, and is based onsite five days per week.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

We will rely on you to:

  • On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
  • On- and off boarding of colleagues
  • Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
  • Administer and prepare mobile devices.
  • Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
  • Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
  • Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
  • Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.

What you need to have:

  • Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
  • A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
  • Solid knowledge of software and hardware
  • Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
  • Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
  • Knowledge of ITIL processes
  • Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
  • Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
  • Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
  • Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality

What makes you stand out:

  • Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.

Why join our team:

  • We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders.
  • We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities.
  • Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.

Title: Commercial Analyst (m/f/d)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Why join us in 2025?

If you join us in the role of Commercial Analyst, this is what you can expect from us:


Attractive salary and an overall generous package
Yearly vacation pay-out
Dentist insurance
Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
Hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours
Home equipment allowance
Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
Pension according to the collective agreement
Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company
Dedicated and approachable colleagues
Directly impact business growth and our merchant-customers


We're looking for a Commercial Analyst profile to pave growth for our Merchant Solutions organization.

As Commercial Analyst you will combine analytical ability with business acumen to work across the organization and drive insights that power our business growth.

Join a dynamic team where commercial success and strategic growth are at the heart of what we do.

The Commercial Management team operates as a strategic support function for sales organizations and drives market success for new products and propositions. The team delivers go-to-market (GTM) strategy and execution, sales performance enablement, and data-driven insights and decision support. You will join a collaborative team where opportunities for mentorship and constructive sparring are available to support your personal and professional growth.

You will own specific responsibilities within the team and towards stakeholders

As Commercial Analyst you will work at the intersection of data, strategy, and project execution. You will be empowered to drive your own analytical work while also supporting cross-functional projects. Sales, as your key stakeholder, will lean on your data analysis and insights to optimize performance and growth. Commercial Management team members will benefit from your support with data-driven insights that inform project plans and outcomes.

Qualifications


Preferably a Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, or Business
Fluency in English (verbal and written)
Ability to deliver actionable insights through data analysis, supported by technical proficiency in data analysis tools
Ability to communicate clearly and work across teams
Project experience


Life at Nexi

Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=standard . Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.

Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

Title: Fintech Data Analyst, Danish Market Expert
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Monthio, a growing tech company in the financial industry, we are committed to building innovative solutions that help our clients make confident, data-driven decisions. We are seeking a talented data enthusiast to join our team and contribute to our mission.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst at Monthio, you will play a crucial role in analyzing data and finding creative solutions to drive the development and refinement of our financial solutions. Your insights will be essential in ensuring our products deliver precise and reliable information that enables our clients to make data-informed financial decisions. This position offers a unique opportunity to influence the application of data within the fintech industry, all while working in a collaborative and dynamic environment.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret large data sets to support the development of our transaction classification tools.
Monitor the data from the Danish market and construct innovative strategies to drive competitive solutions in our product.
Collaborate with data analysts and algorithm developers to create data-driven insights for algorithmic solutions.
Perform quality assurance workflows, ensuring high quality and accuracy in all data-related tasks.
Leverage Danish-market domain knowledge to contribute to the scaling of our product for international markets.
Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation to promote visibility and knowledge-sharing within the team.
Support product and commercial teams by providing statistical analyses and participating in client meetings.


Preferred Qualifications


2+ years of experience in data analysis, data science, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL, Pyspark or Python for data analysis.
Good understanding of Danish society and financial systems.
Proven analytical skills with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Strong organizational skills with a proactive approach to problem-solving and strategic thinking.
Excellent communication skills in Danish and English, with the ability to clearly explain complex systems to relevant stakeholders.


We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you better. The first stage will be a short online meeting, followed by a more formal interview process.

Title: HR dataanalytiker
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I HOFOR deler vi en fælles vision om at skabe bæredygtige byer. I HR bidrager vi til denne vision gennem vores fokus på rekruttering, employer branding, diversitet og et bæredygtigt arbejdsliv.

For at nå vores mål inden for HR, har vi brug for en dybere indsigt i vores data, så vi kan træffe mere datadrevne beslutninger og arbejde mere strategisk inden for de forskellige felter.

Som vores nye HR dataanalytiker bliver du både fagligt ansvarlig for vores data set up, men du vil også være lead på den strategiske dataindsats.

Dataanalytiker der kan levere værdifulde indsigter

Som HR-dataanalytiker vil din primære opgave være at bygge data op, så du kan levere værdifulde indsigter, som kan understøtte vores beslutningsprocesser. Du vil både skulle rapportere på faste datapunkter samt håndtere løbende forespørgsler på forskellige dataleverancer.

Dine arbejdsopgaver bliver at:


Agere strategisk sparringspartner, der kan udfordre organisationen i forhold til mål og strategi
Imødekomme forretnings efterspørgsel på data
Analysere HR data
Rapportere på diversitetsdata
Sikre transparens i vores lønninger, så vi kan efterleve EU direktiv om løngennemsigtighed, der implementeres i 2026
Understøtte datapunkterne i CSRD og ESG rapporteringen



Stillingen er nyoprettet, og du har derfor god mulighed for at forme rollen, samtidig med at du bringer din vidn og erfaring i spil.

Analytisk profil med en god systematisk forståelse

Din uddannelsesmæssige baggrund er ikke så vigtig, vi lægger derimod vægt på, at du er opsøgende og har en god analytisk og systematisk forståelse. Du er detaljeorienteret når opgaverne kræver det, og du trives med at arbejde i spændingsfeltet mellem HR, data og analyse.

Du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, og kan tænke strategisk og sætte en retning ud fra det datagrundlag der er tilgængeligt.

Du er dygtig til Excel og har kendskab til eller interesse i at lære Power BI, Power Automate, SQL og NetStat, som er nogle af de systemer, der er med til at understøtte dit dataarbejde.

HR-teamet ser frem til at byde dig velkommen

Du bliver en del af HR, hvor du får mere end 30 engagerede kolleger. Sammen løser vi opgaver inden for hele HR-paletten og vi bruger hinandens færdigheder på tværs af afdelingen, så vi opnår de bedste resultater.

I HOFOR vil du møde en flad struktur og en uformel kultur, hvor der er plads til fællesskab. Du vil altid have en kollega at sparre med – både på kontoret, hjemmefra og når vi er ude til møder.

Du vil også blive tilknyttet vores PowerBi netværksgruppe, hvor du har mulighed for at drøfte faglige problemstillinger og sparre med andre dataanalytikere i HOFOR.

Vi har et fleksibelt arbejdsmiljø og giver plads til hjemmearbejde efter aftale med nærmeste leder. Hos os er der plads til dig, og til at du har et bæredygtigt arbejdsliv.

Du kan læse mere om vores medarbejdergoder her

Bliv en del af HOFOR og vær med til at gøre en forskel

Er du klar til nye muligheder, så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig senest den 9. januar 2025.

Bemærk at din ansøgning blot skal være et cv på 1-2 sider, hvor du tilføjer et par linjer om din motivation for at søge stillingen.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet er du velkommen til at kontakte sektionsleder Linda Holmetoft på mail: b2blinho@hofor.dk eller tlf. 2232 9560

Vi afholder 1. samtaler den 13. og 14. januar samt 2. samtaler den 21. januar 2025.

Vi forventer stillingen besat pr. 1. marts 2025.

Søg stillingen ved at klikke på ”Søg stillingen” i højre side.

Er jobbet ikke det rette match for dig?

Hvis dette job ikke er det rette match for dig, vil vi opfordre dig til at dele jobannoncen med andre i dit netværk, der kunne finde stillingen interessant. Tag også et kig på vores andre ledige stillinger her - måske vi har det rette job til dig.

Hos os får du plads

Vand, varme, hverdag. I HOFOR sikrer vi forsyningen i hovedstadsområdet. Men vores ansvar rækker længere: Vi skaber fremtidens bæredygtige byer. Det kræver overskud, og derfor giver vi dig plads. Plads til at forfølge de store ideer og til at hente de små. Plads til at dyrke de faglige detaljer og til at tegne de store linjer. Plads til at hjælpe hinanden og til at tænke nyt, når der er brug for det. Vi har plads til flere og til, at du kan være med.

HOFOR. Hos os får du plads. Til fællesskab, udvikling og et bæredygtigt arbejdsliv.

Inkluderende kultur og rekruttering

I HOFOR arbejder vi på at skabe en inkluderende kultur, og vi leder efter dygtige kollegaer uanset udseende, køn, kønsidentitet, seksuel orientering, etnicitet, religion, handicap, alder osv. Vi vil gerne skabe lige muligheder for alle samt sikre en retfærdig rekrutteringsproces. Undlad venligst at vedhæfte et billede.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Senior Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job of a Senior Quantitative Analyst

As our new Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading, and with a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Have experience from a trading desk - preferably within European Intraday Power
Industry experience with machine learning and/or statistical modeling
Skilled in Python and can write production-grade code
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day have ownership within the company
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and likely also your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.


The job of a Senior Quantitative Analyst

As our new Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading, and with a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.


Your key responsibilities

  • Research new market opportunities
  • Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
  • Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
  • Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
  • Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
  • Acquire and maintain data from external sources


Your qualifications and personal skills

  • Have experience from a trading desk - preferably within European Intraday Power
  • Industry experience with machine learning and/or statistical modeling
  • Skilled in Python and can write production-grade code
  • Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
  • Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
  • Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
  • The ability to work independently and structure your workload
  • A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
  • Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English


Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.


We offer:

  • A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
  • Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
  • Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
  • The chance to one day have ownership within the company
  • A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.


Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and likely also your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.


Start date: As soon as possible.


We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant – bliv del af vores BI-afdeling, som er under opbygning
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Kommer du med et par års erfaring fra en lignende rolle, hvor du har arbejdet med business intelligence, Power Automate og Power Apps? Ønsker du at komme med på rejsen og blive en del af en BI-afdeling under opbygning? Og har du forretningsforståelse kombineret med rette tekniske kompetencer, som sætter dig i stand til at drive egne kundeprojekter? Så er det dig, vi leder efter til vores Business Intelligence team i Viby/Aarhus.   

Kom med på rejsen i en BI-afdeling med vokseværk 

Vi ønsker at styrke vores BI-afdeling yderligere og investerer derfor tungt i dens opbygning og vækst. Som vores nye Business Intelligence Consultant kommer du til at indgå i vores team af kompetente kollegaer, hvor du arbejder tæt sammen med vores backend-arkitekter, seniorkonsulenter og projektledere for at sikre, at vi leverer robuste og effektive BI-løsninger.

Overordnet vil du varetage en bred palette af opgaver. Du vil få ansvaret for at drive egne kundeopgaver med fokus på Power BI og særligt Power Automate og Power Apps, hvor du evner at designe, udvikle og implementere skalerbare løsninger, der understøtter vores kunders forretningsmål.  

Vi søger dig, der ønsker at udvikle dig yderligere og som er nysgerrig på nyere teknologier, som vi ønsker at være endnu dygtigere til. Overordnet vil dine opgaver omfatte:  


Bidrage til udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger, der understøtter kundens forretningsmål 
Samarbejde med kunder for at forstå deres behov og forretningsprocesser, som omsættes til optimale BI-løsninger 
Arbejde med Power Platformen, bl.a. Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate og ETL-processer.
Udforske nye teknogier såsom nye teknologier som Microsoft Fabric og AI



Hvem er du?  

For at få succes i rollen er det afgørende, at du har viden om og erfaring med dataanalyse, Power BI, Power Automate og Power Apps fra et konsulenthus. Du motiveres i høj grad af frihed under ansvar - og ikke mindst af at kunne dygtiggøre dig inden for området. Overordnet ser vi gerne, at følgende er opfyldt:   


1-3 års erfaring fra en lignende konsulentrolle
Teknisk dygtig med erfaring i Power BI, Power Platformen, Power Apps og Power Automate
Fordel hvis du har kendskab til Databricks, SQL Server, API’er, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL og Azure Data Lakes
Kundeminded, nysgerrig og teknisk velfunderet  
Evner at formidle komplekse tekniske løsninger på et forståeligt niveau  
Proaktiv og selvkørende - med lyst til at bidrage til den BI-rejse, vi er på. 



Vi tilbyder:   


At du kan være med til at sætte dit præg på BI-området i en fremadstormende IT-koncern med klare vækstplaner
Arbejde med nyeste teknologier inden for bl.a. AI og Microsoft Fabric  
Mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra og have balance mellem arbejde og fritid  
Mulighed for uddannelses- og certificeringsmuligheder  
Sociale arrangementer, faglige events og 1700 skønne teamm8s som kollegaer



Skal du med på holdet?   

Så ser vi frem til at modtage dit CV. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, så er du velkommen til at kontakte TA Partner Trine Larsen på tlf. +45 2815 5806 eller trlar@itm8.com. Grundet juleferie besvares henvendelser først igen mandag den 6. januar 2025. Alle henvendelser behandles fortroligt.   

Vi afholder løbende samtaler og afslutter rekrutteringsprocessen, når den rette kandidat er fundet. Vi indhenter straffeattest forud for ansættelse.  

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!     
Show more

Grundet juleferie besvares henvendelser først igen mandag den 6. januar 2025. Alle henvendelser behandles fortroligt.

Title: Senior Technical Data Analyst til nystartet Analytics team
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Stillingsbeskrivelse

Nu har du chancen for at spille en central rolle i opbygningen af en fremadstormende konsulentvirksomhed, der har sat data og AI højest på udviklingsagendaen. Som den første Senior Data Analyst i vores Analytics team, får du muligheden for at sætte retningen for de kundevendte løsninger og være rammesættende for valg af metode og værktøjer, når vores kunder omsætter deres data til indsigter og forretningsværdi.

Hvem er Sopra Steria?

Sopra Steria er et IT-konsulenthus med fokus på forskellige kerneydelser indenfor applikationsudvikling og data. Hver dag vi hjælper vi private og offentlige virksomheder med at nå deres ambitioner. Vi kombinerer moderne teknologi og en solid forretningsforståelse, der sikrer, at vi finder løsninger som både er attraktive, skaber værdi og er realistiske at gennemføre samt implementere. Vi er med fra start til slut.

Siden 2015 har vi været i top-10 som ”Danmarks bedste it-virksomhed” i ”Great Place To Work’s” årlige undersøgelse. Vi er i høj grad drevet af at skabe et godt, socialt og uformelt arbejdsmiljø med en god stemning. Derfor mener vi, det er afgørende for os vores succes, at vores medarbejdere trives personligt, fagligt og i samspil med hinanden. Det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde!

Om rollen

Som Senior Technical Data Analyst/Consultant hos Sopra Steria vil du få ansvaret for at drive den undersøgende og analytiske del af vores dataafdeling, hvilket omfatter kundedialoger, kravspecifikationsudvikling og dataanalyse fra A til Z.

I din hverdag vil du have kundekontakt og arbejde tæt sammen med dygtige tekniske kollegaer. Sammen med teamet vil du udforske kundernes datapotentiale, kortlægge processer og levere værdifulde data-drevne indsigter. Du får ansvaret for at levere de front-end løsninger som vores kunder efterspørger. Desuden vil dit bidrag til teamet omfatte valg af proces- og analysemetoder og værktøjer, som du vil være hovedansvarlig for at implementere.

Da teamet stadig er i opstartsfasen, vil du, ud over dit analytiske bidrag, også være med til at forme data-teamets kultur og arbejdsmetoder. Du vil naturligt samarbejde med forskellige fagområder på tværs af teams og sikre, at de bliver opdateret på vores nye data-tilgang.

Hvem er du?

Du er en analytisk type, der er god til mennesker og elsker at finde mønstre og indsigter i data og processer. Nogle gange starter du fra bunden med rå data, andre gange optimerer du eksisterende løsninger. Du er begejstret for dataanalyseværktøjer, og besidder en passende forretningsforståelse til at konfigurere den optimale front-end løsning, som dækker det specifikke behov.

Som person er du optimistisk og nysgerrig med et stærkt gå-på-mod og en lyst til at drive udvikling gennem data, AI og indsigter. Du sætter pris på at være en del af et team, hvor vi hver især kan bidrage med vores individuelle kompetencer.

For at lykkes i rollen forestiller vi os, at du:


Tidligere har arbejdet som konsulent (in-house eller eksternt)
Tidligere har arbejdet med dataanalyse og rapportering
Har erfaring med data-visualiseringsværktøjer (som Power BI, MS Fabric eller lign)
Har erfaring med SQL og Python
Kan identificere muligheder ved nye analysemetoder og hvordan de kan anvendes hos vores kunder


Det Er En Fordel Hvis Du


Har kendskab til statistiske analyseværktøjer (som R eller SAS)
Kan fremvise en DP-600 eller DP-900 certificering i MS Fabric/Azure
Har kendskab til MS Azure AI og evt. har en AI-900 certificering
Har lyst til at holde dig opdateret på trends og teknologier inden for data & analytics og AI


Bliv en del af os

Hos os får du muligheden for at blive en del af en organisation som er i rivende udvikling, du bliver en vigtig del af et godt, socialt og uformelt arbejdsmiljø med god stemning og en flad organisationsstruktur.

Vi Tilbyder


Søde og imødekommende kollegaer, som glæder sig til at arbejde sammen med dig.
En uformel og sjov hverdag på en spændende arbejdsplads med sociale og hjælpsomme kolleger.
Gode muligheder med fokus på både personlig og faglig udvikling: seminarer, konferencer, coaching, sparring, certificeringer mv.
Regelmæssige sociale arrangementer som fredagsbar, onsdagstræning, sommerfest etc.
Fleksibel arbejdsplads med mulighed for at arbejde fra vores kontor i København i kombination med hjemmearbejdsdage.


Lyder det som noget for dig, så skynd dig at sende en ansøgning af sted. Skulle du have spørgsmål til rollen, så kontakt Simon Bülow, Senior Talent Acquisition Advisor på +45 29 73 03 81.

Vi glæder os til at at modtage din ansøgning.

Yderligere informationer

Vi er en af nordens førende konsulentvirksomheder inden for digitalisering, innovation og moderne teknologi og gennem mange år har vi været rangeret som en af Danmarks bedste IT-arbejdspladser.

Som en af nordens største konsulentvirksomheder bistår vi store private virksomheder og offentlige organisationer med deres digitale omstilling.

Vi lægger vægt på at skabe værdi for vores kunder og samfundet og har som mål at skabe en bedre og mere bæredygtig fremtid.

Vi Tilbyder

  • Søde og imødekommende kollegaer, som glæder sig til at arbejde sammen med dig.
