Vi lægger vægt på at skabe værdi for vores kunder og samfundet og har som mål at skabe en bedre og mere bæredygtig fremtid.

Title: Business Analyst with data analysis focus in Transaction Monitoring | SEB Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
SEB is a leading Nordic financial services group headquartered in Sweden and with presence in 20 countries worldwide. As a leading Scandinavian bank, we offer financial advice and a wide range of financial services with strong focus on corporate and investment banking.

SEB’s Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) function will further accelerate SEBs deployment of financial crime prevention capabilities to continuously meet regulatory expectations and to become a leader in fighting financial crime.

The FCP Transaction Monitoring Technology and Investigation Platforms unit is now looking for a driven and proactive Business Analyst with special focus on data to contribute to the data-driven journey by taking an active part in the needed data transformation. This role can be based in Stockholm, Riga or Copenhagen.

About The Role

As a Business Analyst at SEB, you'll be part of an inclusive team of professional and engaged colleagues. You'll have the opportunity to work in a dynamic and international environment in close collaboration with development organisations (Tribes). The purpose of the role is to continuously aid in the development of SEB’s Transaction Monitoring Systems and Platforms. The role consists of, but is not limited to:


Conduct data analysis on large amounts of data to identify trends or inconsistencies
Conduct data mapping and identify critical data elements for our systems when switching data sources
Investigate potential data quality issues and contribute to its improvement
Assist in root cause analysis and business impact for potential incidents


Your knowledge and excellent communication skills are critical in bridging the gap between our business objectives and technological capabilities. By collaborating and networking with other internal teams within FCP and Technology, you'll also have room to explore other business areas and grow your skills further.

At SEB, we embrace a hybrid work model, providing employees with eligible roles and tasks to work remotely up to two days a week.

To thrive in this role, we believe you have

▪ Academic degree in Finance, Business, Data engineering, Mathematics, IT or a equivalent relevant field;

▪ Good communication skills and fluency in English;

▪ At least two years of experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst or equivalent working with data;

▪ Experience with conducting data analysis and data mapping, including strong skills in data transformation using tools such as excel and SQL;

▪ A detailed oriented and structured mindset;

▪ Experience in SQL and Python;

▪ Familiarity with Payment flows (considered a strong advantage);

▪ Strong analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and strategically;

▪ Well-organized and able to navigate ambiguity while managing multiple initiatives effectively in a fast-paced environment;

▪ Strong track record of collaboration and teamwork to achieve common goals;

What We Offer

▪ International opportunities and working environment

▪ Long-term stability

▪ Training and learning opportunities

▪ Remote working possibilities and flexible work schedule

Do you want to be part of SEB?

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-01-17. If you have questions about the position, please contact Helena Lundin at Helena.lundin @seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts:

https://sebgroup.com/career

https://bit.ly/SEBcareer
Show more

▪ At least two years of experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst or equivalent working with data;

▪ Experience with conducting data analysis and data mapping, including strong skills in data transformation using tools such as excel and SQL;

▪ A detailed oriented and structured mindset;

▪ Experience in SQL and Python;

▪ Familiarity with Payment flows (considered a strong advantage);

▪ Strong analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and strategically;

▪ Well-organized and able to navigate ambiguity while managing multiple initiatives effectively in a fast-paced environment;

▪ Strong track record of collaboration and teamwork to achieve common goals;

What We Offer

▪ International opportunities and working environment

▪ Long-term stability

▪ Training and learning opportunities

▪ Remote working possibilities and flexible work schedule

Do you want to be part of SEB?

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-01-17. If you have questions about the position, please contact Helena Lundin at Helena.lundin @seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts:

https://sebgroup.com/career

https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

Title: Student Quantitative Analyst for Macro Trading
Description:
Are you ready to join us as we explore the macroeconomic landscape? Do you want to impact our macroeconomic framework and enable quantitative decision-making? You are in luck! We are looking for a Student Quantitative Analyst to join our newly established Macro Trading team.




In Macro Trading, we combine macroeconomic insights and data analysis with market-specific knowledge of power, gas, and emissions to generate trading decisions. Our macro portfolio operates like a start-up, offering high autonomy and the opportunity to innovate and rethink European Energy Trading while having the backing of a larger and more mature organization, increasing the probability of success.




Your journey as Student Quantitative Analyst

We seek a passionate Student Quantitative Analyst with deep interest in macroeconomics and econometrics to help develop the foundation for our energy trading activities. You will be an integral part of the team, receiving support in all areas to help you reach your full potential.




We aim to provide the best possible start in your new role. You can expect a thorough introduction to the team, our business, and the broader organization. You will also join our onboarding program during your first week alongside other new colleagues.




You are expected to work approximately 15 hours per week. We offer flexible working hours to ensure you can balance work and studies without compromise.




Responsibilities – you will:

Apply econometric methods to forecast macro variables
Participate in developing a macroeconomic framework for algorithmic and discretionary trading
Collaborate with traders and quants to translate macroeconomic data into actionable insights




Qualifications – we imagine that you:

Are currently studying a bachelor's (on 5th semester or later) or a master's in economics, finance, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or similar
Have experience with coding in R and/or Python
Have excellent abilities in mathematics and statistics
Preferably, have experience from a relevant previous student job
Are fluent in English – written and oral




Personal skills – we expect that you:

Have a curious and competitive mindset
Can be direct with your colleagues in a constructive way
Can work independently with a strong drive towards achieving results
Are a team player who will do what is best for the team and InCommodities




What you can expect from us:

A steep learning curve and the ability to use theoretical knowledge in a real-life setting
A lot of responsibility and support
Exceptional colleagues who are bold, honest, ambitious, and the smartest in their field
A bunch of great events - both in the teams and in the entire organization
The opportunity to develop both professionally and personally
You will be part of a unique company culture where we live up to our values: Honesty, Transparency, and Rethink and where you don't have to abide by a dress code or a strict hierarchy, so you won't be frustrated with too many rules, policies, or bureaucratic processes




Practical information

Location: Aarhus N, Denmark

Student job




Application deadline:

As soon as possible




If you have any questions, please contact:

Patrick Iele Rasmussen

Mail: pra@in-commodities.com

Show more

Title: Senior SOC Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to join us on an ambitious mission to secure the digital world?

Keepit is looking for a Senior SOC Analyst (SOC L3 Analyst) to join our Security Operation Center in Copenhagen, Denmark.




We are growing fast as a company and do our best to bring our SaaS cloud-based backup services to the global audience.




Our platform is designed to provide customers with an immutable historical archive of their primary data in systems such as Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, Salesforce, Azure AD/Entra ID, Dynamics 365, and Zendesk. It aims to protect them against everything, starting from ransomware to simple accidents.




Most of our back-end components are written in clean, modern C++ using mainly purpose-built components and STL. Several components that deal with business processes and data mining are built using Common Lisp. Everything runs on Linux.




Backing up billions of objects over foreign APIs using imperfect networks on systems with finite memory and making it all happen in as little time as possible is no small feat.




We are product-centered company and cyber security is one of our main priorities.




If you think solving complex problems is fun, we have strong indications that we will not run out of challenging problems any time soon. Come join us for the fun!




Primary Responsibilities:

Act as a senior incident responder for escalated security incidents
Develop and optimize SIEM rules, fine-tuning alerts to reduce false positives
Create and maintain playbooks for incident handling and ensure knowledge transfer to manager analysts
Working on connecting new log sources, log optimization, and parsing
Perform threat hunting, root cause analysis, and forensics
Provide mentorship and training to L1 analysts to enhance SOC capabilities
Lead incident response efforts and coordinate across IT, security, and management teams
Act as a spare SOC engineer




Skills and Qualifications:

4+ years of experience in SOC environments or equivalent
Obligatory expertise in SIEM solutions (MS Sentinel, Elastic SIEM, Wazuh) with demonstrated ability to create, optimize, and manage rules
Hands-on experience with malware analysis, reverse engineering, and forensics
Advanced knowledge of incident response frameworks (NIST, SANS) and tools (e.g., EDR, IDS, IPS, centralized antivirus etc)
Strong knowledge of security standards (ISO 27001, NIST) and ability to map them to incident handling procedures
Leadership and mentorship skills, with a proven track record of training and upskilling junior analysts
Relevant certifications: CSA, CISSP, GIAC, OSCP, CEH, or equivalent will be an advantage




A fair and transparent recruitment process

During the recruitment process, you can expect the following stages:

CV screening, Recruitment interview, Technical interview, Technical assignment (optionally), and Final interview.




You will be assessed according to the criteria below:

Technical Skills:

We are seeking candidates with strong expertise in the following areas:

Incident Response: Proficient in investigating, analyzing, and mitigating complex security incidents.
Threat Hunting: Hands-on experience with proactive threat-hunting methodologies and tools.
Forensic Analysis: Skills in endpoint, network, and memory forensic investigations.
Malware Analysis: Capable of conducting static and dynamic malware analysis.
SIEM Mastery: In-depth knowledge of SIEM platforms (e.g., MS Sentinel, Elastic, Wazuh, including rule creation, query optimization, and reporting.
Automation: Familiarity with SOAR platforms and scripting (Python, Bash, PowerShell) for automating routine tasks.
Cloud Security: Understanding of securing cloud environments (Azure) and detecting cloud-based threats.
Threat Intelligence: Ability to operationalize threat intelligence and correlate indicators with incidents.

Soft Skills:

We prioritize candidates who demonstrate:

Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: A systematic approach to identifying and resolving complex issues.
Leadership: Ability to mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance.
Teamwork and Collaboration: Proven ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Communication Skills: Capability to communicate technical details clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Language: English is a preferred language, and we expect you to be fluent in it, both written and spoken.

Logical Thinking:

We emphasize:

Structured Problem Solving: Ability to break down complex security issues into actionable steps.
Decision-Making Skills: Making informed and reasoned decisions under pressure.
Pattern Recognition: Identifying unusual patterns and behaviours in data or systems.
Scenario-Based Thinking: Proficiency in simulating and analyzing hypothetical threat scenarios.




We offer:

Competitive salary
A modern, energetic global work environment
Flexible work-life balance supported by a hybrid working model
Regular team-building activities
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
Compensation based on experience and skill set




We kindly ask you not to provide us with any sensitive categories of personal data when applying for a job with us. When applying for the vacancy, Keepit will process your personal data, and therefore we recommend that you also read our privacy policy, which describes our processing of personal data and your rights as a data subject.

Show more

Title: Incident Response Analyst for Global Security Operations
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Novo Nordisk DD&IT (Digital, Data & IT) is looking for an Incident Response Analyst to work within the Global Information Security organisation. Among many responsibilities, are you interested to help us monitor and analyse security events to identify potential security incidents?

If so, read on!

Department Overview

With this role, we welcome you to Digital, Data & IT and a journey of digital transformation and innovation where IT makes a real difference for millions of patients worldwide. It’s a global journey with 4000+ colleagues worldwide.

The Global Security Operations – Advanced Security Operations department is based in Digital, Data and IT in Denmark. You will be part of a global information security community with colleagues located primarily in Denmark, USA, and India. Global Information Security consists of leading experts in various areas ranging from network security, incident response, cloud security, cryptography, security operations, due diligences & integrations, to manufacturing security and security risk management and governance.

What’s the role about?
Your role will investigate and respond to security alerts and incidents in a timely manner, conducting thorough analysis to determine the root cause and impact. You will be involved in the development and maintenance of incident response documentation and playbooks, providing recommendations for enhancing security controls and mitigating potential threats, staying up-to-date with the latest security trends and threat intelligence. We are looking for experience with OT (Operational Technology) incident response to address the specific challenges and requirements of industrial control systems and operational environments.

Moreover, as our Level 3 Incident Response Analyst we want you to:



Leading and coordinating incident response activities during security breaches or cyber-attacks, including managing communication with relevant stakeholders and overseeing the containment, eradication, and recovery efforts
Conducting post-incident analysis and lessons learned process to document the details of security incidents, the response actions taken, and recommendations for improving future incident response procedures
Contributing to the development and implementation of proactive security measures, including participating in security architecture reviews, threat modeling, and security awareness training for staff
Providing mentorship and guidance to junior members of the incident response team, sharing knowledge and best practices to enhance the overall capabilities of the team




Candidate profile


Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field
Proven experience in incident response, security operations, or related field
In-depth understanding of network security, malware analysis, and forensic investigation
Familiarity with security technologies such as SIEM, IDS/IPS, and endpoint detection and response
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
Relevant certifications such as GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH) are a plus




Join the Novo Nordisk family
Founded in Denmark in 1923, Novo Nordisk has become one of the world’s leading healthcare companies. At Novo Nordisk, we are committed to driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic diseases. To fulfil this purpose, we pioneer scientific breakthroughs, expand access to our medicines, and work to prevent and ultimately cure disease. That said, we are anything but linear.

With us, your skills, commitment, and ambition help us change patients’ lives worldwide. In exchange, we offer you a rewarding and purpose-driven culture with talented and diverse co-workers. Therefore, your professional and personal development is essential for us, and in Novo Nordisk, the sky is the limit for career opportunities.

Every day, our thousands of digital experts work in all areas of technology. We navigate the tech spectrum from front-end to back-end, from artificial intelligence to machine learning, and from cloud systems to quantum computing. All to make a tangible impact on lives across the globe. How? Go explore at TechLife at Novo Nordisk.

Any questions?
For further information, please call+45 4444 8888 and ask to talk with our Hiring Manager, Thomas Yura

Deadline
19 January 2025

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Senior Quantitative Researcher - QIS
Description:
About us

At RavenPack, we are at the forefront of developing the next generation of generative AI tools for the finance industry and beyond. With 20 years of experience as a leading big data analytics provider for financial services, we empower our clients—including some of the world's most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers—to enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by integrating public information into their models and workflows. Building on this expertise, we are now launching a new suite of GenAI and SaaS services, designed specifically for financial professionals.

Join a Company that is Powering the Future of Finance with AI

RavenPack has been recognized as the Best Alternative Data Provider by WatersTechnology and has been included in this year’s Top 100 Next Unicorns by Viva Technology. We're now preparing to launch Bigdata.com, a next-generation platform aimed at transforming financial decision-making.




Join RavenPack:

RavenPack is searching for a Senior Quantitative Researcher to join the Data Science - QIS Team at our Spanish headquarters, Marbella. We offer competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.

As a Senior Quant Researcher, you will be participating in the development of new systematic trading strategies, as well as showcasing the value of our data for trading and investment purposes across equities mostly and time horizons.

The ability to communicate effectively in English both in writing and verbally is a must. European legal working status is required.




Your Responsibilities:

As a Senior Quant Researcher, you will join the “Quantitative Investment Strategies (QIS) Team,” consisting of four quant researchers dedicated to feature engineering and developing systematic trading strategies. Your work will primarily involve bottom-up research, with some top-down research opportunities. You will create white papers to enhance RavenPack’s reputation as a thought leader in the alternative data industry and present trading strategies to quantitative analysts. You will independently work on practical use cases that demonstrate the value of RavenPack data. Additionally, your responsibilities will include:

Identifying, validating, and amplifying predictive signals within our data while discerning and filtering out irrelevant information.
Formulating systematic trading strategies spanning multiple asset classes with a major focus on equities, enriching security-selection capabilities with Alternative Data across different holding periods.
Offering data-driven insights, engaging in discussions about your research, and presenting trading strategies to leading quantitative researchers and portfolio managers in the field.
Effectively communicating intricate analytical concepts to management in a clear and concise manner.




What We're Looking For:

A PhD/MSc in Quantitative or Computational Finance, or from any related fields including Machine Learning, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, etc.
5+ years of relevant work experience as a quantitative researcher, manipulating large and noisy alternative datasets for features engineering, signal amplification, and portfolio backtesting.
Outstanding quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to develop original research and hypothesis testing.
Demonstrated proficiency in at least Python and SQL.
Strong enthusiasm for technology, and familiarity with big data technologies coupled with proficiency in machine learning is highly advantageous.




What's in it for you?

You will work with the latest technologies.
Our Headquarters is located in Marbella. Following the onboarding period, we offer a hybrid work model, allowing for up to 2 days remote per week.
Free Company shuttle bus from Malaga, Fuengirola, Riviera and Estepona.
You will have ownership of projects working in a collaborative environment where we will value your contribution.
You will work in an agile environment able to react quickly to changes with a fairly flat hierarchy.
As we encourage continuous learning, we will support your ongoing training.
Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Show more

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Senior Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Senioranalytiker til prissætningsområdet

Vil du være med til at sætte priserne på renter og gebyrer for over 3 millioner privatkunder? Er du en dygtig økonom og har du interesse for analyse og behandle data? Trives du med stort ansvar og indflydelse? Så har vi det helt rigtige job til dig.

Vi søger en ny kollega i Danmark som vil tage en aktiv rolle i vores pris team som har prisansvaret på tværs af Norden. Vi er ansvarlige for analyse, implementering og vedligeholdelse af priserne for Danske Banks serviceydelser bl.a. renter, gebyrer mv. Prissætning og understøttelse af den kommercielle agenda er højt prioriteret i banken og afspejler sig i dit daglige arbejde.

Pris teamet er en del af Performance Management, hvor vi bl.a. sikrer opfølgning på de aktiviteter, som vi implementerer, samt løbende evaluerer behovet for nye tiltag til understøttelse af de finansielle mål i Personal Customers DK og Nordic.

Du vil få din daglige gang på vores helt nye hovedkontor på postgrunden lige ved Københavns Hovedbanegård. Her kan du se frem til et nyt og moderne kontor med lækre faciliteter.

Du er med til at udvikle og implementere vores priser

Som Senioranalytiker i Pricing Personal Customers vil du få dybt priskendskab i Danske Banks produkter og services. Du vil sammen med dine kollegaer i afdelingen tage ejerskab over udvikling, implementering og vedligeholdelse af prisstrukturer for produkter og services. Herudover har du medansvar for at optimere og videreudvikle prisområdet for både Personal og Private Banking på tværs af de Nordiske lande med analyser og belysning af business cases som støtter op omkring bankens strategi.

”Hos os vil du opleve en stor forretningsforståelse og samtidig få et stort ansvar i en stilling, hvor du tydeligt ser effekten af dit arbejde, da det har en direkte påvirkning for vores kunder”, fortæller din nye chef, Jacob Ryom, Head of Pricing Personal Customers DK and Nordic.

Et stort ansvar i Pricing Personal Customers betyder at dit daglige arbejde er i tæt samarbejde med stakeholders, hvor dit arbejde har stor indflydelse.

Dine primære arbejdsopgaver består i at:


Udarbejdelse og evaluering af business cases
Simplificere og automatisere nuværende prisstrukturer
Vurdere vores produktsammensætning og udfordre status quo
Lave data- og markedsanalyser som kvantificerer dine forslag
Være sparringspartner for forretningsområderne og øvrige funktioner med prisforespørgsler


Brug dine analytiske evner og kommunikér komplekse problemstillinger

Som person er du nysgerrig af natur og har en struktureret og analytisk tilgang til opgaveløsning. Du trives i en travl hverdag og er god til at samarbejde på tværs af afdelinger, lande og med forskellige interne kollegaer. Endelig er du en god kommunikator, som er i stand til at formidle komplekse problemstillinger på en let og forståelig måde til både rådgivere og bankens øverste ledelse.

Vi forestiller os, at:


Du har en relevant uddannelse og har mellem 2-10 års erfaring
Du er selvkørende og motiveres af at arbejde med simplificering, analyser og tænke kreativt, hvor du udfordrer status quo.
Du har interesse og måske allerede viden inden for prissætning, markedsanalyse etc.
Du kan præsentere dine analyser og budskaber på en klar og tydelig måde i powerpoint og e-mails.


Rig mulighed for udvikling, indflydelse og et højt fagligt niveau

Vi tilbyder dig en spændende og alsidig stilling, hvor du har rig mulighed for at udvikle dine evner inden for både analyser og projektledelse. Vi giver dig stort ansvar fra første dag. Du vil arbejde med et strategisk vigtigt område, så du får rig mulighed for at præsentere dine forslag for bankens øverste ledelse.

I Pricing Personal Customers DK and Nordic har vi et højt fagligt niveau og mange komplekse og spændende arbejdsopgaver. Vi arbejder målrettet på at understøtte banken, og vi opbygger interne færdigheder, der har stor indflydelse på kerneforretningen.

Vil du være en del af holdet?

Du er velkommen til at kontakte Jacob Ryom, Head of Pricing Personal Customers, på telefon 40 22 14 00, hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen.

Da vi behandler ansøgningerne løbende, beder vi dig sende din ansøgning samt CV snarest.

Title: Senior IT Analyst for Open Banking Technology
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27031 

 

Would you like to be in the forefront of one of the leading Open Banking API offerings in the Nordics while at the same time growing your skills as an analysts in a collaborative and truly agile environment? We are now looking for (senior) IT Analysts to enable our people to be their best and deliver on our customer vision, enabling Nordea to create customer value through its external interfaces.  

At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  

About this opportunity 



Welcome to the Requirement and Analysis team in Open Banking Service Domain. We add value by providing a fit-for-purpose analysis to design innovative solutions to create great customer experiences. As the (Senior) IT Analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in actively contributing to the collaboration between business and IT, and drive requirement engineering work in Nordea’s Payments and Fin Transactions Technology Service Area.  

What you’ll be doing: 

Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand and document business strategies(in alignment with the target picture to enable sustainable solutions)
Eliciting functional and non-functional requirements by co operating with different stakeholders e.g. architects, developers, testers, business, legal
Translate business strategies into detailed technical requirements for the IT team
Securing requirements traceability during smooth end-to-end development
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Supporting testers and developers in the team and hub
Verifying developed solutions by conducting test results
Providing insights to stakeholders on the effectiveness of implemented solutions

 

You’ll join a team where people are the most important and work is not only a place to go. We take pride in what we do, prioritize a learning culture and strive to have fun in our daily work. The role is based in Stockholm, Helsinki, Poland Tricity or Copenhagen.



Who you are



Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  

To succeed in this role, we believe that you: 

Have strong technical and business background, and great analytical and requirement specification skills (functional and non-functional) 
Are self-driven, team player, with very good communication and collaboration skills 
Are proactive, detail-oriented and quality driven
Are familiar with Agile way of working and methods (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) 

 

Your experience and background: 

Experience in IT and/or business analysis
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration
Experience of using Jira, Confluence
Experience or knowledge of API development, Data Mapping and Process Modelling 
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain
Practical knowledge of SQL, user interface prototyping and design 
Knowledge of Architecture diagrams like sequence diagrams
Solid technical knowledge for effective collaboration with developers
Proficiency with analysis tools and methodologies

 

An advantage would be:

Familiarity with regulatory requirements in the banking sector
Practical knowledge of REST/SOAP API
Knowledge of PSD2,PSD3/PSR

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/01/2025.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

 

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

 

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com

 

Only for candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:

In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.

The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf

We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

Title: Senior Consultant, Business Intelligence – få en nøglerolle i den videre opbygning af vores BI-afdeling
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Motiveres du af at have en nøglerolle med fokus på Business Intelligence og dataanalyse? Ønsker du at komme med på rejsen og sætte dit præg på en BI-afdeling under opbygning? Og har du en solid teknisk baggrund og erfaring som gør dig i stand til at drive selvstændige kundeopgaver? Så er det dig, vi leder efter til vores Business Intelligence team i Viby/Aarhus eller i Nordhavn i København.

Sæt dit præg på BI-afdeling med vokseværk

Vi ønsker at styrke vores BI-afdeling yderligere og investerer derfor tungt i dens opbygning og vækst. Som vores nye Senior Consultant kommer du til at indgå som en nøglemedarbejder i vores team af kompetente kolleger, hvor du arbejder tæt sammen med vores frontend-udviklere, øvrige seniorkonsulenter og projektledere for at sikre, at vi leverer robuste og effektive BI-løsninger. Derudover får du ansvaret for at drive egne kundeopgaver med fokus på Power BI og dataanalyse, hvor du evner at designe, udvikle og implementere skalerbare løsninger, der understøtter vores kunders forretningsmål.

Vi søger dig, der ønsker en central rolle, hvor du kan være med til at præge området og den videre udvikling af afdelingen med fokus på blandt andet nyere teknologier, som vi ønsker at være endnu dygtigere til. Overordnet vil dine opgaver omfatte: 


Udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger, der understøtter kundens forretningsmål
Samarbejde med kunder for at forstå deres behov og forretningsprocesser, som omsættes til optimale BI-løsninger
Arbejde med Power BI, T-SQL, stored procedures og ETL-processer for at extracte, transformere og indlæse data
Anvende Microsoft-teknologier som Fabric, Databricks, SQL Server, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, Azure Data Lakes, Azure functions, ADLS, Key Vault, Azure Synapse samtidig med, at du udforsker nye teknologier



Hvem er du? 

For at få succes i rollen er det afgørende, at du har viden om og erfaring med dataanalyse og Power BI fra en lignende konsulentrolle. Du motiveres i høj grad af frihed under ansvar - og ikke mindst af at kunne være med til at sætte dit præg på området. Overordnet ser vi gerne, at følgende er opfyldt:  


+5 års erfaring som seniorkonsulent med fokus på business intelligence og dataanalyse
Teknisk dygtig med erfaring i Power BI, SQL, Python, og Microsofts cloud-teknologier 
Ekstra plus er kompetencer inden for Power platformen, Power BI, Power Automate og Power apps
Kundeminded, nysgerrig og teknisk velfunderet 
Evner at formidle komplekse tekniske løsninger på et forståeligt niveau 
Proaktiv og selvkørende - med lyst til at bidrage til den BI-rejse, vi er på



Vi tilbyder:

  


At du kan være med til at sætte dit præg på BI-området i en fremadstormende IT-koncern med klare vækstplaner, hvor vi gerne vil gå fra at være GOOD to GREAT 
Arbejde med nyeste teknologier inden for bl.a. AI og Microsoft Fabric 
Mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra og have balance mellem arbejde og fritid 
Mulighed for uddannelses- og certificeringsmuligheder 
Sociale arrangementer, faglige events og 1700 skønne teamm8s som kolleger



Skal du med på holdet?

  

Så send os dit cv og en motiveret ansøgning.  

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, så er du velkommen til at kontakte TA Partner Trine Larsen på tlf. +45 2815 5806 eller trlar@itm8.com. Grundet juleferie besvares henvendelser først igen mandag den 6. januar 2025. Alle henvendelser behandles fortroligt.  

Vi afholder løbende samtaler og afslutter rekrutteringsprocessen, når den rette kandidat er fundet. Vi indhenter straffeattest forud for ansættelse. 

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!  

 


Show more

  • Arbejde med nyeste teknologier inden for bl.a. AI og Microsoft Fabric 
  • Mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra og have balance mellem arbejde og fritid 
  • Mulighed for uddannelses- og certificeringsmuligheder 
  • Sociale arrangementer, faglige events og 1700 skønne teamm8s som kolleger


Skal du med på holdet?

  

Så send os dit cv og en motiveret ansøgning.  

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, så er du velkommen til at kontakte TA Partner Trine Larsen på tlf. +45 2815 5806 eller trlar@itm8.com. Grundet juleferie besvares henvendelser først igen mandag den 6. januar 2025. Alle henvendelser behandles fortroligt.  

Vi afholder løbende samtaler og afslutter rekrutteringsprocessen, når den rette kandidat er fundet. Vi indhenter straffeattest forud for ansættelse. 

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Business Intelligence specialist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join TDC NET’s mission to increase the use of data for automation and decision-making!

TDC NET is taking the next step in our journey as an independent provider of digital infrastructure in Denmark. We aim to create a unified central data warehouse where definitions are aligned, updated, and documented; where data quality is monitored and improved; and where users of all kinds can find or create the insights they need. We are well on our way and are now looking for another skilled team member to contribute tothis goal. As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will play an important role as a sparring partner for the business, helping to address challenges and support decisions with factual insights.

About The Job

Business Intelligence is positioned within our strategy function, and you will join a team of employees with competencies spanning all areas of BI, ranging from junior to senior levels. You will never work alone on a task, and there is plenty of knowledge to draw upon.

We work in an agile manner with a quarterly plan for our overarching priorities, using Kanban daily to handle and prioritize new needs as they arise. Team collaboration is close, as is our partnership with the business on prioritized tasks.

Currently, most data resides within the MS SQL Server stack, and we are transitioning toward Snowflake and dbt.

As part of our BI team, your primary responsibilities will include:


Collaborating with the business to identify the need for new insights.
Modeling the appropriate data products to meet business needs.
Working with the BI team and other data users to further develop the data warehouse.
Visualizing data to simplify access and enhance self-service.


"In the BI team, we focus on the business's needs, and in collaboration with the business, we define various rules and definitions in the data. We create both complex data models and small, quick ad-hoc data deliveries, all of which support the business's needs and requests. There is a wide variety of tasks and challenges, which only makes working with our data more enjoyable. Most importantly, we optimize and automate everything that can be optimized and automated within data processes," says Camilla from the BI team.

About You

We are looking for an experienced SQL Specialist who can transform business needs into insights through data. The focus is on data modeling and data management, requiring an ability to understand complex relationships while maintaining an overview and clear structure. If you can also visualize data, that’s a significant advantage.

You Have


Several years of experience with SQL development in a role where you’ve also handled data modeling and structuring.
Experience with Snowflake and dbt, or with the MS SQL Server stack and a willingness to develop skills in the former.
Visualization skills and possibly experience with Power BI and DAX or another tool to support your work.
A structured approach to tasks, ensuring your code and outputs are understandable and usable by others.
A high level of responsibility for your work by being precise in solutions and communication.
Good collaboration skills that your colleagues notice in daily interactions.
Proficiency in stakeholder management and experience from working in complex organizations.
Skilled in Danish and English.


As a person, you are curious about our business, processes, and technologies. You engage and are keen to join a company that already makes significant use of data and aims to leverage it even further in the future. It’s okay to be a bit of a data nerd - we all are, and we love it.

Join TDC NET and assist us taking the use of data to the next level. We look forward to your application!

Contact

If you have questions about the position or want to know more about what it means to work at TDC NET, feel free to reach out to Department Director, Carsten Fogh Madsen, on +45 20200600. We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our team at TDC NET.

Location:

Teglholmsgade 1, Copenhagen or Sletvej 30, Aarhus

Process

We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than 20 January 2025.

You can expect to hear from us within 3 weeks from the application date.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a skilled individual to take on a pivotal role in overseeing and improving Data Centre facilities across Kalundborg, Funen, and Zealand (minimum onsite requirement of 2-3 days per week).




6 month Contracts

Travel in Denmark is a must (Kalundborg, Funen, and Zealand)




Define, establish, and operate IT Data Centre facilities, including MDF/IDFs.
Coordinate maintenance and operations by working closely with contractors and vendors, such as electricians and cooling technicians.
Ensure new and existing Data Centre and Patch Room facilities align with established standards and best practices.
Oversee infrastructure lifecycle management and play a key role in managing major incidents affecting IT and business continuity.

Key Skills and Experience

Proven expertise in Data Centre Management, particularly in large organizations.
Strong vendor management and coordination capabilities.
In-depth knowledge of IT infrastructure, service management, and IT processes.
Familiarity with ITIL frameworks (certification preferred).
Experience working on large-scale IT projects and supporting technical architectures.
Understanding of pharmaceutical processes is an advantage.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job as Quantitative Analyst

As our new Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading and a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Minimum 2 years of experience from a similar role or top of your university class
Quantitative background in Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, etc.
Master machine learning and data-science fundamentals
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytic skills and an eye for detail
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 175 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day become partner
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, Supply Chain
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about working in the interface between Supply Chain and Digital Data Organization while building the Business Intelligence solutions to make crucial decisions in LEGO® Operations?

Then bring your strong Business Intelligence (BI) skills, analytical mindset and stakeholder management capabilities into play in this role and help us playing a strong part in the provisioning of solid data solutions within a truly global organization!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities

In this role as Senior BI Analyst, you will be responsible for the data connectivity and global reporting solutions for allocated user groups within the Global Supply Chain Operations. You will act as an interface between business stakeholders in Supply Chain and our Digital Data Organization, to both translate business needs to IT requirements as well as create and influence business intelligence solutions to suit the digital data tool roadmap. Furthermore, you will support team priority activities related to new BI platforms and business developments. More specifically, you will





Secure accessible and reliable data across the Supply Chain information areas through data platforms like Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Automate and SAP Analysis for Office (AfO)
Develop and maintain global Power BI reporting and dataflow solutions used across wider user groups in Operations, Finance and Markets & Channels
Partner directly with supply chain colleagues to co-create a clear roadmap based on key business requirements to deliver both new and improved reporting solutions for use in critical business decision making.
Provide data governance across data assets and Power BI reports and give timely support to end-users when requested
Collaborate with Digital BI engineers to bridge the data requirements from colleagues in Operations
Understand tools and trends within the BI area to apply the newest specialist knowledge within Supply Chain




Play your part in our team succeeding

You will join the Supply Chain Business Intelligence team playing a crucial role in the Global Supply Chain Operations (GSCO) department, by enabling the broader Operations organization in driving the integrity and developments of reports and analysis used in LEGO® Operations.

The team is primarily located in LEGO Campus, Billund and consists of 7 highly skilled and dedicated colleagues with great diversity in terms of educational backgrounds, nationalities, age groups, experience levels, etc.

Do you have what it takes?

The ideal candidate comes with 2+ years of proven experience with Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse building data models for reporting purposes. Experience with Supply Chain & Operations and Demand Management will be an advantage. In addition, you have





Minimum BSc in Supply Chain, Business Intelligence, Business Science or equivalent educational fields
Proficiency in Microsoft Power BI including DAX programming and the overall Power Platform
Strong analytical, data management and problem-solving skills with core ability to spot end-to-end perspectives and solutions
Effective and confident communication, collaboration and networking skills to build strong business relationships
Experience with Databricks, SQL and SAP will be an advantage




As a person, you are a true team player contributing and collaborating closely with colleagues, while bringing a strong curiosity and collaborative mindset following a passion about solving user needs and making sure that we all succeed together!

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist, Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company (CISC) - a service provider working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

The role

As our new Business Intelligence Specialist in our CISC Global Business Service team, you’ll join a team of three ambitious professionals. The CISC Finance team is responsible for utilizing BI reports for daily operations (e.g., bank reconciliation, bank balances, weekly PTP invoice status, etc.) and monitoring vendors’ performance (e.g., SLA and KPI reporting). We deliver BI reporting to support the increase due to growth, a call for better transparency and more compliance, and to streamline new requirements from CISC Finance teams.

The Power BI Specialist will be responsible for maintaining and migrating the existing BI solutions while developing new reports for the business to utilize. The role covers the development of solutions at Global, Regional, and Market levels. The Specialist will collaborate with the master data function to fully utilize CISC's new Cost Breakdown Structure.

The primary goal of the role is to provide dedicated BI reporting that will support CISC growth by helping the organization make fact-based decisions and prioritize its focus. The Specialist will also provide insights into key business drivers, build compelling presentations that offer the proper understanding, and nurture a more self-service analytical culture at CISC by providing concise and relevant Power BI dashboards. You can also troubleshoot and resolve SQL and BI issues by showcasing, dialoguing, and onboarding the business with a data mindset.

Responsibilities will further consist of:


Creation of new and maintenance of existing BI solutions
Refinement of new BI tasks in terms of dashboard and data requirements
Training and supervision of business units who wish to develop BI solutions together with the D&A team
Ensuring that the future CISC BI setup is maintainable and scalable across our global offices
Support transitioning BI reports when MS Business Central replaces MS Dynamics Navision.


Main stakeholders


Global Business Service Function
Global Finance
Regional and Market Finance
PMO


You

We are looking for you to have completed your master’s degree and have several years of full-time experience in a similar position. We expect you to have a high level of expertise in Microsoft Business Central.

We expect you to possess a curious and outgoing mindset that allows you to educate yourself about the business and thoroughly understand its needs. This will enable you to develop appropriate and effective solutions tailored to those needs. You are detail-oriented and structured in your approach. You consistently maintain high visual standards and ensure uniformity across new Business Intelligence (BI) products, contributing to a cohesive user experience. With a solid understanding of data structures and modeling, you can design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making.

Moreover, you are a highly responsible and motivated individual who is thriving in a highly effective and innovative environment.

We look for the following in a candidate


Self-igniting and delivery oriented
Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy
Solid experience with Excel and PowerPoint
Comprehensive analytical and problem-solving skills
Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as excellent communication skills
Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment.


The process

Please apply online as soon as possible, as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience and diversity and to avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion

CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.

We are looking for you to have completed your master’s degree and have several years of full-time experience in a similar position. We expect you to have a high level of expertise in Microsoft Business Central.

We expect you to possess a curious and outgoing mindset that allows you to educate yourself about the business and thoroughly understand its needs. This will enable you to develop appropriate and effective solutions tailored to those needs. You are detail-oriented and structured in your approach. You consistently maintain high visual standards and ensure uniformity across new Business Intelligence (BI) products, contributing to a cohesive user experience. With a solid understanding of data structures and modeling, you can design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making.

Moreover, you are a highly responsible and motivated individual who is thriving in a highly effective and innovative environment.

We look for the following in a candidate

  • Self-igniting and delivery oriented
  • Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy
  • Solid experience with Excel and PowerPoint
  • Comprehensive analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as excellent communication skills
  • Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment.

The process

Please apply online as soon as possible, as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience and diversity and to avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion

CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.

Title: Student Analyst for Analytics in Personal Banking (PeB)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID:  26990   

Would you like to work with Business Intelligence to understand the past, present and the future? We are now looking for a Student Analyst to join the PeB Analytics team within PeB Denmark. You will play a key role in developing the bank’s use of BI through Power BI, to ensure that we use facts to take the right decisions and develop the right solutions. The need to use BI is a strategic asset in ways of working  and enabling stakeholders with data-driven actionable actions.  The PeB Analytics team is part of Personal Banking and have a fundamental role in developing the banks understanding of data and analytics from a customer centric point of view to support the full customer journey.

  

About our team     

Working in PeB Analytics you will be in the heart of everything we do in Personal Banking. From strategy projects, to actionable business/customer analysis and to make relevant engagement towards Nordea’s customers. We support key business stakeholders with a data driven approach making their everyday easy to take actions towards creating positive customer experience and business development.

  

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.    

  

What you’ll be doing    

To find pleasure in the job you have a keen eye on the visual experience and are eager to apply business understanding to our Power BI reports.  Main responsibilities in this role:

Develop and maintaining Power BI reports
Support stakeholder in utilizing Power BI
Document solution requirements and data
Enable automized ways of working for stakeholders with clear definitions and actions

  

Who you are    

This is the right role for you if you are self-driven and feel comfortable engaging with stakeholders across the organization. You are good at communications and strive deliver within expected time lines.You have minimum 2-3 years left of a relevant Bachelor's (BSc) / Master's degree (MSc) within IT, economics, finance or a similar technical discipline. 

  

Your background and skills include:

Experience with design and maintaining data reports. Using SQL is a must
Experience with Power BI is a plus, but eager to learn can compensate
Willingness to learn and apply Dax language
Experience working with stakeholders in regards of stakeholder management and expectations
We are a Nordic company but the organization is Danish therefore to be able to speak and write Danish is a plus

  

What we offer    

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.  

 

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.  

 

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.   

 

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.  

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps    

Submit your application no later than 07/01/2025.   

 

For more information, you’re welcome to contact Martin Zinglersen at martin.zinglersen@nordea.com.  

  

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.  

 

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.  

 

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.   

 

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.   

 

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data engineering and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world’s largest jewelry brand?

Our Journey:

We are on a journey from IaaS based Microsoft solutions to Azure PaaS with use of well-known tools and solutions like ADF, Data lake, Synapse, Analysis Services and DataBricks.

As a Data Engineer you will build high quality data and Data & Analytic products on our Azure Paas data platform.

About the Role:

We are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new data engineer you will collaborate with product managers, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation. You will help business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing scalable data products on our global data platform together with other smart engineers in the organization.

Key responsibilities:


Work closely with your colleagues within a product team to design scalable, efficient and stable products
Work closely with product owners to build and deliver features designed to support PANDORA to drive the business cases and efficiencies within reporting and analytics & AI and other data driven use cases
Create and maintain high quality data pipeline architecture
Obtain relevant business and system knowledge to convert requirements efficiently to technical design documentation and conceptual data modelling
Ingest large, complex data sets, automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, improve data quality, etc.
Own your data products and track continuous stability and benefits



About The Team

You will be an essential part of the data engineering organization and Pandora’s extended Data & Analytics community. You will work within the data product engineering team in a virtual and agile based organization.

As we are a growing team, you will have the chance to influence our culture and working tools and work together with other data engineers, Data Visualization Specialists, architects, scrum masters, product managers and much more from Europe, India and Thailand.

Hard requirements:


A minimum of 3 years of proven experience with DataBricks



Experience:


ADF, Data Lake, Synapse, T/U-SQL, and SQL Server.
Experience with at least one object oriented or functional/scripting languages – PySpark, SQL, Python etc.
DevOps and CI/CD focus
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL
Experience with data warehousing and dimensional modelling
Experience in building, and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and datasets
Experience in working with Azure, AWS or other cloud providers
Experience in working with Streaming data processing or C#/JavaScript/Containerization
Relevant education in within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, or Statistics.



Soft Skills Requirements:

We are looking for a team player passionate about data and engineering. You consider yourself as a real team player, product oriented, can-do attitude and with good stakeholder management skills. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, you are a confident communicator and have the ability to explain your solution design and tailor the message according to the audience.

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora:

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

The Data Engineer will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our data infrastructure. The data engineer will work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and ready for analysis. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By


Developing and maintaining our Data Science Platform
Building and maintaining data ingestion pipelines using Python and Airflow to ensure high data quality and timely delivery
Writing and maintaining documentation and make it available to relevant stakeholders
Automating software deployment and monitoring using tools like Ansible and Grafana


Potentially Relevant Experience


A degree in IT, computer science or equivalent experience
Hands on experience with development and operations of software systems in a Linux environment
Strong experience with Python and SQL
Comfort working from command line interfaces and with automation technologies like Ansible
Fluency in spoken and written English
Experience in the field of biology is a plus, but not a requirement


Location: Lyngby, Denmark

Application deadline: 19-01-2025

Contact details: Vignir Isberg, Senior Department Manager, vis@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.
