Title: Bi & Data Analyst til afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Motiveres du af udvikling, store datamængder og analyser, der skaber reel værdi? Vil du arbejde med data fra kildesystemerne helt ud til brugerne? Hvis ja, tilbyder vi dig muligheden for at blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk fællesskab, hvor lysten til udvikling og optimering er essentielt, og hvor vi sammen bygger fremtidens løsninger.




Rollen og hvad du kan forvente

Hos MineTilbud er afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi en central partner for alle forretningsområder, fra marketing, salg og drift til IT-udvikling. Vores fokus er at levere de rette data, på det rette tidspunkt, til de rette modtagere. For at styrke vores forretning med faktabaseret ledelse og databårne beslutninger søger vi en forretningsorienteret BI & Data Analyst, der brænder for at forstå, optimere og visualisere forretningsdata i høj kvalitet. Størstedelen af dit arbejde vil foregå i PowerBI og Excel, hvor du skal udtrække data fra vores underliggende datawarehouse, som ligger i Amazon Web Services, og illustrere det i PowerBI.

Som det første teammedlem i afdelingen udover virksomhedens chef for Økonomi og Strategi vil du arbejde i tæt kontakt med både CEO og det øvrige ledelsesteam. Du får en central rolle med stor kontaktflade, og i takt med områdets udvikling får du mulighed for at præge det fremtidige BI-landskab og forme din rolle i denne udvikling.




Primære arbejdsopgaver

Modellering og effektivisering af data
Implementering af forretningslogik i Power BI
Udledning af forretningsindsigt fra forskellige datakilder
Udarbejdelse af rapporteringsløsninger
Visualisering og formidling af data til brug for forretningsdrift og udvikling
Være en engageret kollega, der bidrager til et stærkt fællesskab




Din baggrund og kvalifikationer

For at være den rette til denne rolle er det en forudsætning, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du i minimum 2 år har arbejdet med Power BI og haft tæt kontakt med interne stakeholders. Du har en relevant uddannelse på BSc- eller MSc-niveau og en stærk kommerciel forståelse.




Som person er du nysgerrig og opsøgende, har gode kommunikationsevner og lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vækst og udvikling er i fokus. Du er selvstændig, detaljeorienteret og har en struktureret og resultatorienteret tilgang til opgaver. Erfaring med Amazon Web Services er en fordel. Da North Media primært er en dansk virksomhed, er det et krav, at du behersker dansk og engelsk flydende, både mundtligt og skriftligt.




Den der kan og vil og gør, får også lov

Du bliver en del af en dynamisk og innovativ virksomhed i rivende udvikling. Vi er en arbejdsplads med dedikerede og dygtige kollegaer og en uformel omgangstone. Med det rette engagement får du stor indflydelse på din hverdag. Vi tilbyder lækker frokost- og frugtordning, mulighed for at tage aftensmad med hjem, kaffe og te ad libitum fra vores café, træningsfaciliteter i eget motionsrum samt diverse sociale arrangementer.




For mere information om rollen og hvorfor det at arbejde hos MineTilbud gør dig til en del af et stærkt, udviklende og inkluderende fællesskab, kan du kontakte Mayse Lind, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, på telefon +45 2154 9818. Vi afholder samtaler løbende og opfordrer interesserede kandidater til at søge snarest muligt.




Om MineTilbud

MineTilbud tilbyder en stærk medieplatform og teknologi, der giver retailers, brands og e-commercere mulighed for at tage del i hele kunderejsen ved at udkomme med relevant indhold på tværs af platforme. MineTilbud er en virksomhed med en skalerbar volumenforretning og et fundament bygget på effektiv håndtering af store mængder materiale og data – hurtigt, sikkert og til en lav enhedspris. Vi står over for spændende forandringer og udviklingsprojekter, hvor vores store datamængder spiller en central rolle i at forstå og styre forretningen. Som BI & Data Analyst får du en unik mulighed for at påvirke virksomhedens fremtid og bidrage til databaserede beslutninger.




MineTilbud er ejet af North Media A/S, hvis selskaber udvikler og driver platforme til transaktioner mellem erhvervslivet og forbrugerne inden for tilbud fra detailhandlen, lejeboliger, jobannoncering og digitale adgangssystemer. North Media A/S er børsnoteret på Nasdaq Copenhagen.

Show more

Hvis ja, tilbyder vi dig muligheden for at blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk fællesskab, hvor lysten til udvikling og optimering er essentielt, og hvor vi sammen bygger fremtidens løsninger.


Rollen og hvad du kan forvente

Hos MineTilbud er afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi en central partner for alle forretningsområder, fra marketing, salg og drift til IT-udvikling. Vores fokus er at levere de rette data, på det rette tidspunkt, til de rette modtagere. For at styrke vores forretning med faktabaseret ledelse og databårne beslutninger søger vi en forretningsorienteret BI & Data Analyst, der brænder for at forstå, optimere og visualisere forretningsdata i høj kvalitet. Størstedelen af dit arbejde vil foregå i PowerBI og Excel, hvor du skal udtrække data fra vores underliggende datawarehouse, som ligger i Amazon Web Services, og illustrere det i PowerBI.

Som det første teammedlem i afdelingen udover virksomhedens chef for Økonomi og Strategi vil du arbejde i tæt kontakt med både CEO og det øvrige ledelsesteam. Du får en central rolle med stor kontaktflade, og i takt med områdets udvikling får du mulighed for at præge det fremtidige BI-landskab og forme din rolle i denne udvikling.


Primære arbejdsopgaver

  • Modellering og effektivisering af data
  • Implementering af forretningslogik i Power BI
  • Udledning af forretningsindsigt fra forskellige datakilder
  • Udarbejdelse af rapporteringsløsninger
  • Visualisering og formidling af data til brug for forretningsdrift og udvikling
  • Være en engageret kollega, der bidrager til et stærkt fællesskab


Din baggrund og kvalifikationer

For at være den rette til denne rolle er det en forudsætning, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du i minimum 2 år har arbejdet med Power BI og haft tæt kontakt med interne stakeholders. Du har en relevant uddannelse på BSc- eller MSc-niveau og en stærk kommerciel forståelse.


Som person er du nysgerrig og opsøgende, har gode kommunikationsevner og lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vækst og udvikling er i fokus. Du er selvstændig, detaljeorienteret og har en struktureret og resultatorienteret tilgang til opgaver. Erfaring med Amazon Web Services er en fordel. Da North Media primært er en dansk virksomhed, er det et krav, at du behersker dansk og engelsk flydende, både mundtligt og skriftligt.


Den der kan og vil og gør, får også lov

Du bliver en del af en dynamisk og innovativ virksomhed i rivende udvikling. Vi er en arbejdsplads med dedikerede og dygtige kollegaer og en uformel omgangstone. Med det rette engagement får du stor indflydelse på din hverdag. Vi tilbyder lækker frokost- og frugtordning, mulighed for at tage aftensmad med hjem, kaffe og te ad libitum fra vores café, træningsfaciliteter i eget motionsrum samt diverse sociale arrangementer.


For mere information om rollen og hvorfor det at arbejde hos MineTilbud gør dig til en del af et stærkt, udviklende og inkluderende fællesskab, kan du kontakte Mayse Lind, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, på telefon +45 2154 9818. Vi afholder samtaler løbende og opfordrer interesserede kandidater til at søge snarest muligt.


Om MineTilbud

MineTilbud tilbyder en stærk medieplatform og teknologi, der giver retailers, brands og e-commercere mulighed for at tage del i hele kunderejsen ved at udkomme med relevant indhold på tværs af platforme. MineTilbud er en virksomhed med en skalerbar volumenforretning og et fundament bygget på effektiv håndtering af store mængder materiale og data – hurtigt, sikkert og til en lav enhedspris. Vi står over for spændende forandringer og udviklingsprojekter, hvor vores store datamængder spiller en central rolle i at forstå og styre forretningen. Som BI & Data Analyst får du en unik mulighed for at påvirke virksomhedens fremtid og bidrage til databaserede beslutninger.


MineTilbud er ejet af North Media A/S, hvis selskaber udvikler og driver platforme til transaktioner mellem erhvervslivet og forbrugerne inden for tilbud fra detailhandlen, lejeboliger, jobannoncering og digitale adgangssystemer. North Media A/S er børsnoteret på Nasdaq Copenhagen.

Title: Senior Data Engineer (Advanced Audience Modelling)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a cutting-edge thinker with a passion for leveraging the latest in strongly typed data pipelines, AI-powered anomaly detection and cloud-first compute systems? Do you want to join an existing, high-output team of academic and professional experts to tackle some of the most complex challenges in advertising? If so, we’d love to meet you.




Our team is embarking on a highly strategic project at the intersection of data science, advertising technology, and audience insights, with a focus on privacy-friendly predictive modelling for audience segmentation and targeting. The system you'll be designing will support 1/3rd of the world's ad campaigns, so the scope is huge, and the success of our team depends on our ability in the near term to demonstrate to key stakeholders the superiority of our system, and then follow up on that promise in the mid-long term.




What You’ll Do:

Collaborate with a high-performing team to explore, design, and implement proprietary models based on contemporary research papers. Your role will have a focus on designing and building out the supporting data pipelines and cloud infrastructure.
Implement AI-powered anomaly detection frameworks to help us discover signal loss of data degradation in our pipelines.
Explore advanced audience segmentation strategies using massive, multi-dimensional data sets spanning behavioural, social, and content engagement patterns.
Leverage your expertise in and experience with well-architected distributed compute systems and integrated ML solutions to accelerate our journey towards a privacy-first future for the ad tech industry.
Work on the full software engineering lifecycle, from first design to initial implementation, to maintenance of stable products everyone relies on.




WhoYou Are:

You have a strong academic background (PhD or Master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Data Science, or a related field).
You’re passionate about solving real-world problems with advanced models and scalable architecture.
Proven experience in at least one strongly typed language such as Scala, Rust, Go or similar
You have a track record of delivering end-to-end software engineering projects and deploying them at scale, with a focus on measurable results.
A strong communicator who thrives in collaborative environments and is eager to learn from and mentor others.
You know how to land on your feet when priorities change. You want to work in a high-throughput environment.




Bonus Points:

If you have experience with multiple programming languages and particularly functional programming languages
If you have contributed to one or more open-source projects




Why Join Us?

Be a key player in shaping the future of privacy-first advertising and audience modelling using cutting-edge AI techniques and highly performant computing systems.
Join an elite team where your research and technical contributions will have a direct impact on strategic outcomes. Work with massive, industry-scale data sets and the latest machine learning techniques.
Growth opportunities; collaborate with leading minds in the field, present your work at major industry conferences, and push the boundaries of applied machine learning.




If you’re ready to innovate and collaborate on high-stakes projects with real-world impact, apply now to join my team and help us redefine the future of audience modelling.

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight Copenhagen




Come work with us!




Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and foster personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as a top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity, and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing across 12 offices in 8 countries, from Europe to North America.




What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight?

In our central Copenhagen office (Amagertorv 29), a collaborative community of around 90 colleagues drives innovation and technology across the IT sector. As a consultant at Netlight, you will play a pivotal role in shaping current and future products, systems, and technical solutions. This entails contributing to the growth and scaling of existing and emerging products and companies, while continuously learning and mastering a variety of technical tools.




As a consultant within the data area, you will help our clients in roles such as Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer, Data Architect to name a few. We build comprehensive data platforms that encompass data warehousing & data lake infrastructure, data modeling, and the implementation of ETL/ELT data pipelines, whether batch or real-time. We design and implement innovative data products, incorporating elements of backend and cloud engineering. We are at the forefront of advising clients around emerging topics such as data governance, AI and data mesh. At Netlight, you define your career path, clients you engage with, your role (based on your strengths, interests, and experience), and your connections with mentors, coaches, EDGE networks, and social circles.




Main responsibilities

Netlight prides itself on technological agnosticism, meaning that we adapt to our clients’ needs while solving intricate challenges. As a consulting force, we lead the technological frontiers and encourage constant growth. You will be challenged by us, our clients, and in turn, you will challenge them. Collaboratively, we foster growth and harness potential.




As a Netlight consultant, you are:

Passionate about leveraging technology for innovation and value creation
Striving to evolve as a valuable collaborator, leader, and tech expert
Committed to understanding clients’ visions and strategies to help them achieve their aspirations




We imagine that you:

Hold or will soon graduate with a master’s degree in Technology, Computer Science, IT, Software Development or related fields
Or hold a bachelor's degree in one of these areas plus two years of full-time working experience in a relevant IT-field
Bring experience as a young professional in software development, data engineering, or related domains
Have professional exposure from internships, part-time/full-time positions, or similar contexts in agile software engineering roles
Verbal and written proficiency in English
Based in Copenhagen or willingness to relocate to Copenhagen




Get in touch

Netlight is always on the lookout for new talents. If our vision resonates with you, we encourage you to submit your application. We will respond within two weeks if your profile aligns with the current requirements.




We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their unique perspectives and skills. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply and are dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all.




We're looking forward to hearing from you!

We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Quantitative analyst
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bliv en del af vores team i Modellering & Innovation, hvor vi udvikler og driver komplekse modeller til præcise forsikringsberegninger og strategisk styring. Vær med til at forme fremtidens forsikringsløsninger.

Vi har bedt din kommende leder om at sætte ord på jobbet og opgaverneVores "kunder" er Aktuariatet, investerings- og finansafdelingerne samt ledelse og direktion. Modellering & Innovation, som er en del af Aktuar & Analyse i Velliv, har et mål om at blive set som en forretningspartner, der med dataindsigt, analytiske kompetencer og forretningsforståelse, bidrager med finansiel viden og understøtter Vellivs væsentlige beslutningsprocesser med fakta og analyser.

Dine primære opgaver bliver:


Videreudvikle og forfine teknisk fundament for hensættelsesmodeller og solvensmodel
Drift af solvens- og hensættelsesmodellerne
Rapportering på baggrund af ovenstående modeller.


Du har forudsætningerne og modet til mere

Der er styrke i forskellighed. Vi bliver bedre af at bringe forskellige erfaringer, fagligheder og personligheder sammen. Derfor opfordrer vi til, at alle uanset baggrund sender en ansøgning. Vi vurderer dog, at der er nogle grundlæggende forudsætninger, som er vigtige for at lykkes i jobbet:


En kandidatgrad i forsikringsmatematik, matematik-økonomi, statistik eller tilsvarende
Ca. 1-3 års erfaring fra en tilsvarende stilling
Solide analytiske egenskaber
Professionelle mundtlige og skriftlige dansk- og engelskkundskaber
Kendskab til C# eller lignende objektorienteret sprog er ikke et krav, men det er en forudsætning at du har en grundlæggende interesse for objektorienteret programmering.


Sådan oplever en af dine nye kolleger afdelingenDu vil blive en del af et team på 5 fagligt dygtige medarbejdere. Vi er en lille afdeling med fokus på godt arbejdsklima og faglige udfordringer. Vi anvender primært C# som værktøj til vores modeller og analyser. Modellerne er lavet i state-of-the-art C# kode, så her vil du have mulighed for at udvikle et højt fagligt niveau. Vi bruger derudover Git og andre moderne værktøjer til vores arbejde. // Martin Rebild, Quantitative analyst

Plads til at være menneske – plads til at være digVelliv er to år i træk blevet kåret til at have branchens bedste medarbejderimage og har gennem flere år vundet prisen som Årets Pensionsselskab. Hos os bliver du mødt med åbne arme, og vi gør os umage for, at du kommer godt fra start og hurtigt falder til.

Du får en buddy, der hjælper dig i gang, og en leder, der bidrager med mening, udvikling og retning. Du har mulighed for at melde dig ind i ”Klub Velliv” og deltage i aktiviteter inden for sport, mad, hobby og kultur for os medarbejdere og vores børn. I det hele taget kan du forvente en kultur, hvor vi lever vores tre kerneværdier: Optimisme, Ordentlighed og Omsorg. I Velliv skal der være plads til at være menneske – plads til at være dig.

Vi holder samtaler løbende

Send dit CV og et par ord om dig selv og din baggrund i en kort ansøgning. Vi vil gerne høre fra dig senest den 26. januar, men vi holder samtaler løbende, så send gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, kan du kontakte Johannes Müller på telefon +45 25277479 eller johannes.m@velliv.dk.

Vil du lære Velliv bedre at kende? Læs mere her
Show more

Title: Data Analyst – up to £90k – Investment Management firm
Description:
Are you interested in building dashboards to allow an Investment Manager to interpret and analyse their ESG data?




You will be working directly with the senior stakeholders in the firm to understand what insights they are looking to gain, then build reports and dashboards using SQL and PowerBI.




Alongside this, you’ll spend the other half of your time analysing the ESG data and markets, looking for ways you can influence and impact the firm’s performance.




This is a relatively junior role, so while you may have some experience with PowerBI, Tableau or SSRS, this is an opportunity to develop those skills further and progress into a Senior position over the next few years.




The Investment Manager has roughly $110 billion AUM and has been identified as one of the fastest growing globally over the last year – which will provide even more opportunities for progression within the role.




No up-to-date CV required.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k-£45k (DOE)




Are you a data enthusiast looking to make an impact across multiple industries? Join a leading data consultancy in London that partners with clients in finance, retail, and healthcare to deliver data-driven solutions that transform their business operations.




My client is seeking a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills and a passion for leveraging data to solve complex problems. In this role, you'll work with a diverse portfolio of clients, using data insights to drive meaningful business improvements.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets: Extract, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends and insights that inform key business strategies across finance, retail, and healthcare sectors.
Support decision-making: Use statistical methods and predictive models to assist clients in making data-driven decisions that improve their performance and efficiency.
Create data visualisations: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports to clearly communicate data insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with clients and internal teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, consultants, and client representatives, to ensure that data projects align with client goals.
Identify opportunities: Continuously explore ways to optimise processes, identify business opportunities, and deliver actionable recommendations to clients.




You Will Need:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field: Preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Experience with data analysis tools: Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis, manipulation, and reporting.
Data visualisation skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to present complex data in a user-friendly format.
Strong analytical mindset: Ability to understand and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear and actionable conclusions for clients.
Excellent communication skills: Capable of conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Industry experience: Prior experience working with clients in finance, retail, or healthcare, and familiarity with sector-specific data challenges.
Exposure to advanced analytics: Knowledge of machine learning techniques, predictive modeling, or advanced statistical analysis.
Problem-solving approach: A proactive, solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to think critically and creatively.




The Benefits:

Diverse projects: Gain experience working with clients across multiple industries, ensuring no two days are the same.
Learning and development: Access to training and mentorship to support your growth and help you stay at the forefront of data trends.
Collaborative work environment: Join a dynamic and supportive team of data experts, all working towards delivering exceptional results for clients.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your experience and expertise, along with performance-based incentives.




If you’re a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Show more
HTML:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k-£45k (DOE)


Are you a data enthusiast looking to make an impact across multiple industries? Join a leading data consultancy in London that partners with clients in finance, retail, and healthcare to deliver data-driven solutions that transform their business operations.


My client is seeking a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills and a passion for leveraging data to solve complex problems. In this role, you'll work with a diverse portfolio of clients, using data insights to drive meaningful business improvements.


Your Responsibilities:

  • Analyse large datasets: Extract, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends and insights that inform key business strategies across finance, retail, and healthcare sectors.
  • Support decision-making: Use statistical methods and predictive models to assist clients in making data-driven decisions that improve their performance and efficiency.
  • Create data visualisations: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports to clearly communicate data insights to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with clients and internal teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, consultants, and client representatives, to ensure that data projects align with client goals.
  • Identify opportunities: Continuously explore ways to optimise processes, identify business opportunities, and deliver actionable recommendations to clients.


You Will Need:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field: Preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
  • Experience with data analysis tools: Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis, manipulation, and reporting.
  • Data visualisation skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to present complex data in a user-friendly format.
  • Strong analytical mindset: Ability to understand and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear and actionable conclusions for clients.
  • Excellent communication skills: Capable of conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.


It's A Bonus If You Have:

  • Industry experience: Prior experience working with clients in finance, retail, or healthcare, and familiarity with sector-specific data challenges.
  • Exposure to advanced analytics: Knowledge of machine learning techniques, predictive modeling, or advanced statistical analysis.
  • Problem-solving approach: A proactive, solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to think critically and creatively.


The Benefits:

  • Diverse projects: Gain experience working with clients across multiple industries, ensuring no two days are the same.
  • Learning and development: Access to training and mentorship to support your growth and help you stay at the forefront of data trends.
  • Collaborative work environment: Join a dynamic and supportive team of data experts, all working towards delivering exceptional results for clients.
  • Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your experience and expertise, along with performance-based incentives.


If you’re a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Title: Data Analyst (SQL)
Description:
Are you ready to write your next chapter?

Make your mark at one of the biggest names in payments. With proven technology, we process the largest volume of payments in the world, driving the global economy every day. When you join Worldpay, you join a global community of experts and changemakers, working to reinvent an industry by constantly evolving how we work and making the way millions of people pay easier, every day.

We’re looking for a Receptionist and Back Office Support to join our team to help us unleash the potential of every business.

Are you ready to make your mark? Then you sound like a Worldpayer.

About The Team

We are the Data Analytics and Insights team for Global Revenue Operations. Our vision is to be the centre of excellence for Analytics, Insights, Functional Reporting and Internal Controls. Supporting the Organisation to drive best in class customer experience and revenue protection initiatives. We use Innovation and complex data techniques creating visual and insightful analytics, to be able to deliver on our vision. All whilst retaining and attracting a high performing and multi-talented team. We are pivotal to the success of the Global Revenue Operations team.

What You’ll Own

As a member of the Data Analytics and Insights team you be responsible for day to day monitoring of billing platforms and collections performance.

You will be supported and guided in designing data led controls and monitoring tools using data analytics in SQL, Tableau to improve the performance of end to end collections processes.

Working closely with the wider Global Revenue Operations team, you will complete route cause analysis, investigations and gather requirements to help resolve technical, business and operational issues. You will support the business by completing client requests for data and reporting, as well as using data to problem solve.

Support the Analytics function in designing processes to support monitoring and enhancement of all collections related processes.

Work on analytics activities to support the reporting requirements for the Global Revenue Operations footprint considering the complexities of any local data regulations.

Manage and build relationships with other functions and stakeholders (e.g. Accounting, Systems, Product, Finance and the Business) to drive forward analytics projects proactively.

Create and design new value adding analytical processes that drive billing and collections efficiencies and capture of issues.

Where you’ll own it

You’ll own it in our Manchester sites are hubs of activity, conversation, and openness. With inspiring, stylish workspaces we want people to feel excited to come and do their best work.

What You Bring

The successful candidate will have data analysis experience, strong communication skills and the ability to communicate and influence across the organisation. They will be highly driven and focused on delivering quality outputs under tight timescales, and have proven experience of delivery across cross-functional teams. The candidate will also have intermediate to advanced level MS Excel skills as well as intermediate to advanced level SQL skills.

Tableau experience is also beneficial but not essential. Ideally the successful candidate will have worked in a large organisation previously, specifically in a financial orientated department.

Behaviors Overviews

Accountable – You never stand still, never settle. You work at pace to achieve your goals.

Dynamic - You champion your ideas and stay flexible to make them happen. You know that every action adds up.

Determined - You stay open – winning, and failing, as one. Always looking for solutions that add value.

Open - You work across borders, working with your team to achieve your collective goals.

Worldpay Perks - What We’ll Bring For You

We know it’s bigger than just your career. It’s your life, and your world. That’s why we offer global benefits and programs to support you at every stage. Here’s a taste of what you can expect.


A competitive salary and benefits.
Time to support charities and give back to your community.
Global recognition platform.
Global employee assistance program.


What Makes a Worldpayer

At Worldpay, we take our Values seriously, and we live them every day. Think like a customer, Act like an owner, and Win as a team.


Curious. Humble. Creative. We ask the right questions, listening and learning to get better every day. We simplify the complex and we’re always looking to create a bigger impact for our colleagues and customers.
Empowered. Accountable. Dynamic. We stay agile, using our initiative, taking calculated risks to progress. Never standing still, never settling, we work at pace to achieve our goals. We champion our ideas and stay flexible to make them happen. We know that every action adds up.
Determined. Inclusive. Open. Unlocking potential means working as one global community. Our work spans borders, and we stay united by our purpose. We collaborate, always encouraging others to perform at their best, welcoming new perspectives.


Does this sound like you? Then you sound like a Worldpayer.

Apply now to write the next chapter in your career. We can’t wait to hear from you.

Privacy Statement

Worldpay is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how Worldpay protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at Worldpay works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. Worldpay does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

#pridepass

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Data Analyst



Salary: £450 - 550 / day



Location: London Hybrid or Remote



We are currently looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our fast-paced and innovative team within a globally recognised retail company. Reporting directly to the Data Governance Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing the organisation's data framework. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to critical areas such as data modeling, data quality, governance, and management, while supporting the onboarding of products onto Microsoft Purview 2.0.

As a Business Data Analyst, you'll be key in ensuring that business processes are mapped effectively and stakeholders are well-managed. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys working at the intersection of data and business strategy.






The Opportunity



In this role, you will:

Execute the business data framework focusing on data quality, governance, and management.
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure seamless onboarding of products onto Microsoft Purview 2.0.
Interpret and understand complex data schemas, with an emphasis on snowflake schemas.
Support business process mapping at levels four and five, ensuring alignment with organisational goals.
Engage with cross-functional teams to drive data initiatives and foster a data-driven culture.

What sets this opportunity apart is the chance to work with cutting-edge tools like Microsoft Purview 2.0 while contributing to a global retailer's data strategy. This role doesn't require you to build data models from scratch, allowing you to focus on delivering high-impact business outcomes.



What's in it for you?


Competitive rate.
Flexible working model..
Opportunities for learning and development within a global organisation.
Work in an inclusive, supportive environment that values innovation and collaboration.


Skills and Experience



Must-Haves:

Solid understanding of data governance, data management, and data quality principles.
Ability to interpret and work with data schemas, particularly snowflake schemas.
Experience with data governance tools, ideally Microsoft Purview 2.0.
Proven ability to conduct business process mapping at levels four and five.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively.

Nice-to-Haves:

Familiarity with retail industry data processes.
Experience in a global or matrixed organisation.
Certification in data governance or management frameworks.

If you would like to be considered for the Business Data Analyst role and feel you'd be an ideal fit with our team, please send your CV by clicking the Apply button today.

Take the next step in your career and join a team that's redefining data excellence in retail!


Desired Skills and Experience

Process Mapping|Data Governance

Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
London, UK

Octopus Energy UK 🇬🇧 – Data /

Full-time /

Hybrid



At Octopus, our mission is to decarbonise the energy system as quickly as possible. Households are critical in driving the next phase of decarbonisation, through the way we travel and heat our homes.

The Low Carbon Tech (LCT) team sits inside the Octopus Energy group, where its sole purpose is to drive the uptake of technologies combatting the effects of climate change - including Heat Pumps, Solar panels and EV chargers. The team focuses on the end-to-end customer journey of purchasing, installing and monitoring the technologies.

What does it mean to be part of the LCT data team?

The Octopus data team builds tools, pipelines, analysis and machine learning products across the business - we are organised so that each team or ‘pod’ is embedded within and focused upon a specific domain - the LCT data team is dedicated to the Low Carbon Tech business. The data team work closely with other pods to maintain the different tools we build - it’s a collaborative environment and we encourage everyone in the team

A little heads-up: With some of our team taking some well-deserved annual leave over the next couple of weeks, we may not get around to carefully reviewing all applications until the new year. Every application gets reviewed by a real human, and we’ll be in touch to let you know either way—whether it’s a yes or, sadly, a no this time round. Thanks for your patience and understanding!

What You'll Do...


Work closely with LCT leadership team, empowering them to make data-driven decision to accelerate the uptake of low carbon technologies
Embed the use of data within the organisation across all levels - making dashboards impactful, engaging and accessible
Improve the efficiency of the LCT organisation - analysing the factors influencing the utilisation of engineers and conversion of sales
Communicate findings and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders



What You'll Need...


Ideally 4+ years of professional experience
Adept at problem solving and communicating answers to business partners
Managed relationships with senior stakeholders and management
Passionate about working in energy and contributing to the energy transition
Curious and self-driven - when faced with a new problem is capable of seeking out an answer without lots of help and support
Highly data literate and numerate - can make sense of lots of data and shape it into a coherent story
Has great attention to detail
Communicates complex ideas clearly



Experience with some of the below technologies:


A scripting language (ideally Python with pandas)
Wrangling data outside of a spreadsheet environment
Writing performant queries in SQL / dbt
Building reports and dashboards in a BI tool (ideally Tableau or Streamlit)
Is passionate about building robust and useable tools



You must...


Be comfortable working with some ambiguity: The LCT team is busy scaling and as such specific responsibilities, projects and focus will evolve over time
Be curious and self driven - it’s essential you have the initiative to make decisions yourself, and can find solutions to novel problems without lots of help and support
Be highly data literate and numerate - can make sense of lots of data and shape it into a coherent structure
Be a problem solver - you’ll need to be able to listen and understand the problems and requirements of the business and come up with pragmatic data solutions



If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.

Are you ready for a career with us? We want to ensure you have all the tools and environment you need to unleash your potential. Need any specific accommodations? Whether you require specific accommodations or have a unique preference, let us know, and we'll do what we can to customise your interview process for comfort and maximum magic!

Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme   

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject
Experience in analysing data
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.



Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Grayce specialises in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations. For over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Our Accelerated Development Programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles such as Data Analysis, InfoSec, Software Testing and DevOps.

Join Grayce and accelerate your career!

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: You will work with one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure, before transitioning to working directly for them. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing
Show more

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented professional with a passion for uncovering insights through data? We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and make a real impact!

In this role, you’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to analyse complex datasets, identify trends, and deliver actionable insights that drive business decisions. Your contributions will directly influence strategy and growth, giving you the chance to showcase your analytical and problem-solving skills.




What’s in it for you?

Innovative Projects: Work on cutting-edge data initiatives that challenge and inspire.
Professional Growth: Access to training, certifications, and mentorship to develop your expertise.
Supportive Environment: Join a collaborative team where your ideas are valued.
Attractive Package: Competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities for advancement.




What We’re Looking For:

Proficiency in tools like SQL, Python, or Excel.
Experience with data visualisation platforms like Tableau or Power BI.
A sharp eye for detail and the ability to interpret and present complex data.
Enthusiasm for solving problems and working with diverse datasets.




If you’re ready to take your analytical career to the next level, this is the perfect opportunity to do so. Let’s transform data into actionable intelligence—together!




Apply now and shape the future of our data-driven journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Location: UK (Flexible/Remote Options Available)




Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights that drive business decisions? Join a dynamic and forward-thinking organisation where you’ll collaborate with talented teams and make a real impact in the world of customer experience.




We’re hiring a Data Analyst to be part of our Data and Applications team. This role will involve working with diverse datasets to uncover insights, help solve complex problems, and enable data-driven decision-making.




About Us

Our client is an international leader in providing customer experience solutions and digital transformation services to global brands. Operating across multiple countries, they are dedicated to leveraging cutting-edge technologies like GenAI and advanced data analytics to help companies create meaningful customer connections.




With over 6,000 employees globally and a proven track record of growth, this is your opportunity to join a supportive, collaborative team committed to innovation and professional development.




Key Responsibilities:




Collaborate with stakeholders to define business requirements and deliver insights.
Serve as a trusted advisor, offering data-driven recommendations to customers.
Analyze and extract valuable data to support strategic decision-making.
Visualize complex datasets using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik to communicate insights effectively.
Support data engineers in maintaining data pipelines and ensuring data quality.
Present findings to stakeholders and document processes for repeatability.




Essential Skills and Experience:




Proficiency in at least one data visualisation tool (Tableau preferred).
Experience with statistical packages (Excel, SPSS, SAS).
Solid knowledge of Python or R for data analysis.
Advanced SQL querying and experience with relational databases.
Strong numerical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent experience.
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.




Desirable Skills:




Familiarity with cloud technologies and agile project methodologies.
Proficiency in additional programming languages.




Why Join Us?




Competitive salary and benefits package, including a pension plan.
27 days of holiday, plus your birthday off and extra days for Christmas shutdown.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Flexible working arrangements.
A friendly, inclusive, and collaborative work environment.
Regular social events and free on-site parking.




How to Apply




If you’re a motivated individual passionate about leveraging data to drive business value, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and take the next step in your career!




Our client is committed to fostering equality, diversity, and inclusion. They encourage applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of background.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




Covering more trades than anyone else, Aspect is one of London’s largest property maintenance teams. We’re always ready to help, no matter what maintenance issue someone has, operating 24/7. After over 15 years of helping thousands of residential and commercial customers every month, we have ambitious plans to expand our business over the next 3 years. We’re looking for ambitious people to join us at this exciting time.




The Role




The Data Analyst will play a key role in supporting our business through data-driven insights and solutions. You’ll be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from multiple sources to help drive decision-making across various departments.

You will:




Use tools like SQL, Python, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and Salesforce to gather and analyze data.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs), operational efficiency, and customer trends.
Collaborate with teams across the business to identify areas for improvement, optimize processes, and support business growth.
Conduct detailed data analysis, including data mining, trend analysis, and predictive analytics to inform business decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all systems, implementing data quality checks and working with different departments to maintain consistent and accurate data inputs.
Provide actionable insights through visualizations and presentations, making complex data understandable for non-technical stakeholders.




This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a strong analytical background and experience in leveraging data tools to support strategic decision-making in a fast-paced environment.




About You




To excel in this role, you should have strong technical skills, a passion for data, and the ability to turn numbers into actionable business insights. Key qualifications include:

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation of tasks.
Strong skills in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau to create dynamic, interactive reports.
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM or similar platforms to analyze customer and sales data.
Advanced Excel skills for data modeling, forecasting, and reporting.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and a strong understanding of data governance principles.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Knowledge of the property maintenance or service industry is a plus but not required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

TEKsystems Global Services is a growing Professional Services company. We provide bespoke IT solutions across a spectrum of services to a range of market leading global clients. Our business strategy focuses on continually developing our service offering and providing the commercial support needed for this growth, this role is focused on our EMEA region. This specific role sits within our Commercial and Financial Operations department and has the opportunity to progress becoming a Commercial Business Partner role or Project Analyst role.




This is a unique opportunity with a mixture of Commercial and Finance, focusing on data, analytics and process improvements whilst playing a crucial role in driving business results. As part of this team, you’ll utilize our financial, sales and operations technology/systems to cleanse, review, analyze and ultimately transform data into insight. This role offers the opportunity to obtain an in-depth view of performance and business processes whilst providing recommendations for improvements with a “Right First Time” mindset.




This role would suit an individual seeking to be in an analytical role and is passionate about automating manual processes, in what is a fast-paced and dynamic services business. We are a people-focused organisation that takes pride in the inclusive and innovative culture that we have created.We recognise the importance of our people and invest in the training and development to offer continuous opportunity to those who earn the right.




Core Skills, Role and Responsibilities

Developing an in-depth understanding of our business operates, internal systems and data sources to provide data insight
Develop an understanding of IFRS (International Financial Reporting Standards) to aid in the manipulation and presenting of financial data
Develop strong partnerships with Sales, Commercial, Operations and Finance to improve current and future business decisions
Gather, monitor, audit and analyse sales, finance and operations data to provide insight and drive business improvements and track KPI’s
Monitor and audit data quality, building in automated checks where necessary
Analysing trends and variances in data to drive data accuracy
Increase productivity by implementing and maintaining automated data processes.
Supporting in management reporting on financial budgeting, month end revenue and profitability analysis on the EMEA Region
Management reporting on sales performance and reward tracking
Supporting strategic priorities and transformational projects sponsored by the Senior Leadership team
Driving excellence through process improvements
Development of business cases for strategic decision making



















Knowledge and skills:

BSc/BA degree or similar further education (ideally in a Business or Finance related subject)
1-3 years post graduate experience in business finance or similar
Superior communication skills, written and oral, and ability to build relationships quickly
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail – “Right First Time”
Excellent Time Management, organisation skills and adaptable to change
Experience providing high standards of service to stakeholders
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office tools – Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access
Experience and/ or knowledge of SQL and Tableau/Power BI (Desired)
Experience of gathering requirements and delivering insights/reporting as agreed (Desired)
Comprehensible understanding of financial, sales and operational metrics (Desired)
Good basic financial acumen (P&L, cashflow, balance sheet) and understanding of financial modelling, contract pricing and differing pricing models. (Desired)




Behaviours

Ability to scrutinise potential challenges and provide options to deliver the desired result - Solutions-orientated approach
Building relationships and communicating with a wide range of business stakeholders
Takes initiative and responsibility to address what is required to achieve goals
High level of self-motivation and drive for self-improvement (including new skills and tools) with commitment to high quality delivery
Persistent in the face of significant challenges, with a readiness to tackle difficult tasks and devise innovative solutions.
Comfortable in assessment of risks in an ambiguous environment
Organised and able to manage time effectively
Flexible and able to execute multiple initiatives concurrently with the ability to re-prioritize as needed
Open to challenging current ways of working
Fair, open and honest demeanour
Managing upwards
Conflict resolution between stakeholders
Public speaking or presenting experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My leading Financial Services client are looking for a Data Analyst to join their CLM and KYC team, within their Data & MI space. You'll be responsible for the production and maintenance of the Data & MI function, including uploading and oversight to the internal reporting repository.




This is a newly created role within a hugely growing area of the organisation. They are a supportive and high performing team, a brilliant opportunity!




The following skills / experience is required:

Analyst background
Good experience on Pivot tables, VLookups, etc
Power BI, SQL, Python is desirable
Previously worked in Financial Services or similar industry is desirable
Excellent communication skills




Salary: Up to £50,000 + bonus + package

Grade: Associate

Location: London (good work from home options available)




If you are interested and meet the above requirements please apply immediately.

Title: Data Analyst, UK
Description:
Healthcare is usually slow and boring. We believe in its potential to be exciting and entertaining. But changing the healthcare experience is hard – and we’re gonna need all the help we can get…!

About Eucalyptus

Eucalyptus (or 'Euc' for short) is an Australian founded digital healthcare company that is on a mission to solve the world’s biggest healthcare challenges - think fertility, and behavioural change around chronic conditions such as weight loss, diabetes, and mental health.

What We Have Achieved So Far

🚀 Launched 5 demographically tailored brands and facilitated over 1 million medical consultations worldwide (Juniper, Pilot, Kin, Software, & Compound).

🌍 Built a team of approaching 500 Eucalypts in 6 countries (🇦🇺🇬🇧🇩🇪🇯🇵🇵🇭🇿🇦) consisting of medical practitioners, engineers, operators and many more functions!

💰 Raised over US$100M funding from the same investors who backed Canva, Uber, and AirBnB.

🇬🇧 In just over 2 years we have grown the Juniper UK brand, which is now our biggest brand globally!

… and we’re just getting started! Read more about our mission to change healthcare here.

What’s Next?

In the UK we are continuing to grow with ambitions to triple our business by the end of the year!

To achieve this, we are continuously building our team of dedicated professionals who are passionate about healthcare, willing to work hard, and committed to investing in others through direct and honest feedback. This collaborative and proactive approach enables us to make impactful changes, improving the health of millions of patients globally.

About The Role (What You’ll Be Doing)


Improve our day to day toolbox of reporting/dashboards establishing a single source of truth for metrics that matter, and equipping teams with the ability to self serve where possible
Work with our leads to deliver data analysis across our funnel & patient experience, to help them make key decisions about our product & business model
Incrementing on our global data model with a strong focus on UK use cases. You will work closely with our central analytics function in AU to ensure that any modelling is standardised and transferrable to our other brands and other markets
Work with our product team to monitor the performance of new features



About You (Who You Are)


3-4 years of data analyst experience - ideally where you created & managed various dashboards in a consumer start-up
Proficient in SQL, dashboard tools, Excel/Google Sheets, and Python - you can easily navigate data structures & write queries with no oversight (Metabase & Tableau experience are a bonus)
Data modelling & ETL pooling experience - have experience loading and transforming new data sources into table formats that can be easily queried to create high value metrics that align with business outcomes
Ambiguity & a fast-paced environment excites you - your curiosity drives you to ask ‘why?’ to get to the next level of understanding; and you can work at speed
You see more than the data - you have strong business / commercial acumen, and get to the ‘so what’ based on the analysis you do. You help shape the right analysis for the decision at hand
Attention to detail - you have a high bar for ‘correct’, and work through nuances in the data to surface when an insight can be relied on and when it can’t



So, why join Eucalyptus?


Make real impact, fast - We build in the open together, which helps us learn and iterate more quickly so we can deliver high quality outcomes faster than anyone else. Helping impact patients lives for the better from the moment you join Euc.
You’ll be supported to accelerate your career - Regular feedback alongside our bi-annual performance reviews, a professional development budget & leave help ensure you have the support you need to level up. We’re committed to helping every Eucalypt reach their full potential.
You’ll work with others who are incredibly passionate about what they do - Our talent bar is high and our work ethic is strong. You’ll get to stretch yourself everyday, be given autonomy to tackle interesting problems, and work amongst people who care deeply about our patients.
We also offer a range of benefits including
Your own stake in the business with our employee options program
A monthly wellness allowance, for you to spend on whatever wellness means to you
A yearly personal development budget and 3 extra days of leave to continuously up-skill yourself
25 days holiday + bank holidays with an enhanced parental leave policy
A fun office with regular socials including after school sport, clubs, cycle kick offs and seasonal parties
Your own MacBook and more!
Want to hear more about what it’s like to work at Eucalyptus? Hear from our team here or check us out on Instagram @euc.alypt.us


At Eucalyptus, we value individuals from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives, and we embrace the unique qualities each person brings. When you apply, please let us know of any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

    • 25 days holiday + bank holidays with an enhanced parental leave policy
    • A fun office with regular socials including after school sport, clubs, cycle kick offs and seasonal parties
    • Your own MacBook and more!
  • Want to hear more about what it’s like to work at Eucalyptus? Hear from our team here or check us out on Instagram @euc.alypt.us

At Eucalyptus, we value individuals from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives, and we embrace the unique qualities each person brings. When you apply, please let us know of any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Up to £60,000 - Financial Services




Salary: Paying Up to £60,000




Working Arrangements: Hybrid, 3 days in Central London Office




Must have suitable Right To Work, No Sponsorship




The Company




An industry leading FinTech company are looking for a Data Analyst to join a small product analytics division within the company. This is a fast paced environment providing high level impact for their customers.




The Role




Highly proficient with SQL (4+ years) & BI (ideally Looker), Python is helpful




You will be working closely with the VP of Product and Lead Data Analyst




Must have previous experience building models and dashboards




Previous Financial experience is very useful




Product analytics or strategic data backgrounds is preferred




Valued Technical Skills




SQL
BI (Looker)
Python




Please apply now if interest, moving quickly!

Please apply now if interest, moving quickly!


Data Analyst - Up to £60,000 - Financial Services

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🧢Role | Data Analyst

🏢Sector | Retrofit Architects

🎯Responsibilities | Drive meaningful decision-making through the power of data. You'll develop visualisations, dashboards, and reports while collaborating closely with multidisciplinary teams to enhance data quality, accessibility, and analysis.

⭐Purpose | Your expertise will directly contribute to decarbonising schools.

📍Based | London Waterloo / hybrid.

⌚Full-time | 40 hours per week (9am-6pm)

💰Salary | up to £40,000




Our client, an architect-led company addressing the climate emergency through school decarbonisation and knowledge-building, is looking for a Data Analyst to support their mission of decarbonising schools. In this role, you'll use your expertise to help architect and non-architect teams understand, interpret, and improve their data for multiple, critical projects.




To excel in this role, you will:




Use tools such as SQL, R, or Python to manipulate, clean, and model data.
Build and deliver interactive dashboards, impactful visualisations, and reports tailored to users’ needs.
Apply innovative analytical techniques to create actionable insights.
Collaborate with architect and non-architect teams to plan better use of data and support improved decision-making.
Combine quantitative and qualitative data to deliver rich user insights and support strategic development.
Apply modern analytical techniques to interpret complex data sets, uncover actionable insights, and support strategic development.
Collaborate across teams to plan data roadmaps, improve data quality, and support innovation projects.
Take a proactive, hands-on approach to resolving data issues and addressing internal data-driven needs, you must be comfortable with both operational and strategic tasks.




Skills You Bring:

A track record of using statistical data analysis frameworks and techniques on large data sets (expertise with projects related to the built environment a bonus), including cleaning and filtering data.
Strong mathematical and statistical skills for analysing messy, complex data.
Creative problem-solving and an ability to think strategically about data patterns and their implications.
Exceptional communication skills to translate technical insights into practical recommendations.




Experience

Experience in building data roadmaps, dashboards, and algorithms to inform decisions.
Proven experience interpreting data and delivering clear, actionable insights to stakeholders.
Track record of working collaboratively in cross-functional teams and building positive relationships with stakeholders.
Strong communication skills to present findings and recommendations effectively.




The team values innovation, collaboration, and a can-do attitude. If you're passionate about using data to create meaningful impact and enjoy working in a dynamic environment, we'd love to hear from you.




This role may require enhanced DBS checks.

Title: Data Analyst - Subscriptions
Description:
Data Analyst / Subscriptions / PowerBI / Analytics /




Location: Central London




Salary: Circa £50,000 - £70,000 + Package




Permanent




Currently recruiting for a growing digital client who are looking to hire a data analyst with strong subscriptions / audience experience along with expertise within PowerBI and analytics.




Broad responsibility role in a fast paced, innovative environment.




Will be comfortable engaging with various stakeholders and teams to provide reporting and ad-hoc analysis and insights within existing data warehouse and various data sources. These insights will provide a lot of value in driving forward the subscriptions arm of the business.




Experience within PowerBI development and visualisation including DAX and M is also key.




Please apply for more information on the client and full JD.




Responsibilities / Skills




Utilise data / insight analysis to support subscription growth
Create and define data models for automated reporting
Work on segmentations
Create new and enhance existing Power BI Reports
Determine and ensure correct data and analytics flows
Engage with audience and product stakeholders to collect and understand data and insight requirements.
Experience within data/audience analytics and Power BI development.
Strong experience with Adobe Analytics, GA, similar.
Strong Experience with marketing and targeting data from Social Media Platforms
Strong experience in Power BI development & visualizations including DAX and M as well as connecting to SQL and non-SQL data sources.
Strong experience in creating data models in Power BI and Power BI Service.
High level of attention to details and thoroughness.
Experienced in SQL to perform data quality assessments and ad hoc analysis.
Good understanding of data migration/ETL processes, data management, and relational data models.
Confident, motivated, proactive, focussed on business objectives and a strong communicator.
Ability to think data end-to-end.
Degree educated within numerical, science, computer science (desirable)

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🏷️Title: Junior Data Analyst

👫Department: RevOPs

📍Location: UK or Europe, Remote

About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences. Our diverse team drives innovation, using deep industry expertise and an extensive network to empower the next wave of blockchain-driven companies. At Block Labs, we’re passionate about turning bold ideas into breakthrough success.

We’re looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our growing team!

About The Role

We are looking for a detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to support our team by creating impactful reports, automating data workflows, and providing key insights to drive decision-making. This role is ideal for someone passionate about data and eager to grow their analytical skills.

Key Responsibilities


Build and deliver daily reports for stakeholders.
Proactively search for automation in reporting processes to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Calculating, and validating product metrics to measure the success of new features
Present findings and insights to support strategic decisions.
Manage and optimise data collection processes.


About You


Strong communication and presentation skills with a data-driven mindset.
Experience with stakeholder management and reporting
Proficient in SQL for basic data queries.
Familiarity with crypto metrics and data analysis tools like Excel or Tableau.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are working with a leading Cross-border Payment business who are currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their Product & Technology team. You will work closely with the product and tech teams to build dashboards, understand business data needs, and support rollout as the company continues to grow.




This is the first Data Analyst hire for them so there is a lot of scope for personal development and growth within the business as well as establishing a strong data function in a rapidly scaling Fintech.




Responsibilities:

Provide regular reporting to the Product and Technology Director as required
Work with Product and Tech teams to understand data needs and provide data-driven insights
Build dashboards and reports to track business metrics and KPIs
Support rollout of new products and features
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, and support and host discussions within a multidisciplinary team
Be an advocate for data in the business, share knowledge and support the wider business with adopting data-led decision making
Ensure data management and governance processes are in place and adhered to for the products and services your teams provide, and define strategies to enable continual improvement of data management practices and compliance with data governance policies.
Build and review complex data models, ensuring adherence to standards.
Utilise data integration tools and languages to integrate and store data, and advise teams on best practice.




Competencies & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, computer science)
4 years of experience as a data analyst
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with SQL, Excel, and/or Python
Experience with AWS data related solutions including: Redshift, Glue, Athena, Aurora




2 days WFH/3 days in the office - Central London Office

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Varicent ICM Platform Experience required




Opportunity for a Data Analyst / Administrator to join a standout educational Institute in Manchester, Leeds or Birmingham
Salary up to 40,000 + fantastic benefits including our Inclusive working culture, Career Development Courses, Bonuses and more
Apply online or contact Chelsea Hackett via Chelsea.hackett@searchability.com







WHO WE ARE:




We are a rapidly growing organisation dedicated to providing high-quality education and equipping individuals with practical skills and knowledge to succeed in their careers. Offering a variety of academic and professional programs, we strive to help learners build the confidence and expertise needed to achieve their goals.




Known for our supportive and inclusive environment, we place a strong emphasis on personalised development and real-world learning experiences. With multiple locations and a diverse community, we are committed to fostering innovation, collaboration, and growth for both our learners and our team.







OUR BENEFITS:




Competitive Salary
Professional Development Opportunities
Diverse and Inclusive Environment
Health and Wellbeing Initiatives
Additional Holidays
Performance Bonuses
And more..







WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?




We are seeking a detail-oriented professional to manage and maintain our incentive management system, ensuring it is effectively configured to support business needs and deliver accurate outcomes. The role involves overseeing system functionality, addressing data integration, troubleshooting issues, and generating insightful reports. Ideal candidates will have experience with compensation processes and a strong technical aptitude for managing complex systems. If you're skilled in problem-solving and system optimisation, we encourage you to apply.







DATA ANALYST / ADMINISTRATOR – ESSTENTIAL SKILLS




Experience managing Varicent or similar Incentive Compensation Management (ICM) platforms.
Strong understanding of incentive compensation processes and best practices.
Proficiency in data integration, ETL processes, and SQL scripting.
Expertise in configuring and maintaining Varicent or equivalent platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.







TO BE CONSIDERED…

Please either apply by clicking online or emailing me directly chelsea.hackett@searchability.com. By applying to this role you give express consent for us to process and submit (subject to required skills) your application to our client in conjunction with this vacancy only.
